Job Description:
PURPOSE AND KEY RESULTS OF THE POSITION
Under the direction of the VP of Sales and Marketing, the Market Analyst is responsible for becoming an industry product expert, researching and defining opportunities for Tuff Boy Companies. Researching products and services of major competitors, industry needs, current market share and other industry drivers. They will spend their time researching market statistics as they relate to product development, saturation, market share and future opportunities. They will spend time with customers and potential customers, and approximately half of their time at the primary office. As a result of his/her efforts, Tuff Boy will develop products and strategies to grow its sales revenues and establish the brand as a successful product line within the industry. Our Marketing analysts help decide which products and services we sell, as well as at what price. This position will arrive at conclusions by studying market conditions, competitors' activities and consumer behavior.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS/RESPONSIBILITIES
A large part of being a marketing analyst includes cleaning, sorting, and interpreting data.
Using tools to understand current customers and find new
Monitoring and forecasting marketing and sales trends in a particular industry
Crafting and evaluating methods for collecting data, such as customer surveys, questionnaires, and online polls
Measuring the effectiveness of marketing campaigns and strategies
Using statistical software to analyze data related to a particular product or service
Gathering data about consumers, competitors, and market conditions
Converting complex data into understandable graphs, tables, and written reports
Provides actionable overall market and customer insights to address key strategic questions.
Responsible for tracking, reporting, and analyzing the performance of marketing activities, ad-hoc analytic requests, and development/automation of regular reports.
Analyzes external and internal customer data using database queries (SQL, Access), spreadsheet (Excel) models, web analytics tools (Adobe / Omniture), statistical analysis tools, and campaign management software tools.
Evaluates customers’ online behavior and provide insights and recommendations for further enhancements to the guest experience.
Analyzes A/B and Multi-variate tests, communicate results and provide recommendations.
Creates PowerPoint presentations to provide market and consumer insights to other marketing and sales departments.
Advises other marketing functions (e-commerce/website, online/offline advertising, brand, product development) as the knowledge owner for customer and market data.
Marketing
· Assist in the development of ad campaigns
· Work with team to define marketing themes and budgets
· The ability to work within the marketing department to help guide a vision.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITY
· Familiarity with agricultural or industrial equipment
· Mechanical knowledge and ability a plus
· Ability to source research topics and utilize available tools
Detail-oriented and accurate.
Be able to multi-task and prioritize.
Be able to work in a fast-paced environment and able to handle interruptions.
Communicate and work well with others.
· Effective collaboration and teamwork skills.
· Excellent computer skills
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE
Bachelor Degree Preferred
Five- Ten years of work-related experience or equivalent combination of education and experience preferred.
WORK ENVIRONMENT
This position will spend some time in a regional office but will also spend some time outdoors in areas which includes exposure to hot work, chemicals, paints and higher temperatures for brief periods. Time in the field includes being exposed to outdoors, other office settings, dirt, noise, uneven surfaces and excessive heat or cold.
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS FOR PERFORMING ESSENTIAL DUTIES
Sitting/Standing/Walking: About 40% of the time is spent sitting in an office. About 60% of the time is in the shop or yard.
Speaking/Hearing: Ability to effectively communicate with co-workers and supervisors.
Vision: Ability to effectively visualize the computer screen, read printed materials and inspect equipment.
Lifting/Carrying: Ability to lift, push and pull up to 50#s for a short period of time and distance.
Stooping/Kneeling: Ability to stoop/kneel when required.
Reaching/Handling: Ability to reach/handle product when required. Ability to climb stairs and ladders, bend and twist.

Senior Marketing Analyst/CRM Analyst
Reports to: VP, Customer Insights & Analytics
Job Location: Baltimore, MD – remote/hybrid
Salary Range: $90,000 to $95,000/yr
Position Summary:
We are in search of a proactive and driven Senior CRM Analyst to join our team. If you possess a talent for problem-solving, a passion for numbers, and an analytical mindset coupled with an unwavering attention to detail, we want to hear from you. This pivotal role requires not only proficiency in data analysis and direct marketing but also a profound understanding of marketing analytics and business intelligence tools.
As our Senior CRM Analyst, you will play a crucial role in shaping our marketing strategies by leveraging data insights. Your responsibilities will include analyzing complex datasets, optimizing marketing campaigns, and ensuring measurable results. Moreover, you will spearhead our analytics-driven marketing initiatives, translating intricate data into actionable strategies.
Collaboration is key in this role, as you will engage with various teams across the company to align marketing efforts with overarching business objectives. Additionally, you will oversee relationships with multiple marketing analytics data platform vendors, ensuring that we harness data effectively to drive informed decision-making.
Primary Responsibilities:
Develop, execute, and disseminate Business Intelligence reports to key stakeholders.
Oversee the catalog, direct mail circulation and segmentation strategy as well as the analytic reporting, ensuring adherence to production schedules.
Translate business requests into actionable insights and analytics.
Generate marketing analytics and productivity reports for multi-channel direct marketing campaigns, focusing on customer key performance indicators.
Collaborate with external database vendors to maintain the accuracy and integrity of customer data, while managing project deadlines effectively.
Conduct thorough review and audit of all reports and analyses before distribution to ensure accuracy and relevance.
Demonstrate agility in learning and applying new software systems to enhance analytical capabilities and operational efficiency.
These responsibilities underscore the pivotal role of the Senior CRM Analyst in driving data-driven decision-making and optimizing marketing strategies to achieve business objectives effectively.
Discipline/Major:
Bachelor’s degree in marketing, Math, Economics, Finance, Business Analytics, or related fields.
Qualifications:
Relevant Experience: Minimum of 3 years of experience supporting consumer marketing with business intelligence insights and analytics, demonstrating a proven track record in leveraging data to drive marketing strategies and achieve business objectives.
Analytical Skills: Well-developed analytical and problem-solving skills with meticulous attention to detail, enabling the interpretation of complex data sets and the generation of actionable insights to inform decision-making processes.
Technical Proficiency:
· Expertise in Microsoft Excel, including advanced functions and data manipulation techniques, facilitating efficient data analysis, reporting, and visualization tasks.
· Proficiency in DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) for PowerBI, enabling the creation of sophisticated calculations and measures within PowerBI reports and dashboards.
· Experience with PowerBI Reporting, including the ability to design and develop visually compelling reports and dashboards to communicate insights effectively.
· Familiarity with SQL (Structured Query Language) for database querying and manipulation, allowing for efficient extraction and analysis of data from relational databases.
Database Understanding: Strong understanding of relational databases with proficiency in database analysis skills, allowing for effective management and analysis of customer data to derive meaningful insights.
Self-Starter Mentality: A self-starter with the ability to take initiative, work autonomously, and effectively prioritize and multitask under tight deadlines, ensuring timely completion of projects while maintaining accuracy and quality standards.
Continuous Learning Mindset: An eagerness to learn and adapt to advanced marketing tactics and strategies in a fast-paced, evolving direct marketing environment, staying abreast of industry trends and best practices to drive continuous improvement.

About the Role:*
Join our dynamic team at Red Dog Media, where curiosity fuels our journey as we build a powerhouse performance paid search marketing company. Maximize profitability for marketing opportunities while paving the way for future growth and automation

Creation, syndication, and management of pay per click campaigns
Management of tests and experiments
Develop and refine processes, bidding strategies, documentation and automation
Competitive intelligence research

Data integrity
Follows project management from idea to implementation

A data enthusiast with a knack for solving complex puzzles

A Microsoft Excel wizard
Eager to learn and innovate contributing at a high-performing level
A highly autonomous individual that drives initiatives forward with minimal oversight
Enjoys a challenge, competitive industry, and gamifying your work

Complete two educational courses

Job Summary
As Pink Zebra Home’s Advertising Marketing Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in driving the success of our digital marketing efforts, particularly in the scope of paid social media advertising. Your responsibilities will encompass strategic planning, ad delivery, audience targeting, data analysis, and campaign optimization. By using advanced analytical techniques and digital advertising tools, you will extract actionable insights from campaign data to enhance performance and achieve our marketing objectives.
We are seeking for a highly skilled individual with extensive experience in managing campaigns across various platforms including Meta (formerly Facebook), TikTok, and more. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in e-commerce and digital marketing, with a demonstrated track record of driving successful campaigns.
Responsibilities:
Paid Social Media Campaign Strategy and Planning:
- Collaborate with internal teams to develop comprehensive digital marketing strategies with a specific focus on social media advertising, using advanced analytical techniques to identify target audience segments, define campaign objectives, and optimize ad performance.
Ad Creation and Optimization:
- Utilize best practices and data insights to optimize ad creatives for maximum performance and relevance.
- Utilize software such as Smartly.io, Reveal Bot, or comparable tools to streamline the process of creating, customizing, and optimizing paid social media ads across platforms such as Facebook, Instagram, and others.
- Implement A/B testing strategies to test different ad variations and optimize campaigns for maximum effectiveness such as messaging, imagery, and calls-to-action.
Audience Targeting and Segmentation:
- Leverage data analytics and segmentation techniques to identify and target relevant audience segments based on demographics, interests, and behaviors.
- Utilize advanced targeting capabilities offered by Smartly.io and other platforms to maximize ad relevance and engagement.
Analytical Data Management:
- Manage and analyze large datasets related to social media ad campaigns, including campaign performance metrics, audience insights, and ad engagement data.
- Utilize advanced analytical techniques to extract meaningful insights from raw data and identify actionable opportunities for campaign optimization.
- Utilize your expertise in Smartly.io to streamline campaign management processes, automate repetitive tasks, and optimize ad performance.
- Integrate Google Analytics 4 (GA4) into campaign tracking and measurement processes to gain deeper insights into user behavior, campaign performance, and conversion attribution. Utilize GA4 data to inform campaign optimization strategies and drive better results.
Real-Time Monitoring and Optimization:
- Monitor campaign performance in real-time using software such as Smartly.io to identify opportunities for optimization.
- Implement automated rules and procedures to adjust campaign settings, bidding strategies, and ad placements based on performance data.
Performance Analysis and Reporting:
- Generate regular performance reports using data analytics tools to track key metrics and evaluate the success of paid social media ad campaigns.
- Provide actionable insights and recommendations for optimization based on performance analysis, highlighting areas for improvement and opportunities for growth.
- Generate regular performance reports using automated optimization tools to track key metrics and evaluate the success of social media ad campaigns.
- Generate comprehensive end-of-campaign reports, providing insights and recommendations for future optimizations.
Campaign Setup and Management:
- Take ownership of the end-to-end process of setting up and managing paid social media ad campaigns. This includes defining campaign objectives, setting budgets, and bidding strategies, and configuring targeting parameters to optimize campaign performance.
- Monitor campaign performance daily, making data-driven optimizations to improve key metrics.
Industry Trends:
- Stay up to date of industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies related to paid social media advertising and analytics.
- Analyze data and trends across multiple advertising platforms (e.g., social media, search engines, display ads) to inform overall marketing strategies.
- Continuously evaluate new tools and features offered by digital advertising campaign management software such as Smartly.io to enhance campaign performance and drive innovation in digital marketing strategies.
Collaboration and Communication:
- Collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams including Marketing, Sales, and IT to ensure alignment on campaign objectives, messaging, and performance goals.
- Communicate regularly with Executive team members to provide updates on campaign performance, insights, and optimization strategies.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES
The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and/or abilities required to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.
- Bachelor’s degree in marketing, Advertising, or related field.
- 5+ years of experience in digital marketing with a focus on paid social advertising.
- Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data, draw insights, and make data-driven decisions.
- Proven expertise in managing campaigns across Meta Ads, Pinterest Ads, and TikTok Ads with a minimum monthly ad budget expense of $50,000.
- Development of comprehensive digital advertising strategies aligned with business objectives, using data from advertising optimization tool to target the right audience and optimize ad spend effectively, using software such as Smartly.io.
- Proficiency in Google Analytics 4 (GA4) and experience integrating it into campaign tracking and measurement processes.
- In-depth understanding of social media platforms and their advertising capabilities.
- Proficiency in Smartly.io and other social advertising management platforms to efficiently manage and optimize campaigns.
- Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret sales data and draw actionable insights.
- Excellent communication skills, with the ability to effectively present campaign strategies and results.
- Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills to manage multiple campaigns simultaneously.
- Proven track record of driving results and meeting campaign objectives.
- Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
If you have a passion for paid social advertising and a proven track record of driving results, we want to hear from you! Please send us a message to discuss further.

Hi there! We're WebFX, a full-service digital marketing agency based in the US. We've been named the Best Place To Work in Pennsylvania 9 times in a row and we'd love to meet you! We are a fast-growing company that has doubled in size over the past 5 years, with talented team members now based around the globe (and representing 18+ different countries!). While we are growing at a rapid rate, we are committed to growing strategically and sustainably, and that starts with growing our team of the #BestCoworkers - that’s where you come in!

We're looking for people to join our mission to provide world-class digital marketing solutions to mid-size businesses around the world. We are passionate about what we do, we’re committed to driving business growth for our clients, and we’re on the hunt for people just like you, who take pride in their work and want to be part of a company that does too.

Job Title: Jr. Digital Marketing Specialist - Strategy Track
Job Description:
Hi there! We're WebFX, a full-service digital marketing agency based in the US. We've been named the Best Place To Work in Pennsylvania 9 times in a row and we'd love to meet you! We are a fast-growing company that has doubled in size over the past 5 years, with talented team members now based around the globe (and representing 18+ different countries!). While we are growing at a rapid rate, we are committed to growing strategically and sustainably, and that starts with growing our team of the #BestCoworkers - that’s where you come in!

We're looking for people to join our mission to provide world-class digital marketing solutions to mid-size businesses around the world. We are passionate about what we do, we’re committed to driving business growth for our clients, and we’re on the hunt for people just like you, who take pride in their work and want to be part of a company that does too.

You Might Be a Great Fit For This Position if You Have…

A Bachelor’s Degree
Successful FXers in this role have majored in Marketing, Advertising, Business, Journalism, Communications, Information Systems, Statistics, and beyond
GPA of 3.4

A Few Related Skills and Experiences
(This is an entry-level role, and experience in every one of these areas is not required - we will train you on what you need to know! But the following skills/experience are awesome to have, and will help get your career off to a running start):

Part-time/summer job/internship experience is a must
Customer service experience in any industry
Advertising/marketing agency experience
Digital marketing experience
Basic HTML experience
Google Analytics and/or analytical/research skills
Excel/Google Docs skills
Copywriting for the web

Any of these Signature FXer Traits!
You have an interest in the web and stay up-to-date on new and developing technologies
You are a professional, dependable, and independent worker with a strong work ethic
You’re self-motivated, thrive on challenges, and enjoy getting things done
You have an eye for detail and dedication to high-quality work
You have an exceptional level of follow-through
You are a proactive, creative problem-solver who faces challenges with a can-do mindset
You possess excellent time/project management skills
You have solid analytical skills and a knack for making data-driven decisions
You work with a sense of urgency and can consistently meet deadlines
You are an outstanding communicator and possess strong interpersonal skills
You are a lifelong learner who loves to grow and stretch outside of your comfort zone, and are always looking to improve your skills

If any of these sound like you, then we want to hear from you! We are committed to growing 1% better everyday, and we believe working at WebFX could quite possibly make your life 1(00)% better - after all, you would be surrounded by the #BestCoworkersinPA!

In This Role, You’ll Get To…

Partner with senior digital marketers and support some of our largest campaigns and client accounts
Analyze performance data (in Google Analytics and MarketingCloudFX) and prepare monthly digital marketing campaign reports
Develop appropriate SEO strategies and action plans/optimizations based on data
Manage large PPC (think Google Ads!) campaigns and budgets and work to ensure a positive ROI for clients
-Perform research to ensure client success - think keyword research to competitor analysis, and everything in between
Devise the content strategy and outlines for our team of copywriters and manage the execution of web content based on client needs and preferences
Manage the ideation, planning, and execution efforts of CRO special projects and champion CRO best practices for clients
Perform A/B, website usability, and website conversion rate testing to determine what works best for your client and provide recommendations accordingly
Interpret web analytics, demographic data, market research, and buyer behaviors, and generate and execute strategies as they relate to findings
Manage the planning and execution of email marketing campaigns
Optimize web content for keywords related to client products and services
'Get your hands dirty’ and get into the backend of client websites to correct errors and technical issues and implement content

A Typical ‘Day in the Life’ Might Consist of:
5% managing resources for CRO projects
5% analyzing clients’ competitors and making appropriate recommendations
10% working in the backend of websites/fixing technical issues/implementing content
10% creating reports for client campaigns
15% analyzing data and identifying deliverables
25% creating and managing overall client strategy
30% executing on SEO and PPC strategies with regular optimizations
100% pursuing your own personal best while delivering real-world impact for our clients!
Note: The Jr. Digital Marketing Specialist - Strategy Track is not a client-facing position

What You’ll Get From Us!

Opportunities to Learn and Train With Our Team!

World-class on-the-job training from the experts (think Sr. Marketers, not the HR team) as well as opportunities for ongoing personal learning and development
On-site, state-of-the-art training amenities to facilitate departmental trainings, industry-related updates, and monthly Lunch-and-Learns.

In-Person Experience Alongside Our Team of Industry Experts
This position is based fully in-office at our riverside campus in Harrisburg, PA, with opportunities for this to evolve as Fxers advance in their career tenure.

Menlo Security's mission is enabling the world to connect, communicate and collaborate securely without compromise. COVID-19 has made our mission all the more real. We support customers across various enterprises including Fortune 500 companies, 9/10 of the largest global banks and the Department of Defense.
The world has fundamentally changed. We are growing from 400 employees into the next phase of our journey, and we need passionate talent filled with empathy and agility. The right candidate for the job is ethical, hyper-organized, fanatical about seeing things through to completion, service-oriented, and humble enough to take feedback and coaching yet confident enough to provide feedback and coaching.
Menlo is well-funded for growth and our investors are second to none. They include Vista Equity Partners (“Vista”), General Catalyst, JPMC, American Express, HSBC, and Ericsson Ventures.
About Menlo Security:
Menlo Security is the leader in Browser Security, and is committed to providing innovative solutions that redefine how organizations protect themselves from cyber threats. Our cutting-edge Secure Enterprise Browser solution enables businesses to operate securely in the digital world, ensuring a safe and productive online experience for users.
Position Overview
Menlo Security is seeking a motivated Marketing Analyst with early to intermediate career experience to join our dynamic marketing team. This role is ideal for someone passionate about data-driven decision making, eager to contribute to the development and execution of marketing strategies that drive business growth. The Marketing Analyst will be responsible for analyzing demand marketing trends, monitoring competitive demand activity, and evaluating marketing campaign effectiveness to support strategic decision-making processes. This role will report to the Sr Director, Demand Generation, and serve as a strategic advisor on the performance and trends of the Demand Gen team.
Key Responsibilities:
Perform, visualize, and present data analytics on the outcomes of Demand activities:
Conduct in-depth data analysis and produce visualizations to evaluate and present the effectiveness of marketing campaigns, web traffic, and key business metrics.
Collaborate with Regional Marketing leaders on the reporting and analysis of key pipeline measurements, including but not limited to: ROI, cost per lead, cost per opportunity, deal velocity, average deal size, rolling analysis, cohort analysis, stage conversion rates…
Collaborate with the Digital Marketing Director on the reporting and analysis of key website traffic metrics, including but not limited to: Traffic acquisition, new users, active users, bounce rate, engagement time, web conversions…
Assemble the above mentioned metrics into a weekly Master Metrics Report for the Head of Demand Gen and CMO

Present insights, trends, and recommendations on Demand strategies:
After collecting, analyzing, and visualizing data from the above areas - work with the functional owners and Head of Demand Gen to recommend quarterly adjustments.
Recommend areas of activity for both increased and decreased investment.

Maintain and optimize the primary data storage and analytics platforms:
Represent the Marketing team’s priorities regularly in conversations with the Business Intelligence (BI) team, who own Salesforce, Snowflake, and Tableau.
Determine and recommend updates to these BI systems which would benefit and streamline marketing analytics and processes.

Monitor and report on operational and competitive Demand dynamics:
Conduct a quarterly report on where primary competitors are investing their budget
Collaborate with Marketing Operations to determine new trends and capabilities in demand marketing technology and platforms
Collaborate with Product Marketing to determine any major shifts in primary competitor demand messaging

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, Statistics, or a related field.
1-3 years of experience in a marketing analyst role, preferably in the cybersecurity or technology sector.
Strong analytical skills, with proficiency in data analysis tools (e.g., Excel, Google Analytics, Tableau, Snowflake).
Familiarity with CRM and marketing automation platforms (e.g., Salesforce, Marketo).
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
Detail-oriented with strong organizational and project management skills.
Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment.
A passion for technology and cybersecurity is a plus.
Our Compensation and Benefits
At Menlo Security, Base Salary is one part of our competitive total compensation and benefits package and is determined using a salary range. The base salary range for this role is $62,000 - $108,000.
In accordance with NY, CO, CA, and WA law, the range provided is Menlo Security’s reasonable estimate of the base compensation for this role. The actual amount may be higher or lower, based on non-discriminatory factors such as experience, knowledge, skills, abilities, and location. All employees may be eligible to become Menlo Security shareholders through eligibility for stock-based compensation grants, which are awarded to employees based on company and individual performance.
Menlo Security does not accept unsolicited resumes from search firm recruiters. Fees will not be paid in the event a candidate submitted by a recruiter without an agreement in place is hired; such resumes will be deemed the sole property of Menlo Security.
Menlo Security is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

We believe in open communication, supporting new ideas, and sharing a mutual mindset of what we’re aiming to achieve together. There are tremendous opportunities to take initiative, implement new ideas, and have a hand in building a legacy.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.

:
The primary focus of this position will be daily P&L Reporting and attribution as well as creating and implementing new models and concepts to enhance the accuracy, profitability, and efficiently of financial accounting and managing our interest rate risk position using the QRM Framework. Expected to perform multiple functions across the Secondary Marketing area, including developing and maintaining model inputs and improving the accuracy and efficiency of modeling interest rate risk.
WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING:
Development and evolution of current daily P&L framework and attribution, including forecasting of expected future margin
Maintain and improve key model assumptions including loan valuation, prepayment assumptions, and behavioral models that drive loan valuation and hedging
Creating new structures and processes that aligns priced in margin to modeled initial margin in QRM
Ownership of fair valuation inputs and concepts to align valuation with our priced in margin
Ownership of servicing valuation embedded in fair value calculations along with enhancement to servicing segmentation and valuation
Ownership of modeling new Products from implementation within QRM Framework to valuation and reporting
Design and implement improvements to current reporting and/or database structure
Provide insights for process efficiencies, functional realignments and overall continuous improvement
Builds adhoc analysis, reporting and models as needed with limited support
WHAT WE NEED FROM YOU:
Must Have Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Economics, Finance, Mathematics or applicable area
Must be coachable, able to take direction and feedback and have a willingness to learn
Must be able to complete projects and tasks independently, but also be a team player
Strong work ethic, self-motivation and drive
Strong analytical, problem solving skills and mathematical skills
Intermediate to Advanced experience using Excel, with ability to utilize PIVOTs, vLookup, & other analytical functions
Strong attention to detail
Onsite attendance is required

Nice to Have Qualifications:
1-2 years prior work experience, with knowledge of the mortgage process and market preferred
Experience working with QRM

Job Title: Senior Marketing Analyst
Company: Quick Quack Car Wash
Location: Remote
About Quick Quack Car Wash: Quick Quack Car Wash is a leading chain of express exterior car washes, committed to delivering fast, convenient, and eco-friendly car cleaning services. With a focus on innovation and customer satisfaction, Quick Quack Car Wash is seeking a talented Senior Marketing Analyst to join our dynamic marketing team.
Position Overview: As a Senior Marketing Analyst at Quick Quack Car Wash, you will play a critical role in driving data-driven marketing strategies and optimizing performance across various channels. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in customer segmentation, data modeling, marketing attribution, and site measurement to inform strategic decision-making and maximize ROI.
Key Responsibilities:
Utilize advanced analytics techniques to segment customers based on behavior, demographics, and other relevant attributes to inform targeted marketing campaigns.
Develop predictive models and propensity scores to identify high-value customer segments and optimize marketing spend allocation.
Implement marketing attribution models to measure the impact of various marketing channels and tactics on customer acquisition, retention, and lifetime value.
Conduct thorough analysis of marketing campaigns and initiatives to provide actionable insights and recommendations for optimization.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including marketing, product, and finance, to align on key performance metrics and strategic priorities.
Design and implement experiments and A/B tests to evaluate the effectiveness of different marketing strategies and tactics.
Lead the measurement and reporting of website and digital marketing performance, including traffic, conversion rates, and user behavior.
Stay abreast of industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in marketing analytics and data-driven decision-making.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, or a related field (Master's degree preferred).
5+ years of experience in marketing analytics, data analysis, or a similar role, preferably in the retail or e-commerce industry.
Proficiency in statistical analysis and data manipulation using tools such as SQL, Python, R, or similar programming languages.
Strong understanding of customer segmentation techniques, predictive modeling, and statistical methodologies.
Experience building out custom reports in PowerBI.
Experience with marketing attribution models (e.g., multi-touch attribution, time decay models) and web analytics platforms (e.g., Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics).
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
Ability to communicate complex analytical concepts and findings to non-technical stakeholders effectively.
Detail-oriented with a high level of accuracy in data analysis and reporting.
Self-motivated and proactive with the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Joining Quick Quack Car Wash offers a unique opportunity to be part of a forward-thinking company that values innovation and excellence. If you are passionate about leveraging data to drive marketing strategy and performance, we'd love to hear from you!

About
CleanChoice Energy, a national renewable energy company that empowers people and businesses to cut emissions and live cleaner, healthier lives, is seeking a Marketing Analyst to join our growing team. This is a unique opportunity to join a mission driven organization transforming the U.S. electricity market by switching homes and businesses to 100% clean, pollution-free energy.
Job Description
This role will be focused on improving our data-driven approach to marketing through advanced analytics and robust reporting. We are looking for someone who is highly analytical, data-driven and passionate about marketing. In this role, you will be responsible for conducting analyses and creating reporting to help the sales and marketing teams manage performance and drive growth. This position will report to the Director of Business Intelligence and be fully dedicated to supporting the Growth and Revenue Operations team.
Responsibilities
Analyze the performance of customer acquisition and retention programs, across multiple channels, including but not limited to digital (search, social, email, display/video advertising), online and offline partnerships, direct mail, and sales (indirect, in-person, call center)
Create, update and maintain various monthly reporting packages and dashboards for marketing and business leadership
Lead several initiatives including customer acquisition cost optimization, attribution and media mix modeling, audience segmentation, and retention reporting
Work with business leaders to define and scope reporting needs and translate the reporting needs into dataset requirements
Develop data-driven insights to drive innovation and strategic decision making
Present findings and insights to business stakeholders.
Qualifications and Skills
2-3 years of experience in marketing analytics
Degree in business, marketing, economics, statistics, engineering, or a related field
Hands on experience working with various marketing data sources in an analytical data environment (Google Analytics, Facebook, Segment, Braze, Salesforce)
Familiarity with marketing KPIs and measurement
SQL experience required
Experience using DOMO (or similar reporting platform)
Ability to collaborate effectively with marketers, business intelligence analysts, and data engineers
Prior energy experience is not required
Travel
100% Remote

Southern Company Gas provides for the energy needs of over four million U.S. households and businesses. As the largest natural gas-only distribution company in the United States, we're working to ensure that Americans have access to a supply of clean, safe, reliable and affordable natural gas for decades to come. We offer our customers a wide range of energy services under one umbrella: seven regulated utilities as well as non-regulated businesses that offer retail, wholesale and storage services.
Southern Company (NYSE: SO) is a leading energy provider serving 9 million residential and commercial customers across the Southeast and beyond through its family of companies. Providing clean, safe, reliable and affordable energy with excellent service is our mission. The company has electric operating companies in three states, natural gas distribution companies in four states, a competitive generation company, a leading distributed energy infrastructure company with national capabilities, a fiber optics network, and telecommunications services. Through an industry-leading commitment to innovation, resilience, and sustainability, we are taking action to meet our customers’ and communities’ needs while advancing our commitment to net zero emissions by 2050. Our uncompromising values ensure we put the needs of those we serve at the center of everything we do and are the key to our sustained success. We are transforming energy into economic, environmental and social progress for tomorrow. Our corporate culture and hiring practices have earned the company national awards and recognition from numerous organizations, including Forbes, Military Times, DiversityInc, Black Enterprise, J.D. Power, Fortune, Human Rights Campaign and more. To learn more, visit www.southerncompany.com.
Southern Company is an equal opportunity employer where an applicant's qualifications are considered without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other basis prohibited by law.

Hi there! We're WebFX, a full-service digital marketing agency based in the US. We've been named the Best Place To Work in Pennsylvania 9 times in a row and we'd love to meet you! We are a fast-growing company that has doubled in size over the past 5 years, with talented team members now based around the globe (and representing 18+ different countries!). While we are growing at a rapid rate, we are committed to growing strategically and sustainably, and that starts with growing our team of the #BestCoworkers - that’s where you come in!

We're looking for people to join our mission to provide world-class digital marketing solutions to mid-size businesses around the world. We are passionate about what we do, we’re committed to driving business growth for our clients, and we’re on the hunt for people just like you, who take pride in their work and want to be part of a company that does too.

You Might Be a Great Fit For This Position if You Have…

A Bachelor’s Degree
Successful FXers in this role have majored in Marketing, Advertising, Business, Journalism, Communications, Information Systems, Statistics, and beyond
GPA above 3.4

A Few Related Skills and Experiences
(This is an entry-level role, and experience in every one of these areas is not required - we will train you on what you need to know! But the following skills/experience are awesome to have, and will help get your career off to a running start):

Part-time/summer job/internship experience is a must
Customer service experience in any industry
Advertising/marketing agency experience
Digital marketing experience
Basic HTML experience
Google Analytics and/or analytical/research skills
Excel/Google Docs skills
Copywriting for the web
Presentation skills

Any of these Signature FXer Traits!
You have an interest in the web and stay up-to-date on new and developing technologies
You are a professional, dependable, and independent worker with a strong work ethic
You’re self-motivated, thrive on challenges, and enjoy getting things done
You have an eye for detail and dedication to high-quality work
You have an exceptional level of follow-through
You are a proactive, creative problem-solver who faces challenges with a can-do mindset
You possess excellent time/project management skills
You have solid analytical skills and a knack for making data-driven decisions
You work with a sense of urgency and can consistently meet deadlines
You are an outstanding communicator and possess strong interpersonal skills
You are a lifelong learner who loves to grow and stretch outside of your comfort zone, and are always looking to improve your skills

If any of these sound like you, then we want to hear from you! We are committed to growing 1% better everyday, and we believe working at WebFX could quite possibly make your life 1(00)% better - after all, you would be surrounded by the #BestCoworkersinPA!

In This Role, You’ll Get To…

Work directly with a portfolio of clients as their direct point of contact at WebFX, educating them through clear communication, and helping them achieve their goals
Work to maintain our world-class client retention rate by developing and fostering long-lasting client relationships
Analyze performance data (in Google Analytics and MarketingCloudFX) and prepare monthly digital marketing campaign reports
Develop appropriate SEO strategies and action plans/optimizations based on data
Create and manage PPC (think Google Ads!) campaigns and work to ensure a positive ROI for clients
-Perform research to ensure client success - think keyword research, competitor analysis, and everything in between
Devise the content strategy and outlines for our team of copywriters and manage the execution of web content based on client goals
Manage the ideation, planning, and execution efforts of CRO special projects and champion CRO best practices for clients
Perform A/B, website usability, and website conversion rate testing to determine what works best for your client and provide recommendations accordingly
Interpret web analytics, demographic data, market research, and buyer behaviors, and generate and execute strategies as they relate to findings
'Get your hands dirty’ and get into the backend of client websites to correct errors and technical issues and implement content

A Typical ‘Day in the Life’ Might Consist of:
5% managing resources for CRO projects
5% analyzing clients’ competitors and making appropriate recommendations
10% working in the backend of websites/fixing technical issues/implementing content
10% creating reports for client campaigns
15% analyzing data and identifying deliverables
25% communicating with clients
30% executing on SEO and PPC strategies with regular optimizations
100% pursuing your own personal best while delivering real-world impact for our clients!
Note: The Jr. Business Data Analyst is a client-facing position

What You’ll Get From Us!

Opportunities to Learn and Train With Our Team!
Our “Bootcamp” training program will be provided for new FXers to learn, grow and develop both in and out of the office in the specific hard skills necessary to be successful in their position
World-class on-the-job training from the experts (think Sr. Marketers, not the HR team) as well as opportunities for ongoing personal learning and development
On-site, state-of-the-art training amenities to facilitate departmental trainings, industry-related updates, and monthly Lunch-and-Learns.

A Place to Grow Your Career
WebFX grew 250%+ over the past 3 years, and we promote almost exclusively internally. Merit-based promotional opportunities are abundant for new FXers who meet or exceed position performance metrics.

In-Person Experience Alongside Our Team of Industry Experts
This position is based fully in-office at our riverside campus in Harrisburg, PA, with opportunities for this to evolve as Fxers advance in their career tenure.

Digital Marketing Specialist
Digital Marketing Analyst
Digital Marketing Consultant
Lead Internet Marketing Consultant
Sr. Internet Marketing Consultant

Marketing Analyst
OSG USA, INC. is a leading manufacturer of taps, endmills, drills, and indexable cutting tools. OSG also serves the fastener industry by offering a complete line of thread rolling, flat, cylindrical, and planetary, rack and trim dies. The company markets its products to numerous industries including automotive, die mold, aerospace, energy, heavy industry, and dental.
** Only local candidates will be considered for this position.
Position Summary:
We are seeking a Marketing Analyst to join our growing team! The Marketing Analyst plays an important role being responsible for collecting and interpreting data about OSG’s customers, and buying habits and analyzing market trends to help develop strategies and drive informed decisions. The marketing analyst will be responsible for the management of OSG’s CRM database, and work closely with organization stakeholders and cross-functional leaders by leveraging data insights and behaviors to develop innovative marketing strategies and tactics. This role will develop and track campaigns that drive business results while managing strategies, execution, and optimization across multiple channels.

Job Functions for a Marketing Analyst:
Analyze all current and future state CRM operations, data feeds, and reports
Manage and maintain the CRM database and conduct end-user training as needed
Provide actionable overall market and customer insights to address key strategic questions
Responsible for tracking, reporting, and analyzing the performance of marketing activities, ad-hoc analytic requests, and development/automation of regular reports
Analyzes external and internal customer data using statistical analysis tools, and campaign management software tools to provide insights and recommendations
Creates PowerPoint presentations to provide market and consumer insights to marketing sales and internal management teams
Performs other allied duties as needed
Qualifications for a Marketing Analyst:
Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Data Analytics, or related field
Strong organizational and problem-solving skills
Experience with data analytics tools and techniques (Excel, PowerBi, etc.)
Proven ability to interpret data and develop actionable insights
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Excellent knowledge of MS Office Suite of products
Strong attention to detail and accuracy
Preferred Qualifications for a Marketing Analyst:
Experience with MS CRM & Dynamics
PowerBi experience
Experience in the cutting tool industry
Benefits: Excellent, Low-Cost Benefits
401K Tax Deferral & Profit Sharing Plan with full employer match up to 6%
Comprehensive Premium PPO medical plan, dental and vision coverage
Wellness Program Incentive - earn discounts off your medical premiums
Flexible Savings Account (for medical and dependent care)
Company-paid Employee Basic Life/Dependent Life Insurance
Company paid Short Term and Long Term Disability Insurance
Begin accruing vacation immediately
Up to 15 PTO days in your first year
Up to 3 Flex days each year
10 paid holidays
Tuition reimbursement program
Employee Assistance Program
Compensation: Salary + Quarterly bonus potential
Reports to: Marketing Manager
Job Type: Full-time, Exempt
Hours: 8 a.m. – 5 p.m.
Location: 620 Stetson Avenue, St. Charles, IL 60174
We welcome the opportunity to speak with you about becoming part of our team. Learn more about OSG USA, Inc. at www.osgtool.com.

Reli. is a rapidly growing eCommerce company selling on Amazon (www.amazon.com/reli), Walmart, Shopify (ShopReli.com), and eBay seeing 100% year over year growth. We currently service 7,000+ orders daily across our eCommerce marketplaces, with over 1,000,000+ unique customers such as Marvel, Dominos, and Lululemon.
We are seeking a highly motivated and data-driven individual to join our advertising team! As a ”Product Team" member of Reli. You will play a crucial role in helping to manage and optimize our ad campaigns. This position requires a strong analytical mindset and a passion for leveraging data analytics to drive advertising success. If you are detail-oriented, resourceful, and have a keen eye for optimization, we want to hear from you!
This is a starting position with very high potential for advancement and career growth!
Starting wage will depend on experience and educational background.
Growth Plan Details: This role is associated with a Growth Plan, with the goal of reaching Marketing Associate (Analytical) - Level 2, around the time of completion of Year 1 at Reli. Impactful progress towards reaching Level 2 will include opportunities for compensation increases along the way, dependent upon performance, building towards a $30/hr base compensation upon reaching Level 2. We are committed to supporting your professional development and rewarding your achievements every step of the way.
Reli. is headquartered at 12641 166th Street, Cerritos, CA. We are Hybrid Remote. Our work from home days are on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays. Our in-office days are on Tuesdays and Thursdays to facilitate team bonding and collaboration.
Fantastic employee benefits:
Paid Time Off (Vacation, etc.) - 15 Days PTO to Start + 1 additional day per year working at Reli.
10 Paid Holidays in addition to PTO
Hybrid Work Schedule
Regular Team Happy Hours/Events
Employer Matching for 401(k)
Health Care (Medical, Vision, Dental) - Blue Shield PPO or HMO Medical Insurance
Life Insurance
Full Time-8 hr. Shifts
Position Description:
Analytical:
You will take ownership over multiple product categories that you discover and research - taking a product idea, working through its life cycle, and turning it into an eventual product launch
Product & Market Research to contribute towards expanding into new markets or grow in existing markets
Conducting quantitative product analysis (through Excel or Google Sheets) to determine product specifications, product pricing, and product launch viability
Communicating with purchasing/vendor coordinator(s) to ensure accuracy of product information, specs and pricing when performing price analysis
Creative/Design
Data driven & compelling copywriting for product page listings including product title, bullet points, enhanced content and keywords to support discoverability and improve conversion rate
Product Page Listing Setup & Updating on Amazon, Shopify, Walmart.com, and other marketplaces
Product page photography & written design requests to provide to our third party design service for execution of product page images, creative packaging artwork, and other marketing materials
Assist with managing design queue & actively coordinating with designers for photo editing/design finalization
Identifying & supporting marketing efforts to drive marketplace growth and/or optimization through A/B Testing, Price Optimization, & more
Experience with performing product research, analysis, pricing
Candidate Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree
Ability to apply a customer and marketing mindset when generating design requests for our design service to execute marketing materials
Product-focused with ability to conduct product research / analysis from a customer mindset
Resourceful, independent, and a problem solver
Detail-oriented to be able to follow Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs)
Willingness to learn and incorporate constructive feedback
Excellent communication skills with a willingness to ask questions and work in a team
Excellent computer and technology platform skills
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with eCommerce product page creation (images, copy, etc.)
Marketing Perspective - Understanding what types of product images are attractive to the customer for driving conversion
Strong Attention to Detail - Understanding the importance of following detailed SOPs and being able to document and communicate properly; ability to translate large amounts of detailed information into specific takeaways
Open-minded - Ability to be open-minded about findings and willingness to adjust accordingly, willingness to learn and being open to feedback
Creative thinking - Ability to try alternative approaches that with help see a problem / analysis from different perspectives (product-focused with consumer mindset)
Experience with performing product research, analysis, pricing
Analytical ability - Ability to propose data-driven product specs/price, etc.; Ability to gather & evaluate/analyze research in order to make informed decisions and conclusions based on quantitative analysis, making judgments about the value of information and understanding its components; considers different points of views and understands how information connects.
Willingness to ask questions / intellectual curiosity - Asks questions to find out all the needed details to move forward / complete task; being curious to understand the context of the process or ask questions if not clear; determined to understand the findings to communicate to the team
Photography experience

Reli. is a minority-owned and family-owned company headquartered in Cerritos, CA, with three strategically located distribution centers nationwide.
We are a rapidly growing eCommerce company built around strong values & making an impact. Providing a variety of products through eCommerce channels to make the daily lives easier for our business and consumer customers.

There are 2 actors on a network, people and machines. Just as usernames and passwords are used by people to access machines, machine identities are used by machines to identify and access each other. Venafi is the inventor of the technology that manages and protects machine identities, the most important security initiative in our Global 5000 customers. We are Warriors!

Venafi is looking for a Marketing Analyst who will report to the Sr Director of Enterprise Analytics and work closely with the Chief of Revenue Operations and Analytics to provide dashboarding and meaningful insights to sales and marketing leaders and the Executive Leadership Team as a whole. Are you passionate about making a positive impact and protecting the world from cybercriminals? Do you bring out the best of all those around you? If so, you may be a natural Venafi Warrior!
How you'll be protecting the world:
Translating business questions into easily consumable analyses and visualizations via Tableau and Excel
Providing data driven insights and recommendations for process improvements within sales and digital marketing to optimize the lead lifecycle and overall sales processes
Managing customer segmentation and targeting for both marketing campaigns and sales team prioritization
Outlining an accessible and reportable data structure across all go-to-market technologies along with the Sales Operations team such that the Enterprise Analytics team can quickly and easily develop insights from otherwise unstructured data
Collaborating with marketers to create measurement plans and reporting for campaigns/initiatives
Identifying website tagging and coding in support of business needs to implement and maintain integrity across sources of marketing data
Assisting Marketing Operations to properly design digital analytics setup and implement analytics tracking (Google Analytics, Marketo, etc.)
Working with marketing teams to develop A/B testing criteria and maintain a testing schedule to optimize campaigns
You are a great fit for this role if you:
Are an expert in the advanced capabilities of Excel and Tableau
Are a data-driven individual with a strong business acumen and focus on analytical problem solving, data manipulation and data management skills
Have the ability to tell a story and influence with data that is relatable and understandable by peers and executives alike
Are creative and able to effectively visualize responses to complex business questions
Are flexible and can adapt quickly when priorities change
Are an incredibly organized master multitasker and know how to set goals, prioritize, and maintain focus when it comes to deadlines
Have experienced the transformation from premise to cloud-based product selling and worked in both low volume high value go-to-market environments and high-volume frictionless go-to-market environments.
Have fantastic interpersonal skills, are a great listener, and are willing to go the extra mile to ensure your internal customers' success
Have an excellent technical understanding and can pick up new tools quickly
Possess BS/BA or equivalent knowledge and experience
Have 3+ years of marketing/sales operations/analytics experience
Have experience with any/all of the following technologies and/or data sources: Aviso, salesforce CRM & CPQ, Outreach, Gong, Marketo, Lean Data, DiscoverOrg, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, Google Analytics, Drift, DemandBase
While you are busy protecting the world, we've got you covered!
In addition to fostering a virtual first collaborative environment, Venafi offers a benefits package that is in the top 10%. Venafi pays 90% of the monthly premium for medical insurance and 100% of the monthly premium for dental, vision, life insurance, short and long-term disability, and accident insurance for both team members and their families. We offer an open time off policy and observe 12 holidays each year. We also offer a 401(k) with company matching, company HSA contribution, 2x salary employer-paid life insurance, parental leave, pet insurance, fertility, adoption and surrogacy benefits!
More About Venafi:
Venafi is the undisputed leader in Machine Identity Management. Why? Because we created the category and are light years ahead of anyone that would consider competing! Gartner has recognized Venafi as number one in our space and as it turns out, one is NOT the loneliest number!
Venafi is the inventor of the technology that secures and protects machine identities. The Venafi platform provides visibility, intelligence, and automation for SSL/TLS, IoT, mobile, cloud native, Kubernetes, and SSH machine identity types. Many of the largest organizations in the world use Venafi.

Billions of dollars have been spent protecting usernames and passwords and almost nothing managing machine identities—organizations are just now realizing that managing and protecting machine identities is as important as managing usernames and passwords. The bad guys know this and are using stolen or forged machine identities in their cyberattacks. In fact, Gartner says 50% of network attacks will use machine identities.
Come help us protect the world!

#LI-Remote
#LI-HA

Job Title: Digital Marketing Specialist - Account Manager- Ft Myers, FL
Job Description:
We're WebFX, a full-service digital marketing agency based in the US that's been named one of the Best Places To Work! We are a fast-growing company that has doubled in size over the past 5 years, with talented team members now based around the globe (and representing 18+ different countries!). While we are growing at a rapid rate, we are committed to growing strategically and sustainably, and that starts with growing our team of the #BestCoworkers - that’s where you come in!

We're looking for people to join our mission to provide world-class digital marketing solutions to mid-size businesses around the world. We are passionate about what we do, we’re committed to driving business growth for our clients, and we’re on the hunt for people just like you, who take pride in their work and want to be part of a company that does too.

We have a multi-step interview process, where we focus on giving both our candidates, and ourselves, opportunities to get to know each other a bit better. While our process may be more thorough and perhaps longer than other interview processes that you've been a part of, our goal is to work together with our candidates to find a mutually beneficial fit, where a candidate is a great addition to the FXFamily, and WebFX is the right fit for their career goals. GPA above 3.4

Experience at a marketing/advertising agency

Any of these Signature FXer Traits!
You have an interest in the web and stay up-to-date on new and developing technologies

You’re self-motivated, thrive on challenges, and enjoy getting things done

If any of these sound like you, then we want to hear from you! We are committed to growing 1% better everyday, and we believe working at WebFX could quite possibly make your life 1(00)% better - after all, you would be surrounded by the #BestCoworkersinPA!

In This Role, You’ll Get To…

Work directly with a portfolio of clients as their direct point of contact at WebFX, educating them through clear communication, and helping them achieve their goals
Work to maintain our world-class client retention rate by developing and fostering long-lasting client relationships
Optimize client websites for search engines (on-page SEO)
Manage significant paid search budgets on top-tier search engines (Google, Bing, etc.)
Perform keyword research for both SEO and PPC campaigns
Create and manage paid search campaigns
-Perform research to ensure client success - think keyword research, competitor analysis, and everything in between
Project manage all aspects of digital marketing campaigns for clients
Calculate ROI and prepare monthly digital marketing campaign reports
Direct the design of web pages and other content, ensuring all web functionality is operating properly and all content is up-to-date

10% creating reports for client campaigns
15% analyzing data and identifying deliverables
25% communicating with clients

100% pursuing your own personal best while delivering real-world impact for our clients!

Position Overview
The Marketing Analyst provides analytical support across a wide range of information, database and guest analysis, promo analysis and pricing analysis to enable the marketing team to make enhanced business decisions. To be successful in this role, you will be required to demonstrate a strong understanding of data strategy as well as work with various stakeholders across the business. The ideal candidate will have experience in storytelling through the usage of various data sources and will demonstrate an inquisitive nature by constantly searching for areas of opportunity for growth.
Job Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree in Business or a related field, required
3+ years in a business analyst or data analyst role, required
Multi-unit retail and/or restaurant experience, preferred
Expertise in Excel, Access, and PowerPoint
Strong presentation skills

Location Requirement:
This position is based in Phoenix, Arizona
Skills
Microsoft Excel
Data Visualization Tools (Power BI, Tableau preferred)
Analytics Insights
Summarizing complex data sets
Business Intelligence Tools
Pricing Structures
Promotional Recommendations and Analysis
Key Result Areas
Support the development and maintenance of marketing reporting:
Work cross-functionally within the marketing team, operations, and finance to perform analysis on various types of data such as sales, product mix, loyalty, and other marketing KPIs.
Track daily sales performance for LTO offerings and closely monitor sales vs forecast.
Perform post-mortem promotional analysis and compile recommendations for future promotional tactics.
Support in the building of comprehensive recaps of LTO and product drop performance and present findings to appropriate teams.
Support the Senior Manager of Customer Insights in the development and implementation of pricing strategy:
Perform elasticity analysis on items post-price increase.
Assist in the maintenance of the price change process.
Make recommendations on item-level pricing for future price increases.
Present findings from various sources and provide recommendations to leadership and other key stakeholders:
Prepare Reports and data-driven insights to the marketing team and key stakeholders.
Utilize statistical and analytical tools to interpret data and draw actionable conclusions.
Measure the ROI of promotional activities and make recommendations for improvement.
Identify trends and patterns in promotional data to optimize future campaigns.
Other duties as assigned

About Hearth
Hearth is a Fintech company helping home improvement contractors grow and manage their business. Our SaaS platform provides over 14,000 contractors the financial tools they need to close more business, including financing solutions, invoicing, payment collections, insurance products, all in one, modern system designed specifically for the home improvement industry.
Backed by 8VC, Founders Fund, and other prominent leaders in Silicon Valley, Hearth has raised over $50M and is one of the fastest growing companies in the home improvement space.

The Mission
To us, the home improvement contractor is a true embodiment of the American Dream – skilled craftspeople who choose to start their own business to build a better life for their families and their communities.
While home improvement professionals power a $500 billion per year industry and protect the homes of millions of Americans, they are typically overlooked by Wall Street and Silicon Valley, and are one of the most underserved, undercapitalized, and written-off segments of entrepreneurs.
We built Hearth to tip the odds of success in their favor. Hearth is a seamless digital toolkit that helps home improvement pros win more projects, grow their sales, and save time running their business. In the last six years, we’ve built an industry-leading technology platform (Financing, Payments, Quotes, Contracts, and Banking), work with over 15,000 contractors, and have funded over $500 million in additional projects for home improvement pros. And, we are just getting started.

Your Mission
Hearth is at an inflection point of growth and looking for the right individual to join our growing marketing team as a Growth Marketing Analyst.
The right archetype for this role is someone who is a scrappy, analytical, growth-minded professional who wants the training ground to become a CMO one day. The core focus of the role will be Growth Marketing and Analytics.
With mentorship from a world-class team (Affirm, Square, Bain&Co, Adobe), you’ll contribute to various marketing initiatives and have the opportunity for a substantial impact on company growth. The ideal candidate is a self-starter, with an appetite to learn and a genuine desire to help small business contractors.
Here's what you'll do:
Growth Marketing
Design, implement, and manage end-to-end integrated marketing campaigns to drive lead generation, customer engagement, and retention.
Serve as the “quarterback” for all growth marketing projects. Collaborate with Marketing, Sales/Revenue Operations, Data, Customer Service, Sales and Product teams
Recommend, test, and implement lead form and landing page experiments to unlock marketing efficiencies
Own the marketing pipeline (lead submission through sales) to improve lead quality and reduce acquisition costs.
Investigate and diagnose lead flow issues within lead forms, Marketo, Typeform, Salesforce, and our tech stack.
Marketing Analytics:
Own marketing reporting via weekly performance updates, driving insights, and managing marketing dashboards.
Partner with the Engineering/Data science team to iterate upon dashboards and provide additional views.
Drive ad hoc analysis of campaign performance, uncover insights, and propose optimization opportunities to drive growth
Here’s what we’re looking for:
Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, or Analytical related degree preferred
Proven experience (1 - 3+ years) in growth marketing and marketing analytics at an agency or technology company
Proficiency with BI tools such as Tableau, Looker, Mode, Excel, or Google Sheets
Strong analytical skills with the ability to analyze data, derive insights, and make data-driven decisions.
Experience with CRM platforms such as HubSpot, Marketo, Salesforce, or equivalent
Experience in maintaining data hygiene
Ability to manage multiple projects at the same time in a fast-paced environment.
Technically capable, excellent communicator, and a desire to improve processes.
Experience working within a SaaS company is a plus

Benefits:
Mission-driven, values-based culture.
Competitive pay.
Growth opportunities as we continue to grow and scale.
Generous PTO, plus paid company holidays.
Stock options.
Medical, dental, and vision options.
401(k) package.
Free Employee Assistance Program
Parental Leave Program
Pet Insurance
Location:
This role will be located in NYC along with the rest of the technical Hearth team, the CEO, and other key business roles. Hearth believes in the energy, connection, and serendipity of in-person/hybrid work culture (3+ days/week) for builders who are committed to building truly innovative software and making a significant positive impact in the world.
More About Us:
Hearth embraces diversity. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and do not discriminate on the basis of sex, race, color, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, citizenship, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
The pay range for this role is:
60,000 - 85,000 USD per year (New York)

Corporate Profile
SyBridge Technologies was established in 2019 by Crestview Partners to create a global technology leader that provides value-added design and manufacturing solutions across multiple industries. SyBridge is the combination of 15 acquisitions made to combine different products, services, and technologies into a singular technology-enabled solution. SyBridge is headquartered in Itasca, Illinois and has 18 locations throughout North America, Europe, and Asia. For more information, please visit www.SyBridge.com.

About Crestview Partners
Founded in 2004, Crestview is a value-oriented private equity firm focused on the middle market. The firm is based in New York and manages funds with approximately $10 billion of aggregate capital commitments. The firm is led by a group of partners who have complementary experience and backgrounds in private equity, finance, operations, and management. Crestview has senior investment professionals focused on sourcing and managing investments in each of the specialty areas of the firm: industrials, media, and financial services. For more information, please visit us at www.crestview.com.

Position Summary
As a Growth Marketing Analyst, you will be responsible for developing and executing strategic marketing initiatives aimed at driving customer acquisition, retention, and revenue growth for the SyBridge On Demand platform as well as upcoming SaaS offerings. This role requires a blend of analytical, creative, and strategic thinking to identify and capitalize on opportunities for expanding the company's market presence. The Growth Marketing Analyst reports to the Chief Growth Officer and sits on the growth team supporting the Digital Solutions division. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, leveraging data-driven insights to optimize marketing campaigns and enhance overall business performance.

Key Responsibilities:
Develop and implement comprehensive growth marketing strategies aligned with the growth objectives of the SyBridge Digital Solutions division.
Conduct market research to identify trends, competitive landscapes, and customer behavior.
Create and optimize multi-channel campaigns to acquire new customers for On Demand, Studio and other software offerings.
Utilize digital marketing channels such as SEO, SEM, social media, and email marketing to reach target audiences.
Implement A/B testing and other experimentation methodologies to optimize conversion rates.
Develop and execute retention strategies to increase customer loyalty and lifetime value.
Collaborate with the product team to enhance user experience and satisfaction.
Monitor, analyze, and report on key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success of growth marketing initiatives.
Use data-driven insights to make informed decisions and continually improve campaign performance.
Work closely with cross-functional teams, including sales, product development, and design, to align marketing strategies with overall business goals.
Collaborate with content creators to develop compelling and effective marketing collateral.
Implement and iterate on growth hacking tactics to discover new channels for customer acquisition.
Continuously test and optimize marketing campaigns to improve performance.

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field. MBA is a plus.
Minimum of 3 years scaling a fast growing e-commerce or SaaS platform.
Proven experience in a growth marketing or digital marketing role; specific knowledge and experience in growth hacking methods and tools required.
Strong highly creative with strong analytical skills and proficiency in data analysis tools.
Experience in designing, executing, and optimizing marketing campaigns across various channels and platforms.
Experience in conducting A/B testing, web optimization, conversion rate optimization, and funnel analysis.
Knowledge of various growth marketing tools and frameworks, such as automation, campaign monitoring platforms, CRM, SEO, etc.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

Our commitment to you…
SyBridge Technologies is an Equal Opportunity Employer and prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of any kind. We are committed to the attitude of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at SyBridge are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, National origin, veteran or disability status, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. SyBridge encourages applicants of all ages.

This position will require prolonged computer use, sitting for periods of time, and walking in a manufacturing facility. In accordance with Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA), SyBridge Technologies will provide accommodations when requested by the employee. When the employee becomes aware of any disabilities that would affect them from performing their duties, they will advise SyBridge Technologies if accommodation is required.

The Senior Database Marketing Analyst is responsible for execution, analysis and reporting of the direct mail channel. This role will act as liaison with external suppliers as well as internal partners. The ideal candidate must comfortablymanage a high volume and diverse workload with aggressive deadlines.
We are seeking candidates local to the Ewing, NJ (Greater Philadelphia area), as we are required to work in office part-time.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES, RESPONSIBILITIES and QUALIFICATIONS include the following. Other duties may be assigned.
Working with the Database Marketing Manager and Database Analystand other key members, execute Direct Mail campaigns on time according to published schedules.
Provide support in assembling Mailing Instructions for outside printers to support on-time mailings.
Work with all departments and team members to create and coordinate schedules and track all projects through the production process. Monitor issues within projects and assist in resolving project conflicts or issues.
Manage all projects to ensure that the end result exceeds expectations.
Assist in creation of Mailing Instructions (weekly by LOB) out of Portal providing outsourced printers with necessary information to execute campaigns.
Become expert in understanding the data paths for lists coming into the Portal = Customer Portfolios= Printers. In addition, how this information is available to run response analysis reports once mailings are live.
Ability to coordinate and manage multiple projects simultaneously, including ability to develop and manage project timelines. Ability to promptly absorb additional project(s) as delegated.
Take lead on analysis projects that will lead to OCM optimizing its mailing programs.
Demonstrate excellent decision making, organization, planning and problem-solving skills with proven ability to identify, prioritize, and escalate critical issues.

Run Daily Progress (KPI) Reports in Portal:
Daily List (Label) Counts for Gross Names Received and Net Names Yielded.
Track # Mailers sent for CRM/Sponsor Approval
Track # Mailers ready for Print
Provide reports for weekly DM Progress Meetings with: Merchandising, Client Relations, & Marketing.
Update Mail Tracker report to reflect actual drop dates and mail quantities.
Update MTT Tracking report to confirm sponsors have mailed and estimate postage liabilities.
Follow-up regularly with CRMs, Merchants, suppliers, and broader team to manage project schedules and deliverables to assure results are delivered on-time.
Run weekly response analysis reports on all active mailing campaigns.
Coordinate with Operations and other support staff to manage OBD extensions.
Update Portal with specific mailing information as needed.
Assist in managing and maintaining department calendar.
Assist Database Marketing Manager and Database Analystto troubleshoot and resolve production issues and exceptions to expectations.
