We are searching for a Performance Marketing Analyst to join this amazing dynamic team. The ideal candidate is self-motivated and curious with a passion for understanding the why. This individual will combine their passion with expertise in digital marketing analytics to optimize campaign targeting, measure performance, and drive overall marketing efficiency. The Performance Marketing Analyst will play a crucial role in supporting customer acquisition, increasing conversion rates, and optimizing marketing strategies through data-driven insights. This position requires the ability to communicate your methods and findings by speaking conversationally about the rationale behind assumptions and recommendations.
Key Responsibilities:
Campaign Optimization:
Analyze owned and paid media data to support the team in formulating campaign optimization strategies.
Utilize customer data from email, SMS, and customer databases to help draw conclusions and make actionable recommendations to improve customer lifetime value and company sales.
Leverage existing media mix modeling and partnerships to understand the relationship between our marketing inputs and outputs, and clearly articulate opportunities and risks.
Evaluate data to drive insights into conversion rates, customer acquisition, and other key performance goals.
Participate in the advancement of targeting techniques and strategies to strengthen customer relationships.
Actively contribute to marketing discussions to support hypothesis testing including test design, implementation, and analysis.
Forecasting:
Develop forecasting models to gauge growth trajectory, predict future marketing outcomes, and avoid oversaturating channels (segmentation, classification, propensity, LTV models).
Demonstrate expertise in modeling with the ability to help establish performance goals through historical analysis and communicated assumptions.
Budget Allocation:
Leverage forecasting ability to assist the marketing team in allocating budgets wisely based on analytical insights.
Identify growth opportunities and recommend strategic budget adjustments for optimal results to drive improved return on investment and efficient customer acquisition costs.
Reporting and Visualization:
Develop and maintain interactive reporting dashboards using existing reporting tools and Excel to communicate performance updates on key metrics and channels (i.e. paid, organic, and owned).
Collaborate with the team to understand reporting requirements and ensure the delivery of actionable insights.
Track and report customer segment performance.
Day to Day:
Collaborate with the team exploring, discussing, and ideating on results to identify forward-looking risks and opportunities.
Provide competitive information with insight as needed.
Offer ad-hoc analysis to help cross-functional teams better understand product trends by customer segment and the role of each product category in the customer journey supporting the identification of growth opportunities such as cross-selling, up-selling, and product gaps.

Experience/Requirements:
Bachelor's Degree required, Business, Finance, Marketing, Statistics, or a related field
Experience or desire to work in a small, fast-paced company where cross-functional partnerships are critical to driving a direct and tangible business impact
3+ years in an analysis role with experience in a retail/e-commerce business preferred
Experience working with marketing data, user growth and acquisition across consumer products is preferred
Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey complex data-driven findings to non-technical cross-functional team members and build cross-functional relationships
Solid understanding of model building and forecasting with experience in statistical analysis and tools a plus
High proficiency with Excel required with experience in systems such as NetSuite, Shopify, Google Analytics, Monetate, and Northbeam a strong plus
Proficiency in data visualization tools (i.e. Tableau, Power BI) and strong SQL skills a plus

We are looking for an experienced marketing analyst to join our team and to drive growth for our portfolio of clients. The role will be part of our analytics team which is the cornerstone for our entire service offering. As such, this role will have a direct impact on the marketing strategies of our clients.

At the strategic level, you will work with stakeholders to develop marketing strategies informed by data, as well as continually improve our company processes to deliver consistent results. Specifically, you will provide insights that drive growth that won't be necessarily readily evident without a deep analysis on the data.
At the tactical level, you will help validate new marketing angles alongside a creative team, analyze CRO experiments, and work with channel performance data to look for new opportunities. This requires you to have a strong understanding across a wide variety of marketing channels (paid search, paid social, organic search, earned media, influencers/affiliates, video, display, and shopping ads). You will be responsible for delivering both ad-hoc and scheduled reporting, as well as performing in-depth analysis for key marketing initiatives that cover 7-figure ad buys.

Note: This position is opened only to United States of America residents.
The below are some traits and experience we believe are necessary for this role:
Ability to think on your feet. You can answer ad-hoc questions from clients with confidence and are able to support your answers with data.
* Data driven and passion for analytics. You love solving puzzles and teasing out trends/insights from datasets.
* Excel Fanatic. You love using Excel. You have an innate ability to organize data in an effective way to highlight the insight you've uncovered.
* Strong attention to details. You are intimately aware that the devil is in the details and have a proven track record demonstrating this skill.
* Strategic thought process and results oriented. You tackle issues with sensibility and always see things to the end. You are goal oriented and are tactful in achieving results.
* Excellent written and verbal communication. You can easily simplify a complex topic and you are able to use a variety of different methods to convey your message (including the effective use of charts).
* Have a high standard of excellence that borders on perfection, while being pragmatic enough to deliver results. While you love data and can provide deep insights, you understand the fine balance between over-analysis and delivering results.
* Are a lifelong learner, and a high sense of curiosity. You have a growth mindset and keep up with digital trends so you always stay one step ahead.
* Have a sense of humbleness. While you may be excellent at what you do, when it comes to tackling issues, you are open-minded and have a sense of humility.
Note: This position is opened only to United States of America residents.

Some of the experience you have:
* Undergraduate degree in a quantitative field or work experience in lieu.
* Digital marketing background with at least 2 years of direct experience in ecommerce, either in an agency or brand role.
* 1 or more years of working with: Google Analytics, and the reporting elements of Google Ads and Facebook Ads.
* Prior experience providing reporting to executive teams. This includes developing presentations using Microsoft Office or Google Slides.
* Deep understanding of the digital media ecosystem and analytics (e.g. multi-touch attribution models).

We value you and what you bring to the table so we offer:
* Competitive salaries.
* Full benefits package including medical, dental, and vision.

* Fully remote work
* Career Evolution: Join us, and we will give you the tools to achieve your career goals!

Our Values

* We prioritise high-impact actions.
* We apply judgment on:
* When to get involved and when to get out of the way.
* When to be an independent problem solver and when to ask for help.

Woodstream has a rich history of over 150 years, and we are an essential, life sustaining business. We provide pest & animal control products that destroy disease carrying insects & rodents. We provide a safe work environment including screening, social distancing, and sanitation processes.

We have an immediate opportunity for a Trade Marketing Analyst in Lancaster, PA

Bonus Program
401k with Company Match

Overview of the Role:

As the Trade Marketing Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in driving the success of our consumer products through effective trade marketing strategies. You will be responsible for creating and analyzing sales data and making recommendations to aid business objectives. The ideal candidate will understand the consumer goods industry, sales and analytical skills.
Trade Marketing is a lead function with WOODSTREAM, responsible for Defining, Designing and Delivering the go to market strategy for our leading portfolio of brands. This entails developing the sales materials (presentations, demo’s, samples etc.,) and supporting the sales team by attending key calls with the top accounts as the brand/category expert.
Trade Marketing is responsible for tracking the performance of brands and innovation to quickly identify the opportunities and then working with the sales and brand marketing teams on a day-to-day basis to optimize/overdrive.
Finally Trade Marketing is the custodian of the 4P strategy and is responsible for driving LSM compliance across specified retailer/channels.
DEFINING It is the responsibility of Trade Marketing to then turn these insights into a Category Growth Platform (CGP) that set out a compelling vision for our retail partners and a clear roadmap for internal stake holders on what it will take to win in the market. Defining the go-market-strategy means working closely with our consumer Marketing and Product Development Teams to identify the key insights that will shape channel, category, and brand dynamics over the coming 12-24 months.
To excel in this facet of the role, the incumbents must have a strong analytical skills and an ability to quickly learn and understand the category growth drivers (trade in, trade up etc).
DESIGNING the go to market strategy means developing guidelines in the form of a Local Success Model (LSM) that provide in each channel with clear rules for engagement on each 4P. These LSMs need to be rooted in shopper and consumer understanding and deliver category growth for our retailers and both share growth and financial return for WOODSTREAM.

Specific Responsibilities:
The Trade Marketing Analyst must understand reading, pulling, and analyzing data. The Trade Marketing Analyst will be responsible for the in delivery of;
Develop and own reporting and dashboards to be used by the trade marketing team & sales team to enable them to proactively identify risks and opportunities
Track distribution and pricing changes by customer
Analyze new item performance by customer to enable sharing of best practices
Pull Panel information to understand the shopper behavior to enable the trade strategies
Support the Trade Marketing Managers and Vice President of Trade Marketing with sales materials
Work closely with diverse cross-functional team
Successful Candidate Profile:
Bachelors in a business related field.
1-2 years of experience in business
Proficient in Excel
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Woodstream Fun Facts!
We are the #1 EAC (Electronic Animal Containment/fencing) company in North America, 10X the #2 company and these products protect our food supply.
We are the ONLY Pest & Animal Control company with a significant ESG (Environmental, Social & Governance) Program.
Over 40% of our directors and above are woman.
57% of the Executive Team (meaning VP and above) are female, black, Hispanic or Asian/Islander.

We are currently seeking qualified candidates for a Digital Marketing Analyst to support the efforts of the retail Digital Marketing and Sales teams across our brand portfolio. This role aligns with a corporate strategic initiative to drive digital transformation, to drive sales and profit on our websites, and to attract and retain our target consumer (varies by brand). This position will focus on defining and measuring results against goals and providing channel and campaign-specific reporting, analysis, and recommendations to maximize our investment. Experience in multi-channel marketing campaign measurement is a must. Additionally, this position will be responsible for managing various internal and external partnerships related to data structure, measurement, integrity, security, and the sharing of customized information.
Responsibilities of the position include:
Support the Digital Marketing and retail sales teams in continuous improvement activities by way of reporting, analysis, and recommendations that allow us to maximize our investment to reach and convert consumers to our brands and products.
Regularly track progress to key performance indicators and provide ideas and recommendations to drive improvement.
Analyze website profitability (shipping subsidies, promotions, affiliate commissions, new products vs. factory recertified vs. parts, etc.) and share recommended adjustments to increase sales volume and profitability.
Advance the use of data in the decision-making process.
Manage relationships with data analytics providers to ensure accuracy and relevancy across a variety of audiences.
In partnership with IT, help map the future of digital marketing analytics, ensuring alignment with internal systems and security protocols.
Conduct regular and ad-hoc research (e.g. brand audiences, customer journeys, search term analysis, competitive benchmarking, content trends, measurement tactics, etc.) and share learnings with team members as appropriate.
Requirements of the position include:
A Bachelor’s Degree (preferably in Communications, Marketing, or Website Development with a focus on Marketing).
At least 3-5 years of proven experience in multi-channel digital marketing campaign measurement to include ecommerce, social media, email, and digital advertising.
Proven experience using UTM tracking and Google Analytics (UA and GA4) for eCommerce websites. Google Tag Manager and Google Search Console are a strong plus.
Demonstrated knowledge of DTC ecommerce models particularly as a brand selling on its own site and on retailer sites (such as Amazon).
Advanced computer skills, analytical skills, and attention to detail, including knowledge of advanced Excel functionality (Tableau and Power Bi experience a plus).
Ability to organize and process large amounts of information and data.
Good communications skills (verbal and written) & proven ability to work in a team environment.

Insurance is a trillion dollar market that is fundamental to society, yet it has not modernized — until now.

Newfront is building the modern insurance experience.

We've reimagined the experience for clients, prospects, and employees, altering the way people create, understand, select, transact, and use insurance. We're changing the approach so that it starts and ends with the client, not the product, and empowering people for moments that matter.

Our unique approach recognizes both the vast potential of technology and the fundamental role of insurance experts. We're a technology-driven company with DE&I in our DNA and strong values; we believe people matter most.

Our mission is to define the future of the insurance industry, while instilling a high performance culture in combination with living our Work, Love, Play ethos each day. The Benefits Marketing Analyst will support the service teams in creating communication materials for Carrier & Vendor Partners and partner with the service team to ensure that all client initiatives are executed precisely and flawlessly.

This position is a salaried, exempt and full-time role and will be reporting to the Data Analytics Research & Development Lead. This is a US Hybrid/Remote role, with the option to work from any of Newfront’s offices. #LI-Remote


WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING
Partner with sales and service teams to understand the client’s goals leading into the RFP process.
Complete the carrier/vendor marketing process from conception to completion for clients of all sizes with varying lines of coverage and funding types.
Be engaged and aware of the latest product offered by carriers.
Organize client census and plan design information to send to carriers.
Review carrier proposals for accuracy and completeness.
Summarize RFP responses into a client ready presentation.
Work with General Agent (GA) partners for small group marketing process outsourcing.
Other tasks, duties, or specialist projects as assigned.
To perform this position successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform these essential functions.
WHAT YOU BRING TO THE TABLE
Efficient at multi-tasking and flexibility to deal with ever-changing priorities and deadlines.
Effective negotiation skills with internal and external stakeholders.
Exceptional communication: written, public speaking and presentation preparation.
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail. Must be able to screen details and identify potential discrepancies.
Exceptional customer service skills, diplomacy, professionalism, and tact.
Proficient knowledge and use of Microsoft Office and advance complexities of features.
Ability to be resourceful, take initiative, solve problems, create solutions, and manage process improvements.
Thrives at working with others in a fast-paced environment and is responsive to co-workers and colleagues. Ability to train, delegate, provide oversight and give feedback.
Adaptability and flexibility to proactively anticipate and address issues and client needs.
Exceptional time management skills and the ability to navigate demanding schedules, priorities, and volumes.
Ability to learn, adopt and train use of technology systems and software applications.
Proficient at strategic project planning including extended time management.
Ability to forge relationships and build trust with clients, carriers, and internal stakeholders.
Ability to provide direction, give feedback and coach others within team.
Active participation as an Newfront team member, suggesting improvements in processes and procedures and ways to make the organization better.
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE
Minimum of 3 years of carrier / vendor marketing experience within the employee benefits industry.
Insurance industry background or and knowledge of group products required.
Must continue to meet continuing education requirements for CA Department of insurance license renewal.
CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATION
CA Department of Insurance Life License (required or completed within 3 months of start date).

Position Summary: The Senior Marketing Analyst is designed to support marketing campaign management, reporting and analytics needs. The ideal candidate has strong analytical skills, enjoys diving into data, is capable to translate business questions into comprehensive reporting tools and has strong project management skills. We are looking for someone who is passionate about data, very detail-oriented and extremely organized who works well together with various very different groups, whether it’s sales or IT, to develop, build, track and report our initiatives. The candidate must be a self-starter, comfortable in the mortgage industry and able to think outside the box. Responsibilities:
Gather and manipulate larger data sets using SQL (SSMS), Alteryx and Tableau or Power BI to support the performance marketing team
Assists and builds reporting suites and presentations that provide actionable insights for marketing, operations, and executive dashboards.
Develops and implements new initiatives, monitors, and analyzes performance, and brings new ideas to improve the company’s KPIs.
Support and manage traffic and lead tracking and reporting on loanDepot.com, use 3rd party services and various API tools to bring and deliver data between internal sources and external partners (i.e. TapClicks, Zapier)
Presents data in front of and interacts with senior management on a regular basis.
Collaborates with other parts of the organization such as lead engineering, DBA or business (Sales) to enable the execution of various projects.
Ensures accuracy of QA/QC data and report outputs.
Manages multiple projects concurrently and adjusts priorities according to business needs.
Performs other duties and projects as assigned.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree in Economics, Computer Science, Business, Finance or any relevant field or study (i.e. equivalent training or certifications) required.
Minimum of five (5) + years’ experience in data manipulation and analysis required.
Minimum of two (2) + years’ experience in mortgage, banking insurance or any other financial related industry.
Experience with marketing performance metrics, web analytics, GA
Experience with data ETL process, 3rd party API data transfer process preferred.
Experience with SSMS, Tableau, Power BI required.
Experience with Salesforce, Microsoft Dynamics 365, Alteryx preferred.
Experience with online and offline marketing campaigns & performance tracking; previous experience with Direct Mail is a plus
Experience with one or more marketing channels: direct mail, lead aggregator, digital
Required expertise in SQL, relational databases, data warehousing, and process automation
Experience in working with data visualization tools such as Tableau, building complex reports and dashboards for various audiences
Strong project management skills with ability to handle multiple projects, to bring and keep collaboration teams on schedule
Alteryx, Phyton, Google Analytics (or equivalent) skills highly desirable.
Financial services, mortgage, lending industry experience preferred

Job Description
Marketing Analyst
Analytics | Santa Clara, CA (hybid)

The organization: Customer Analytics
The Customer Analytics team is central to Chegg – we use data and analyses to support every business line and the marketing and product organizations. We are a team composed of analysts, data scientists, economists, mathematicians, statisticians and engineers. Our group is part of the larger data organization at Chegg that focuses on enabling data and insights at scale. We use a world-class set of instrumentation, analysis and data science technologies to transform our data into insights and then into knowledge. While the analytics group is centralized, we heavily partner with our stakeholders to ensure insights delivered are directly usable for decision making and ultimately add value to Chegg. In short, we are a diverse team who absolutely love working with data to help Chegg deliver on our Student First mission!
The role: Marketing Analyst
We are looking for a Marketing Analyst to help support the overall marketing strategy and operations at Chegg. You will anticipate and analyze the conversion funnel performance. You will partner with the marketing, product, and business teams to guide key decisions based on your analyses and insights. You will present recommendations for effective user acquisition/retention to key marketing and other stakeholders. Key to the role is having the curiosity, domain expertise and technical skills to understand and quantify efforts that impact user acquisition and retention. Working with other Analytics team members, you will balance multiple analytics efforts with several organizations, leveraging innovative problem-solving methods to deliver key insights that drive new user growth, longer retention and better student experience.
Responsibilities
Partner closely with marketing and other teams across the organization to identify impactful business problems, translate them into structured analyses, actionable insights, and over time, analytic models, reports, and dashboards for scalable monitoring.
Partner with marketing and other teams to forecast the conversion funnel performance, analyze issues/opportunities within conversion funnel, and support the teams as necessary to resolve/implement them.
Use exploratory data analysis techniques to quickly identify meaningful relationships, patterns, or trends that help stakeholders understand marketing performance and emerging business opportunities and risks.
Present analyses and recommendations to a wide audience, including senior business stakeholders and company-wide execs.
Collaborate with other analysts/data scientists to provide recommendations based on collective learning across various analytics efforts in the organization.
Requirements
3+ years of previous experience in Analytics in a B2C company and in an enterprise, data-driven environment
Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field (e.g. engineering, sciences, math, statistics, business or economics) required. Master's degree in a quantitative field preferred.
Must have strong SQL and data manipulation skills.
Experience with one or more databases like Redshift, Postgres, etc.
Experience with root cause analyses and predictive modeling
Experience creating dashboards and key metrics. Familiarity with BI platforms such as Tableau a plus
Experience in web analytics platforms such as Amplitude, Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics or others a plus
Proven ability to question data, assumptions and tactics, develop an analytic approach, and deploy a variety of techniques such as trend analysis, customer segmentation and A/B tests to guide strategy and operational decision-making
Self-motivated, independent, organized and proactive, highly responsive, flexible and adaptable when working across multiple teams
Passionate about producing high-quality analytics deliverables and communicating results to a broad audience
Ability to prioritize and deliver within a fast-paced, dynamic environment
The pay range for this position is $90,537 to $168,141. The actual pay will vary based on geographic location, job requirements, professional experience, and other factors.
In addition, Chegg offers a comprehensive benefits plan for eligible employees, including medical, dental, vision, life and supplemental life insurance, short-and long-term disability, mental health support, parental leave, paid time off, volunteer time off, paid holidays, 401(k) with matching contributions, Flexible Spending Account (FSA) and Health Savings Account (H.S.A.) options, an Employee Stock Purchase Plan, an Employee Referral Program, Tuition Reimbursement, and other benefits found at:
https://www.chegg.com/about/working-at-chegg/benefits/
."

Why do we exist?
Students are working harder than ever before to stabilize their future. Our recent research study called
State of the Student
shows that nearly 3 out of 4 students are working to support themselves through college and 1 in 3 students feel pressure to spend more than they can afford. We founded our business on provided affordable textbook rental options to address these issues. Since then, we’ve expanded our offerings to supplement many facets of higher educational learning through Chegg Study, Chegg Math, Chegg Writing, Chegg Internships, Thinkful Online Learning, and more to support students beyond their college experience. These offerings lower financial concerns for students by modernizing their learning experience. We exist so students everywhere have a smarter, faster, more affordable way to student.

Company Overview

Bitchin’ Sauce is one of the fastest-growing food brands in the United States. The brand has exploded onto the consciousness of taste-forward consumers because of a remarkably healthy and shockingly tasty product that people cannot stop dipping, spreading, and smothering on their favorite foods. Bitchin’ Sauce is made from raw, California almonds and is Gluten-Free, Vegan, Kosher, Project Non-GMO Certified, and is totally Bitchin’. First introduced in the San Diego farmers markets, Bitchin' Sauce has single-handedly pioneered the nut-based dip category and is transforming eating. The company has grown from a small ragtag crew in the farmer’s markets to over 80 employees with distribution to over 17,000 major retailers nationwide. Our award-winning dips are available in healthy grocers and in major retailers such as Whole Foods Market, Sprouts, Costco, Safeway/Vons, and Target. The Bitchin' Team is made up of a bunch of scrappy, problem-solvers with an uncompromising commitment to delivering taste, quality, and excellence in all we do. Authenticity is not a poster on the wall, it’s simply the reality at Bitchin’ Sauce – always has been…always will be. We share a common vision of spreading a totally Bitchin' lifestyle and find every opportunity to use our skills and resources to give
back to people and the community. Nothing makes us happier than helping each other discover our personal strengths and utilizing them within our company.
Job Purpose

As a Marketing Analyst, you will be responsible for interpreting data, analyzing results, and providing actionable insights to drive marketing strategies and campaigns. You will collaborate closely with cross- functional teams to optimize marketing efforts, enhance customer acquisition and retention, and maximize return on investment (ROI).
Duties and Responsibilities

Generate actionable insights and recommendations to improve marketing ROI, customer acquisition, retention, and engagement.
Conduct thorough analysis of marketing data, including campaign performance, customer behavior, market trends, and competitor activities.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key performance indicators (KPIs) and provide updates Weekly, Monthly, Quarterly, and Annually.
Utilize statistical techniques and predictive modeling to identify patterns, trends, and opportunities for optimization.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and execute experiments and A/B tests to evaluate the efficacy of marketing strategies and tactics.
Assist in the development of marketing plans and budgets based on data-driven insights and market analysis.
Stay informed about industry developments, emerging trends, and best practices in marketing analytics.
Closely monitor tactic spend and return-revenue goals, adhering to targets set during annual & quarterly planning.
Curious and strategic mindset.
Relentless determination and creativity.
Other tasks as they may be assigned from time to time.
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree preferred.
Experience in the consumer goods industry preferably in Shopper Marketing, E-Commerce, Digital Marketing, Brand or Trade Management.
Prior experience leveraging consumer insights to develop effective marketing programs and campaigns.
Experience analyzing and deriving insights from Syndicated Data, Panel Data, Google Analytics.
Experience with project management.
Strong written and oral communication skills and experience with Microsoft Office Suite.
Adaptable to evolving environments and can take direction from multiple people.
Ability to quickly learn and navigate several internal processes, procedures, and vendor systems.
Positive attitude when faced with challenges, and have a warm, supportive, and enthusiastic mentality when leading our Specialists & Ambassadors.
Ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced startup environment, and are ready to wear multiple hats as needed.

Working Conditions

The Employee will be responsible for time sensitive tasks that may require specific working hours.
The Employee is expected to work in a full-time capacity.
Overnight traveling maybe be required several times a year.
The Employee must be prepared to stand from six to twelve hours a day and lift up to 60 pounds while at events.

Bitchin’ Benefits
Healthcare - coverage for employees + dependents
401k - up to 4% match
Paid Time Off - 10 paid holidays + additional vacation time
Volunteer Time Off - time off to volunteer in the community.
Please be advised that as part of our interview process for each position, in accordance with California labor laws, candidates may be asked to undergo skills testing to assess their suitability.
Bitchin' Sauce, LLC is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state, or local laws.
This policy applies to all employment practices within our organization, including hiring, recruiting, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, leave of absence, compensation, benefits, training, and apprenticeship. Bitchin' Sauce, LLC makes hiring decisions based solely on qualifications, merit, and business needs at the time.
Have a Bitchin’ day!

Hi there! We're WebFX, a full-service digital marketing agency based in the US. We've been named the Best Place To Work in Pennsylvania 9 times in a row and we'd love to meet you! We are a fast-growing company that has doubled in size over the past 5 years, with talented team members now based around the globe (and representing 18+ different countries!). While we are growing at a rapid rate, we are committed to growing strategically and sustainably, and that starts with growing our team of the #BestCoworkers - that’s where you come in!

We're looking for people to join our mission to provide world-class digital marketing solutions to mid-size businesses around the world. We are passionate about what we do, we’re committed to driving business growth for our clients, and we’re on the hunt for people just like you, who take pride in their work and want to be part of a company that does too.

In This Role, You’ll Get To…

Work directly with a portfolio of clients as their direct point of contact at WebFX, educating them through clear communication, and helping them achieve their goals
Work to maintain our world-class client retention rate by developing and fostering long-lasting client relationships
Analyze performance data (in Google Analytics and MarketingCloudFX) and prepare monthly digital marketing campaign reports
Develop appropriate SEO strategies and action plans/optimizations based on data

-Perform research to ensure client success - think keyword research, competitor analysis, and everything in between

Manage the ideation, planning, and execution efforts of CRO special projects and champion CRO best practices for clients
Perform A/B, website usability, and website conversion rate testing to determine what works best for your client and provide recommendations accordingly
Interpret web analytics, demographic data, market research, and buyer behaviors, and generate and execute strategies as they relate to findings
'Get your hands dirty’ and get into the backend of client websites to correct errors and technical issues and implement content

A Typical ‘Day in the Life’ Might Consist of:

10% working in the backend of websites/fixing technical issues/implementing content
10% creating reports for client campaigns
15% analyzing data and identifying deliverables
25% communicating with clients
30% executing on SEO and PPC strategies with regular optimizations
100% pursuing your own personal best while delivering real-world impact for our clients!

We are looking for a Digital Marketing Apprentice to join our team. This is a remote position, eligible to candidates within the US. This apprenticeship offers the perfect opportunity to launch your career in marketing. You’ll receive 6 months of hands-on experience filled with ample opportunities to expand your leadership skills, facilitate your professional development, and master key digital marketing tools and techniques.
Compensation for this apprenticeship is $15/hour.
Training
Our training program includes three components that combine to accelerate your learning opportunities and career growth.
Pairing with a senior digital strategist – Weekly one-on-one meetings with an experienced marketer to guide your learning and get your questions answered.
Hands-on work with our clients – You will work directly with our brand name or startup clients, delivering analytical market research and digital campaign management services.
Learning materials and certifications – Our structured curriculum is designed to help you acquire the knowledge you need to excel as a digital marketing analyst. Specific learning objectives: web analytics, search engine optimization, written/oral communication, content marketing, market research and Amazon marketing.
Requirements
You must be available to work 40 hours/week for a minimum of 6 months.
We accept both undergraduate candidates, in addition to candidates who are 1-2 years out of school.
We look for applicants who are detail-oriented with phenomenal communication skills (written and verbal).
If you like working with numbers in Excel to figure out what they mean then explaining your findings to a client, you might thrive in our apprenticeship. Our ideal candidate has the skill set of an investigative journalist — they work hard to uncover the facts, figure out what they mean and explain the findings to others.
When
We review applications on a rolling basis so feel free to submit your application at any time during the year.
Culture
We love what we do. Our team is looking for apprentices who are passionate about learning digital marketing and enthusiastic about applying analytical methods to digital campaigns that benefit our clients.
We live our core values every day:

About the Opportunity:
We are rapidly growing our digital capabilities to serve the needs of our global customers including health clubs, luxury hotels and apartment complexes, as well as high-end home gyms. We are seeking a talented and detail-oriented Digital Marketing Data Analyst to join our marketing team. The ideal candidate will be adept at collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data to provide actionable insights that drive informed marketing strategies. As a Digital Marketing Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in optimizing marketing performance, eCommerce performance, enhancing customer experiences, and contributing to data-informed decision-making across the organization.
If you are a data-driven professional with a passion for marketing analytics and a knack for turning data into actionable recommendations, we invite you to apply to join our team and contribute to the success of our marketing efforts.
**this is a hybrid position based out of our Global HQ in Rosemont, IL - M/F remote and T-Th are in-office collaboration days** #LI-Hybrid

WHAT YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:
Data Collection and Processing:
Gather, clean, and organize marketing data from various sources, including eCommerce platforms, Business Intelligence platforms, CRM, marketing automation platforms, and databases.
Ensure data accuracy and completeness, collaborating with other teams to streamline data collection processes.
Data Analysis and Interpretation:
Conduct in-depth analysis of marketing campaigns, customer behavior—both online and offline, and other relevant metrics.
Interpret data trends, patterns, and anomalies to provide insights into marketing performance, eCommerce performance and identify areas for improvement.
Reporting and Visualization:
Generate regular reports and dashboards to communicate key performance indicators (KPIs) and trends to marketing and leadership teams, with special focus on our generation of Marketing Qualified Leads (MQLs) and their generation of qualified Opportunities and Closed Won business.
Utilize data visualization tools to present complex information in a clear and accessible manner to educate Marketing, Sales and Executive teams.
Marketing Strategy Support:
Collaborate with digital marketing team to understand their objectives and provide data-driven recommendations for campaign optimization for both Demand Generation and eCommerce related campaigns.
Assist in the development and evaluation of marketing strategies based on data insights.
A/B Testing and Experimentation:
Design and implement A/B tests and experiments to optimize marketing campaigns, messaging, and targeting.
Analyze and report on the results of experiments to inform future marketing initiatives.
Continuous Learning and Innovation:
Stay informed about industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in marketing analytics.
Proactively explore new data sources and analytical tools to enhance the depth and accuracy of marketing insights.
WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR IN YOU (QUALIFICATIONS):
Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Statistics, Data Science, or a related field.
3-4+ years experience as a Marketing Data Analyst or similar role.
Proficient in data analysis tools such as SQL, Excel, and statistical software as well as Salesforce object query language.
Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms.
Proficient in programming languages. Python preferred or R is acceptable.
Experience with data cleaning, hygiene and modeling techniques.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills to convey complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience with Salesforce CRM, Pardot, Shopify, Oracle Business Intelligence a plus.
Expertise in Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, and reporting within Google Ads, Facebook Ads and other relevant digital advertising platforms.

As a Search Marketing Analyst, you’ll manage the tactical components within integrated Search Engine Marketing (SEM) campaigns, more commonly known as Paid Search, or Pay-per-Click (PPC). Working with Google, Microsoft, and Yahoo (among others), you’ll assist with the strategy, planning and reporting for our clients.
Holistic SEM program management including keywords development, ad creative and strategy, trafficking recommendations, optimizing program towards key business goals and reporting
Actively participating in meetings and proactively documenting takeaways and next steps
Assimilating data from multiple sources, compiling the information and drawing actionable conclusions that can be measured and reported
Bid strategy optimization and testing. Daily checks on program KPIs, thresholds and campaign budget caps. Ongoing management of budget and pacing.
Translating campaign/client goals into SEM tactics and effectively executing those tactics against the client’s strategy
Implementing Paid Search best practices, providing refinement and optimization recommendations and proactively identifying campaign execution issues
Monitoring emerging industry trends and summarizing them for internal and external stakeholders
Leveraging and developing proficiencies with SEM platforms, tools and resources
Developing campaign ad copy (text-based titles and descriptions or feed-based images) and tagging traffic or creative elements to sites per creative rotation instructions
Help develop performance forecasts, budget allocations and providing data-based rationale for these recommendations
Collaborating with both clients and internal cross-channel colleagues by providing reporting as requested in a concise and timely fashion
Fostering relationship with internal teams (SEM, S&A and other capabilities), external partners and clients

Qualifications
A four-year degree, preferably 1 to 2 years analytical or digital marketing experience; exposure to SEM a plus
Strong ability to work closely with your team to problem solve, prioritize tasks, and manage time effectively
A detail-oriented approach and a desire to achieve objectives accurately
Solid quantitative and research skills, and proven data interpretation capability
Familiarity with the digital advertising space and a passion for growing that interest into a career
Strong communication skills – you’re clear and thorough, yet concise
A passion for building relationships and a desire to contribute to team building and event planning
Exudes confidence and won’t hesitate to connect with folks throughout the organization to get the job done right
Got what it takes? We’d love to hear from you.

As a Marketing Analyst, you will play a crucial role in supporting the marketing efforts within the organization. You will use the insights you find to help ddm and our clients make better business decisions – like increasing revenue or optimizing marketing campaigns. You will be responsible for collecting and interpreting research about market trends, customer experience, competitors’ activities, and marketing strategies for our company and our clients. Your duties include identifying target audiences, gathering web analytics, and providing actionable recommendations to drive toward determined KPIs.

Your primary function: Marketing Analyst

Your roles to support that function:
Compile and analyze marketing data
Provide actionable insights to drive client success
Build marketing dashboards
Provide regular reporting
Troubleshoot and maintain marketing data
Develop, own, and manage analytic and reporting processes
Specific duties and responsibilities to support your roles:
Analyze marketing metrics for effect/cause relationships between outcomes and marketing activities.
Help determine marketing KPIs and work with other internal departments to ensure accurate tracking.
Serve as the subject matter expert on analytics for clients by understanding business goals and providing plans for consistent analysis and reporting of marketing data.
Scope, build, and maintain dashboards to visualize marketing performance.
Mine and analyze data to identify key trends, segments, and associations.
Identify potential testing opportunities to optimize marketing activities.
Effectively communicate performance and recommendations to internal and external stakeholders.
Work cross-departmentally to create a holistic view of marketing analytics for clients.
Manage data sources and troubleshoot to ensure data integrity.
Provide proactive solutions based on data analysis.
Support department teams with regular reporting needs such as monthly media campaign reporting.

Professional skills and qualifications needed for consideration:
4+ years of experience in marketing analytics
BA degree in relevant field, such as marketing, statistics, or business.
Strong experience with Google Analytics 4. Experience with Mixpanel and Google Tag Manager is a plus.
Highly proficient in data manipulation through Microsoft Excel.
Proficient in data visualization platforms such as Looker Studio, Tableau, and Power BI.
Familiarity with marketing tools such as CRMs (Salesforce, Hubspot, etc.), marketing automation platforms (Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Hubspot, Marketo, Pardot, etc.), media platforms (Meta, TikTok, LinkedIn, Hootsuite, etc.), and other tools (SEMRush, Monsido, Cision, etc.).

Proficient in problem-solving and critical thinking, with the ability to analyze situations, evaluate information, and devise effective recommendations.
Strong understanding of business and marketing strategies, the customer journey, and marketing channels.

Company: AMEN CLINICS, INC., A MEDICAL CORPORATION
Job Description:
The Marketing-Customer Insights Analyst position is responsible for the measurement, analysis, and reporting of marketing activities and customer behaviors-trends across all strategic channels and digital platforms. Reporting to the Marketing Director, the Digital Marketing Analyst is responsible for collecting, analyzing, and reporting on website and marketing data regarding customers, markets, competitors, web behavior and campaign effectiveness through the user journey.
This newly-created position requires a strong background in web metrics, tracking and reporting. The ideal candidate will have experience looking at multiple channels to interpret and present findings in a clear and concise way to support business decisions. The ideal candidate is a passionate team player that thrives by working in a collaborative fashion through open communication and participating as an active member of the team. Elevate the effectiveness of leads, sales, and marketing programs (organic and paid media efforts) through better measurement, and analysis. The goal will be to understand ROI and understand what media campaigns are working or not working so we can adjust campaigns and efforts to gain more effective results.
The ideal candidate will possess strong knowledge and experience with Salesforce, multi-touch attribution, SQL database, Python coding, and data-visualization tools, such as Tableau, Power BI, or Qlik. This candidate should also be a passionate team player with the ability to work both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative fast-paced, results-driven environment.

Who We Are:
Amen Clinics is one of the largest and most respected mental health private practices in the country. Our team is composed of the country’s most talented psychiatrists, psychologists, psychotherapists, and compassionate healers. Our marketing team works in a collaborative environment and are passionate about mental health.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Standardized Reporting: Work with internal stakeholders to determine ongoing business intelligence needs in order to design, develop and produce ongoing reports and dashboards to support the business.
Campaign Analysis: Provide ROI analysis of all online marketing campaigns with predefined key performance indicators, including understating the consumer journey and how many touchpoints it takes on average to book an appointment. The ideal candidate has expertise working with multiple channels, including Paid Search, Facebook and other Social Media Channels, Programmatic Display and Native Advertising, Pre-Roll, Social Display, Email Marketing (Listrak & Klaviyo) and Call Tracking (Invoca) Platforms.
Test Design and Analysis: Work with Marketing Director and team to create a solid test design that will produce statistically sound, actionable results. Ideal candidate has Conversion Rate Optimization [CRO] experience with hands-on experience leading website, landing page, and performance marketing A/B and multivariate testing optimization efforts for all organic and paid digital channels
Web Analytics: In addition to setting up standard web reports, the ideal candidate will continually mine Google Analytics for nuggets of information and insights to improve website performance.
Competitor Analysis: Conduct market research to analyze the competitive landscape, determine brand perceptions, identify new market opportunities.
Set up and Manage Tracking Mechanisms: Work with web developers to implement new tracking tools and ensure they are working properly on an ongoing basis.
Qualifications and Requirements:
Experienced in Salesforce, SQL (Structured Query Language) and Python Coding.
Possess strong knowledge and experience with multi-touch attribution (e.g. allocating credit to every touchpoint in the consumer journey, across marketing and advertising channels and tactics, and determining influence on driving a conversion event).
Experienced with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, MODE, DOMO and SQL database tools.
Proficient in Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics as well as experience running reports in Google Ads, Facebook, Native & Programmatic Tools, etc.
Experience analyzing data from WordPress, Listrak, Klayvio (or a similar ESP), and enterprise resource planning software
Ideal candidate will also have a strong understanding of Invoca Call Tracking, Chat, and EHR and EMR Medical Health Software System (e.g. Best Notes)
Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and big data technologies
Proven track record of successfully implementing and deploying data models and AI solutions in real-world applications.
Strong proficiency in statistical analysis, machine learning, and AI algorithms, with expertise in various techniques such as regression, classification, clustering, deep learning, and natural language processing (NLP).
Bachelor’s Degree with 4+ years’ marketing analytics experience
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Ability to articulate learning to the team in laymen’s terms.
Excellent organizational, planning and project and time management skills.

Work closely with sales and marketing teams to identify opportunities.

Marketing Analyst Responsibilities:
Conduct deep market research, analyze insights, and distill key company and leadership intel into concise reports for sales and marketing team use, through data mining and scientific investigation.

Responsible for tracking, analyzing, and reporting of demand generation outreach performance and success, and present to sales and marketing teams.

Understand and take an active role in improving marketing strategy and campaign practices, mining for emerging trends, efficiencies, and automations that advance our campaign efforts and ensure the messages are delivered accurately and properly to current and prospective customers.

Marketing Analyst Qualifications:
Associate or Bachelor’s degree in Marketing or Communications
2+ years of experience; experience in a B2B SaaS support role a plus.
Strong computer, scientific, analytical, and organizational skills.
Informed on market trends and how to build and maintain a competitive landscape.
Detail orientated with excellent oral and written communication skills.
Self-motivated, adaptable, collaborative, curious, and has a positive attitude.
Comfortable serving in a liaison and advocate role; and interacting with varying levels of stakeholders.

No agencies please

Job Title: Jr. Digital Communications Account Manager -Fort Myers, FL
Job Description:
We're WebFX, a full-service digital marketing agency based in the US that's been named one of the Best Places To Work! We are a fast-growing company that has doubled in size over the past 5 years, with talented team members now based around the globe (and representing 18+ different countries!). While we are growing at a rapid rate, we are committed to growing strategically and sustainably, and that starts with growing our team of the #BestCoworkers - that’s where you come in!

We're looking for people to join our mission to provide world-class digital marketing solutions to mid-size businesses around the world. We are passionate about what we do, we’re committed to driving business growth for our clients, and we’re on the hunt for people just like you, who take pride in their work and want to be part of a company that does too.

We have a multi-step interview process, where we focus on giving both our candidates, and ourselves, opportunities to get to know each other a bit better. While our process may be more thorough and perhaps longer than other interview processes that you've been a part of, our goal is to work together with our candidates to find a mutually beneficial fit, where a candidate is a great addition to the FXFamily, and WebFX is the right fit for their career goals. Interested in joining the FXFamily? More info below!

Learn more about our Ft Myers location here!

You Might Be a Great Fit For This Position if You Have…

A Bachelor’s Degree
Successful FXers in this role have majored in Marketing, Advertising, Business, Journalism, Communications, Information Systems, Statistics, and beyond
GPA above 3.4

A Few Related Skills and Experiences
(This is an entry-level role, and experience in every one of these areas is not required - we will train you on what you need to know! But the following skills/experience are awesome to have, and will help get your career off to a running start):

Part-time/summer job/internship experience is a must
Customer service experience in any industry
Advertising/marketing agency experience
Digital marketing experience
Basic HTML experience
Google Analytics and/or analytical/research skills
Excel/Google Docs skills
Copywriting for the web
Presentation skills

Any of these Signature FXer Traits!
You have an interest in the web and stay up-to-date on new and developing technologies
You are a professional, dependable, and independent worker with a strong work ethic
You’re self-motivated, thrive on challenges, and enjoy getting things done
You have an eye for detail and dedication to high-quality work
You have an exceptional level of follow-through
You are a proactive, creative problem-solver who faces challenges with a can-do mindset
You possess excellent time/project management skills
You have solid analytical skills and a knack for making data-driven decisions
You work with a sense of urgency and can consistently meet deadlines
You are an outstanding communicator and possess strong interpersonal skills
You are a lifelong learner who loves to grow and stretch outside of your comfort zone, and are always looking to improve your skills

If any of these sound like you, then we want to hear from you! We are committed to growing 1% better everyday, and we believe working at WebFX could quite possibly make your life 1(00)% better - after all, you would be surrounded by the #BestCoworkersinPA!

In This Role, You’ll Get To…

Work directly with a portfolio of clients as their direct point of contact at WebFX, educating them through clear communication, and helping them achieve their goals
Work to maintain our world-class client retention rate by developing and fostering long-lasting client relationships
Analyze performance data (in Google Analytics and MarketingCloudFX) and prepare monthly digital marketing campaign reports
Develop appropriate SEO strategies and action plans/optimizations based on data
Create and manage PPC (think Google Ads!) campaigns and work to ensure a positive ROI for clients
-Perform research to ensure client success - think keyword research, competitor analysis, and everything in between
Devise the content strategy and outlines for our team of copywriters and manage the execution of web content based on client goals
Manage the ideation, planning, and execution efforts of CRO special projects and champion CRO best practices for clients
Perform A/B, website usability, and website conversion rate testing to determine what works best for your client and provide recommendations accordingly
Interpret web analytics, demographic data, market research, and buyer behaviors, and generate and execute strategies as they relate to findings
'Get your hands dirty’ and get into the backend of client websites to correct errors and technical issues and implement content

A Typical ‘Day in the Life’ Might Consist of:
5% managing resources for CRO projects
5% analyzing clients’ competitors and making appropriate recommendations
10% working in the backend of websites/fixing technical issues/implementing content
10% creating reports for client campaigns
15% analyzing data and identifying deliverables
25% communicating with clients
30% executing on SEO and PPC strategies with regular optimizations
100% pursuing your own personal best while delivering real-world impact for our clients!
Note: The Jr. Digital Communications Account Manager is a client-facing position

What You’ll Get From Us!

Opportunities to Learn and Train With Our Team!
Our “Bootcamp” training program will be provided for new FXers to learn, grow and develop both in and out of the office in the specific hard skills necessary to be successful in their position
World-class on-the-job training from the experts (think Sr. Marketers, not the HR team) as well as opportunities for ongoing personal learning and development
On-site, state-of-the-art training amenities to facilitate departmental trainings, industry-related updates, and monthly Lunch-and-Learns.

A Place to Grow Your Career
WebFX grew 250%+ over the past 3 years, and we promote almost exclusively internally. Merit-based promotional opportunities are abundant for new FXers who meet or exceed position performance metrics.

In-Person Experience Alongside Our Team of Industry Experts
This position is based fully on-site at our office in Fort Myers, FL, with opportunities for this to evolve as Fxers advance in their career tenure.

The Prestwick Companies is a family of brands that not only serves its customers but its employees and the surrounding community. Across three companies and over 200 employees, we value a family environment within the organization and are motivated by a common set of values - all while working with a greater sense of purpose. We encourage all our employees to treat one another as people first and employees second. We recognize that small, daily actions can make a great impact on those around us.
The Marketing Analyst is instrumental in driving the growth of The Prestwick Companies. This position is pivotal for leveraging data to provide vital intelligence for our sales and marketing teams, ensuring that our strategies are backed by accurate and timely information. This position will also be responsible for tracking and measuring the effectiveness of our outreach efforts, holding themselves and others accountable for meeting objectives.
The Marketing Analyst will oversee lead generation, market intelligence and deployment of sales and marketing journeys for in-market leads and contacts. They will work discreetly in the background, acting as the linchpin of our sales operations. A key aspect of this role involves establishing robust tracking mechanisms and holding both themselves and the team accountable for achieving set targets.

Overview:
To be part of our organization, every employee should understand and share in the YNHHS Vision, support our Mission, and live our Values. These values-integrity, patient-centered, respect, accountability, and compassion - must guide what we do, as individuals and professionals, every day.

SUMMARY
Focused on driving digital marketing strategy and enhancing engagement across Yale New Haven Healths digital properties. The position is responsible for analyzing and understanding the effectiveness of digital marketing campaigns and efforts including paid (display, search, social), owned (website, email, social), and earned (influencers and partnerships). The Digital Marketing Analyst will also be responsible for collecting, analyzing and interpreting marketing data to inform strategic business objectives and improve overall campaign performance. In addition to understanding online customer behavior and turning performance insights into digital journeys, the Digital Marketing Analyst will maintain data compliance in line with healthcare regulations.

EEO/AA/Disability/Veteran.
Responsibilities:
1. Develop and execute digital marketing strategies across various channels, including website, search, social, mobile, text and email. Provide insights into the effectiveness of each channel and offer recommendations.
2. Implement A/B testing and other optimization techniques to enhance campaign performance. Evaluate campaign success against established KPIs.
3. Create user journeys and marketing funnels, identifying pain points and areas for improvement to enhance conversion rates.
4. Evaluate emerging technologies and digital platforms. Identify opportunities for Yale New Haven Health to stay ahead in the digital marketing landscape.
5. Implement successful lead nurturing programs and triggered email campaigns to engage and convert prospects into customers. Leverage personalization strategies to enhance customer experience.
6. Regular analysis of digital marketing activities, including website traffic, social media engagement, and email marketing metrics. Translate data into actionable insights to enhance marketing.
7. Analyze traffic patterns to gain insights into user behavior. Use data to make recommendations to improve navigation, content placement, and overall user experience.
8. Generate regular and ad-hoc reports to communicate KPIs and campaign effectiveness to stakeholders. Develop dashboards for easy visualization of data trends.
9. Ensure accurate implementation of tracking pixels, tags and other analytics tools across digital platforms. Monitor and troubleshoot traking issues to maintain data integrity.
10. Ensure adherence to healthcare regulations and data protection requirements, including third-party cookies, pixels, and other data collection methods.
Qualifications:
EDUCATION
Bachelor's degree in marketing, analytics, business or related field. Masters degree preferred.

EXPERIENCE
Minimum of 5 years of experience in digital marketing and analytics or similar role. Demonstrated experience in utilizing digital channels (web, search, social, mobile, text, email) to drive action. Prior success with lead nurturing programs, triggered emails, search, and personalization. Experience using digital and site analytic tools to generate marketing recommendations and optimizations.

SPECIAL SKILLS
Proficiency in analytics and tag management systems and tools such as Google Analytics / GA4, Google Tag Manager, Adobe Analytics / Experience, Salesforce Marketing Cloud / Tableau or similar platforms.
Familiarity with healthcare or other highly regulated industries and compliance requirements.
Proficiency in database management concepts and best practices, including experience with utilizing and managing large databases. Knowledge of technologies such as SQL, Excel, AMPscript, HTML/CSS.
Demonstrated experience in utilizing digital channels (SEO, SEM, digital display, social media and email marketing) to drive action. Prior success with lead nurturing programs, triggered emails, media buying, search, and
personalization.
Strong understanding of targeting and segmentation strategies.

ACCOUNTABILITY
In personal and job-related decisions and actions, consistently demonstrates the values of integrity (doing the right thing), patient-centered (putting patients and families first), respect (valuing all people and embracing all differences), accountability (being responsible and taking action), and compassion (being empathetic).

New York, NY (50% Remote 50% Onsite)
TouchTunes invites an energetic Marketing Analyst to join our marketing team, to help unlock the power of our tremendous data assets as we grow our fun and exciting business.

In this role you will work closely with the CMO and department heads, to support and enable the marketing team with analytical tools, reporting, and expertise. You'll play a pivotal role by designing and evaluating experiments, conducting ad-hoc analysis, and by setting up processes for regular reporting and enabling teams to be self-sufficient. Your work will directly inform both high level strategy and detailed optimization on a daily basis, as we ramp up TouchTunes marketing, to grow the #1 network of connected digital jukeboxes and the mobile app used by millions every day to play music

This role initially reports directly to the CMO, with responsibility for supporting and enabling paid and organic, B2C and B2B marketing channel managers with analytics and reporting to help us set targets, optimize campaigns, and measure our progress as we grow consumer MAU, B2B Sales, and revenue.

TouchTunes is the world's largest in-venue interactive music and entertainment platform, with our connected jukeboxes featured in over 65,000 locations globally. Our music experience inspires emotional connections in shared spaces, enhancing the way people interact with each other and their environment. Millions of songs are played daily across the TouchTunes network, with our popular mobile app driving the vast majority of plays

Accountable for analytics and reporting dashboards to track campaign performance for B2B and B2C marketing channels
Elevate our analytical tools, and implement best-in-class process and practices
Design and evaluate experiments and A/B tests from top to bottom of the marketing channel
Derive insights and communicate findings
Support strategic planning processes with objective goal setting and assessment of performance against targets
Continually improve our data and mar-tech stack, understanding and updating our tracking, attribution and reporting to measure results, insights and actionable recommendations, for web, iOS and Android, in a changing privacy landscape.
Partner with internal finance, analytics, BI, and product teams
Apply AI and automation to increase innovation, productivity and efficiency.
What you bring to the table:
Bachelor’s Degree in statistics/data analytics, accounting/finance, marketing or economics including quantitative course, CS, engineering, or other related field
3 plus years’ experience in business intelligence and analysis, ideally with 2 years’ experience in web or mobile app marketing analytics
Strong experience in analysis and reporting using Excel, SQL Google Analytics, Tableau or similar BI tools, Mixpanel, Amplitude or similar tools, Branch, Appsflyer, Adjust or similar MMPs
B2C, especially consumer mobile app industry experience strongly preferred
B2B experience preferred (for example at a marketplace business serving both consumer and small business)

Experience modeling and measuring impact on non-paid marketing channels, including CRM, SEO, and/or social media preferred
Experience with TV, radio, or podcast advertising as “brand-formance” channels a plus
Experience with product or landing page A/B testing, and Appstore optimization
Proven ability to synthesize data & results, identify trends & key findings, and communicate succinctly to senior or junior audiences
Good sense of humor to carry us through tight deadlines
An analytical mind with love for statistics & math
Technical aptitude, to understand the data infrastructure and help fix it when it breaks
Comfort with ambiguity and change, excited to figure out how to measure things that are difficult
Organized and able to juggle many projects at once
Willing to challenge the status quo
Music or entertainment industry experience a plus
What is in it for you:
Working alongside a bunch of super talented and friendly people.
A fun, diverse, open and fast-paced environment focused on family atmosphere and creating an off-the-hook user experience.
Challenging and stimulating projects.
Working in a culture that likes to drive constant innovation.
Very competitive insurance packages.
Competitive 401K package with company match.
Hybrid working environment.

Digital Marketing Analyst
Location: Provo, Utah
Department: Growth Strategy
Employment Type: Full Time

About Us:
At Harmon Brothers, we're dedicated to driving growth and delivering value through data-driven marketing strategies. Our team thrives on creativity, innovation, and a deep understanding of our clients' needs to achieve outstanding results. We are currently seeking a highly skilled Digital Marketing Analyst to join our team and contribute to our clients' success and growth.

Job Summary:
As a Digital Marketing Analyst at Harmon Brothers, you will play a crucial role in analyzing all digital marketing efforts and developing actionable strategies to enhance performance and maximize ROI. You will delve into data, draw insights, and translate complex findings into clear, actionable strategies that drive our clients' growth.

Key Responsibilities:
Implement and manage tracking mechanisms across digital assets, including websites and mobile apps, to monitor events and conversions effectively.
Conduct thorough competitor analysis and market trend and research studies to inform strategic digital marketing decisions.
Analyze sales funnels, customer behavior, and campaign performance to identify opportunities for optimization and growth.
Analyze all testing and/or campaign results and optimize for improvement based on goal KPIs.
Develop and maintain dashboards and data models for clear presentation of insights to team members and clients, providing data-driven recommendations for growth.
Collaborate closely with all internal teams and maintain strong client relationships (when applicable) through regular reporting meetings and strategic discussions.
Monitor and report on key marketing KPIs, including leads, conversion rates, website traffic, and social media engagement, ensuring data accuracy and actionable insights.
Conduct deep-dive analyses into ad accounts, identifying strengths, weaknesses, and areas for improvement to drive client success.
Stay abreast of new platforms, tools, and industry best practices to continuously improve our marketing strategies and execution.
Requirements:
Proven experience as a Digital Marketing Analyst or similar role is preferred
Expertise in web analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics), data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau,), and digital marketing platforms (e.g., Google Ads, Facebook Ads Manager).
Strong understanding of SEO, SEM, social media, email marketing, and other digital marketing channels is preferred.
Excellent analytical skills, with the ability to process and interpret complex data sets and a keen eye for detail.
Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to translate technical findings into clear, actionable insights for non-technical employees and clients.
Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Statistics, Business, or a related field is preferred.
A proactive, entrepreneurial mindset, with a drive for excellence and continuous learning.

At Harmon Brothers, we're a driven by innovation and are committed to excellence and growth. Our core principles guide us in our goal to achieve outstanding results for our clients and ourselves. We're in search of A-Players who embody these values:
Entrepreneurial Spirit: You think like an entrepreneur and founder, taking initiative, innovating, and constantly seeking new opportunities for growth.
Proactivity & Preparation: You're always one step ahead, anticipating challenges, and preparing solutions, ensuring we meet our goals with excellence.
Ownership & Responsibility: You take full ownership of your role, embracing high levels of personal responsibility and accountability for the outcomes of your work.
Client-Centric Growth: Your drive to contribute to our clients' success is relentless. You are constantly seeking ways to leverage your unique skills to drive meaningful growth for our clients.
Team Collaboration: You're excited about being an integral part of the HB Strategy Team, contributing to a collaborative, supportive, and fun environment.
Data-Driven: A KPI-driven mindset is at your core; you make decisions backed by data, always aiming for measurable success and continuous optimization.
Continuous Learning: Your mindset revolves around growth and learning. You embrace testing new strategies, learning from outcomes, and applying insights to achieve better results.
Aligned with Our Ambition: You see yourself in our core values and our mission resonates with you deeply. You're not just looking for a role that matches your skills, but a career that aligns with your personal and professional aspirations.

What We Offer:

Health Stipend
Work location flexible/hybrid

Aura is on a mission to create a safer internet. In a world where our lives are increasingly online, Aura's category-defining suite of intelligent digital safety products help millions of customers protect themselves against digital threats, and that number is growing rapidly. This is an exciting phase at Aura, and our team of over 400 people worldwide is guided by a leadership slate that's successfully grown startups into multi-billion dollar organizations.
Come build with us!
The Aura Brand team is seeking a highly motivated Lead Brand Marketing Analyst to build and maintain the data pipelines needed to understand and measure the effectiveness of our Brand-level Marketing campaigns. Reporting directly to the Chief Brand and Communications Officer, the ideal candidate will play a key role in analyzing and interpreting data, providing valuable insights, and supporting strategic decision-making within the organization. You will need to possess strong analytical skills, a keen attention to detail, and the ability to communicate complex findings in a clear and actionable manner. We are looking for someone with specific expertise in marketing attribution methodologies (media mix modeling) and predictive modeling. Your vision and strategic thinking will play a critical role in optimizing & driving the success of our Brand.
Day to Day:
Be the expert in the effectiveness of our Brand-level Marketing campaigns (both online & offline channels)
Develop and refine methodologies for assessing brand impact (direct and indirect) and return on investment, providing a clear picture of campaign effectiveness.
Monitor and evaluate the performance of weekly performance, using key metrics and KPIs to assess effectiveness and identify areas for improvement and optimizations.
Build and implement advanced attribution models to measure past or current campaign effectiveness. Similarly, build and implement predictive models to forecast future campaign effectiveness. Both will be used to inform strategic decision-making.
Conduct in-depth analyses of data to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for optimization.
Present findings and recommendations to senior leadership and stakeholders in a clear and compelling manner.
Stay updated on industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in data analytics and attribution modeling.
Collaborate with Performance marketing to gain an understanding of the full Marketing funnel.
Collaborate with Finance to define key performance indicators (KPIs) and establish metrics-driven strategies to drive Brand growth. Conduct scenario analysis to assess potential impacts from Brand campaigns, on business operations.
What You Bring To The Table:
7+ years experience and Proven track record of building models to support brand building efforts, experience in data analysis, with a focus on marketing attribution and performance modeling, LinearTV a must.
Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or related field; advanced degree preferred.
Strong proficiency in data analysis/reporting tools and software (e.g., Excel, GoogleSheets, Tableau, Power BI).
Proficiency in SQL and one or more languages used for data analysis (e.g. Python, R, SAS).
Strong understanding of digital marketing platforms (e.g., Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, Facebook Ads Manager) and advertising attribution methodologies.
Excellent communication skills. Capable of crafting and presenting clear, persuasive reports and insights- with the ability to distill complex data into actionable insights for non-technical stakeholders.
Prior brand building experience in the consumer tech industry is a plus.
