Job Description
As a Marketing Analyst, Pricing you'll be responsible for researching, analyzing, developing and implementing product pricing strategies to optimize profitability and support overall business objectives You will strategize on how we go to market with a product monetization model that is aligned with customer value. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to analyze data, assess market trends, research competitive landscapes, and recommend pricing adjustments across our software and hardware product verticals. This is an exciting opportunity for a strategic thinker who enjoys working with data and financial modeling and has a passion for driving business success through effective product pricing strategies. In this position you will report directly to our VP, Product Marketing.
Responsibilities
Collect, analyze, and interpret relevant data to identify opportunities for price optimization to maximize revenue and market share.
Utilize statistical and financial models to assess the impact of pricing changes on ARR and hardware profitability.
Stay informed on our vendor/supplier landscape as it relates to manufacturing costs and pricing of our hardware product verticals.
Conduct thorough market research to understand competitor pricing strategies and market positioning.
Stay informed about industry trends, economic factors, and customer behavior that may impact pricing decisions.
Collaborate with sales, marketing, finance, procurement, and other teams to gather relevant information, develop and implement effective pricing strategies around business goals, and ensure continued alignment on pricing strategies.
Create reports/KPIs to track and measure effectiveness of pricing strategies during Go–To-Market launches and provide summarized recommendations and actions based on customer behavior insights.
Recommend pricing adjustments based on market analysis, cost considerations, and strategic objectives.
Provide insights on product and customer profitability to support strategic decision-making.
Develop and maintain pricing models to simulate various pricing scenarios of new and existing products/services and proposed pricing changes and assess their impact on financial performance.
Provide support for pricing-related inquiries and collaborate on customer-specific pricing agreements.
Required Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, Economics, Marketing or a related field.
Two-four (2-4) years of proven experience as an Pricing Analyst or in a similar analytical role, including one-two (1-2) years specific to Product Pricing.
Strong analytical and quantitative skills with proficiency in data analysis tools.
Knowledge of pricing models, strategies, and methodologies.
Familiarity with market research and competitive analysis.
Excellent attention to detail and accuracy in data interpretation.
Effective communication skills to convey complex pricing concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
Successful track record of collaboration with key stakeholders.
Efficient in Microsoft Office and Google Workspace
Familiarity with JIRA, NetSuite, Salesforce or other relevant software.
Must be passionate about the business with a constant desire to learn more and improve!

Title: Senior Digital Marketing Analyst
Department: Health Fund
Reports to: Senior Manager of Marketing & Communications
FLSA Status: Exempt, Non-Management

Summary
The 32BJ Health Fund is a multiemployer labor management fund that provides health benefits to members of SEIU Local 32BJ and their dependents. The Fund is self-insured and responsible for efficiently managing its resources as it provides comprehensive coverage for approximately 200,000 people across multiple states and Washington, DC. The Fund offers benefits for medical, hospital, prescription drug, vision, dental, short- and long-term disability, and life insurance. The Health Fund is one of five benefit funds administered by the 32BJ Benefit Funds.
To ensure that it can deliver cost-effective, high-quality care, the Fund has embraced value-based plan design and innovative purchasing strategies that encourage participants to use healthcare models and programs that provide primary care and other cost-effective benefits, including the 32BJ Maternity Program and the 32BJ Health Fund Centers of Excellence for Joint Replacement and Weight Loss (Bariatric) Surgery. The Fund operationalizes this strategy by actively managing its plans and provider networks and by investing in forward-looking policies that lower healthcare costs while maintaining quality of care.
The 32BJ Health Fund seeks a Senior Digital Marketing Analyst with creative, strategic, and analytical capabilities to enhance its engagement with internal and external stakeholders and to support the success of its strategic priorities on behalf of SEIU 32BJ members: 1) To maintain a low healthcare spending trend; 2) To solve the healthcare affordability challenge; and 3) To keep members at the center of everything we do.

Please take a moment to watch our video to learn more about our culture and contributions to our members: youtu.be/hYNdMGLn19A

Essential Duties and Responsibilities
As the Health Fund’s team is evolving, so is the role of the Senior Digital Marketing Analyst. The responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to:
Develop, implement, and manage digital campaigns and strategies that advance the Health Fund’s strategic priorities, engage its various audiences, and elevate its brand. Work closely with subject matter experts to ensure the accuracy and timeliness and relevance of communications for each audience
Create a visual brand library with engaging content, including templates, graphics, and videos, for a variety of media (web, email, text, social, print) and audiences
Partner with IT, Data Analytics & Engineering, and other colleagues to help manage the building of a Marketing & Communications database with set protocols for reviewing, approving, and storing communications. Establish a clear process for actively maintaining the information system and managing its workflows, including a standard tagging system for correctly identifying and retrieving communications for revisions, etc.
Employ message testing and analytics tools to collect data that will help us better understand the communications preferences and needs of our stakeholders—especially members. Collaborate with Health Fund colleagues, other member-facing departments, and external healthcare partners to identify communications opportunities and to gauge members’ understanding and feedback
Update and maintain digital channels and platforms, including the Health Fund’s websites, and build new websites, as needed
Collaborate with IT to implement web analytics platforms (e.g., Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, etc.) and to develop an effective SEO strategy (crawling, indexing, ranking) for data optimization and analysis
Keep current with evolving digital tools and best practices
Provide additional support as directed by senior leadership and management

Qualifications and Core Competencies
Creative eye for developing visual communications for contemporary media; culturally relevant transcreation experience highly desired
Experience working with popular social media platforms and data analytics
Experience with writing content for web and social media platforms, including the ability to distill complex concepts and ideas into lively and accessible web content, including (interactive) infographics, and social media copy
Experience in strategic communications planning and capacity building in multifaceted organizations

Technical Skills
Microsoft Dynamics Marketing; Adobe InDesign; Adobe Acrobat Pro; video production software; WordPress or other Desktop Publishing tools; Google Analytics or other social media analytic tools (e.g., Insights 360, Brandwatch, etc.)

Interpersonal Skills and Attributes
Self-motivated and approaches challenges with the team attitude of “Yes, we can”
Able to work both independently and collaboratively
Demonstrates attention to detail, quality, and consistency while also understanding the big picture
Able to prioritize work and meet deadlines
Uses resourcefulness and initiative to solve problems and knows when to ask for help
Personally interested in social and economic justice, especially in support of union members, low-wage workers, or immigrant communities
Embraces the mission, purpose, and vision of the 32BJ Health Fund
Mission: To improve the lives of hard-working people by providing sustained access to affordable, high-quality healthcare
Purpose: To maximize the value of our healthcare dollars so that members and employers have the flexibility to allocate resources to other critical needs
Vision: To create a more just society by making access to quality health services easy and affordable

Education and Experience
Bachelor’s Degree or combined work experience and education
3+ years’ work experience in digital media, graphic design, and marketing analytics
Experience in healthcare or with labor unions or other nonprofit organizations preferred

Language Skills: Speak, read, write, and understand English required; Fluency in Spanish preferred
Reasoning Ability: High
Certificates, Licenses, Registrations: None required

About the opportunity: The Digital Marketing Analyst will work with the VP of Marketing to develop a strategic plan across digital channels to utilize content that is being created. Lead and develop integrated marketing strategies and tactics for PHCbi brand products' digital platforms, growing lead generation and traffic through digital efforts, including analysis of PPC, SEO, organic and paid social, and programmatic digital activity; establish and monitor benchmarks for campaigns and tactics; develop strategic and tactical recommendations; and define and build new processes/frameworks to address new marketing use cases as they arise.

Passion for social media; strong awareness of emerging web trends and best practices.

Strong knowledge of HTML and SiteCore.

Rithum™ is the world's most trusted commerce network, accelerating how brands, suppliers, and retailers work together to deliver seamless e-commerce experiences. We provide an unmatched platform for brands and retailers, enabling them to accelerate growth, optimize operations across channels, scale product offerings and enhance margins.
Today, more than 40,000 companies trust Rithum to grow their business across hundreds of channels, representing over $50 billion in annual GMV. Using our commerce, marketing, and delivery solutions, our customers create optimized consumer shopping journeys from beginning to end.

Overview
The Senior Growth Marketing Analyst will be the driving force behind our strategic measurement plans and making pivotal recommendations, shaping the future of our campaigns and business outcomes. The ideal candidate understands marketing pipelines and has a strong analytical and insightful mindset to construct hypotheses. This is a high-impact role that requires a unique blend of strategic thinking, experimentation, creativity, data-driven decision-making, reporting and collaboration with cross-functional teams.

Responsibilities
Develop a clear and disciplined reporting protocol to ensure that customers are acquired sustainably and profitably. This includes the whole spectrum of "growth health metrics" from forecast development to campaign analysis and optimization, ROI analysis, and first touch attribution reporting by channel.
Own conversion rate optimization, exploring improvements across the full buying funnel.
Create dashboards/reports via Looker Studio/Tableau/Salesforce to measure and report on marketing campaigns.
Connect spend and data pipelines from different ad sources like LinkedIn ads and Google ads to one summarizing dashboard.
Create and own weekly/monthly/quarterly performance reporting.
Dive deep into the data to form high-conviction hypotheses for testing.
Identify the right mix of marketing channels, activities and programs to support the achievement of monthly and quarterly pipeline goals.
Measure all marketing output, including paid ad programs, events, sponsored content, etc. and ensure that all investments are delivering a desirable ROI.
Synthesize multiple data points to provide actionable insights that lead to iteration of forward-thinking campaigns that capture new audiences and re-engage existing ones.
Forecast, measure, analyze, and report trends on campaign performances.
Leverage insights to drive experiments and growth (website/landing page views, free trials, etc.).
Own analytics initiatives to measure the impact of all marketing activity.
Build digestible reports that prove results and surface new insights.

Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications
Minimum 5 years' experience in growth marketing, data analytics, product management, or related field.
At least 4 years of experience using analytics tools to drive business insights using Excel, Google Analytics and SQL/R/Python.
At least 4 years of experience presenting data findings through visualizations like charts, graphs via Looker Studio, Tableau, Domo or other BI data tools.
Experience conducting in-depth analysis to uncover trends, patterns, and insights that guide marketing strategies and decision-making.
Experience with data extraction.
Ability to manage project ambiguity, complexity, and interdependencies in a resourceful, organized, and structured way.
Strong communication skills, written and verbal.
Ability to work EST hours
Preferred Qualifications
Experience in B2B, Salesforce, Google Ads or Account Based Marketing a plus.
Experience working in hyper-growth and scaled tech companies.
A Self-starter who desires to discover trends and find actionable information.

Overview:
The Marketing Analyst is a key player in the success of EIM’s University Partner (UP) business. EIM partners with leading colleges and universities to power hybrid, accelerated doctorate programs in health care (Doctor of Physical Therapy, Doctor of Occupational Therapy, Physician Assistant, and other programs). In our partnership with the University, we offer various services through all phases of the hybrid program's development. This includes accreditation, student enrollment, faculty recruitment, marketing, curriculum development, and clinical placement. A few of our University Partners include Hanover College, Hawaii Pacific University, Bowling Green State University and others.

As a member of EIM’s University Partner marketing team, the Marketing Analyst will play a pivotal role in enhancing our marketing and student recruitment efforts by collecting, maintaining, analyzing and communicating data and insights from across the student recruitment funnel to drive strategic decisions and contribute to the success of our graduate programs. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis, market research, same point in time analysis, and a deep understanding of marketing strategies in the education sector.

Benefits:
PTO
Sick Days
Health, Dental, Vision Insurance
Parental Perks
401(k) with company matching
Much, Much, More!
Responsibilities:
Job Responsibilities:

Data Collection and Analysis:
Gather, clean, and analyze data across the student recruitment funnel.
Utilize statistical methods and tools to identify trends, patterns, and key insights in the student recruitment funnel.
Conduct thorough competitor analysis to benchmark against industry standards and EIM’s graduate program ecosystem.
Funnel Optimization:
Collaborate with the marketing and admissions teams to optimize the student recruitment funnel.
Identify opportunities for improvement in lead generation, conversion rates, and overall efficiency.
Develop and implement A/B testing methodologies to enhance campaign performance.
Market Research:
Stay abreast of industry trends, emerging technologies, and changes in student behavior.
Conduct market research to identify target demographics, preferences, and potential areas for campaign expansion.
Provide actionable insights to inform marketing and student recruitment strategies and decision-making.
Reporting and Visualization:
Create regular and ad-hoc reports to communicate key performance indicators (KPIs) and actionable insights.
Develop data visualizations that effectively convey complex information to stakeholders.
Present findings to cross-functional teams and leadership.

Collaboration:
Work closely with the marketing and admissions teams and other stakeholders to align efforts and strategies.
Provide analytical support for the development and execution of targeted marketing campaigns.

Qualifications:
Qualifications:
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Marketing, Business, Statistics, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Marketing Analyst, Data Analyst, or similar role.
Strong proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, R, and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau).
Knowledge of marketing analytics platforms and techniques.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
Familiarity with the higher education sector is a plus.
Experience with Salesforce suite is a plus.

Ascent Resources is seeking an experienced Midstream and Marketing Analyst. This position is located in Oklahoma City, OK and will report to the Director - Marketing.
This role is responsible for supporting Midstream and Marketing department’s daily operations by creating, maintaining, and providing quality control for various inputs and assumptions for multiple internal models and software tools. Fulfill ad hoc requests (data, reports, analysis) from management and/or other departments on short notice with established deadlines. Provides various monthly and quarterly deliverables for various departments.
The analytics work performed and reported on will impact short and long-term decisions made throughout the organization. Management and department heads decision making is heavily predicated on the analytics performed. There is no direct managerial role, but the candidate will be responsible for working closely with more senior members of the organization and collaborating with the several different departments requiring the ability to effectively communicate the key elements of Midstream and Marketing as well as the ability to understand its impact on other disciplines within the organization.
Primary Duties & Responsibilities
Develop and/or maintain multiple spreadsheets and software tools used in the support of ongoing Midstream and Marketing department needs by incorporating advanced analytical methods and modeling techniques into output deliverables
Initiate process improvement recommendations while contributing to standardization, repeatability, and automation of processes to ensure on-going timely delivery of high-quality results
Run, develop, evaluate and communicate the inputs, assumptions and results of models for short-term market trends in natural gas, oil and NGL’s
Collaborate with internal departments to coordinate midstream capacity, well connect schedules, or other key commercial data
Support internal groups on daily efforts and align goals and outputs based on their feedback and guidance
Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities
Able to work successfully in a team environment
Able to work successfully in an office environment with moderate to heavy daily pressure to meet deadlines
Able to demonstrate strong interpersonal skills and active listening when communicating with co-workers
Able to demonstrate effective oral and written communication skills
Able to prioritize and schedule tasks, pay attention to detail, and demonstrate good organizational skills
Advanced abilities in Microsoft Office Excel, PowerPoint, Power BI, Word, SQL, Snowflake, Data Manipulation, and Python
Prefer experience with oil and gas reserves and Enersight software
Valid state Driver’s License
Education & Work Experience Required
Bachelor s Degree in business related field, mathematics or energy management preferred or minimum of six (6) years of relevant work experience may be considered in lieu of degree
Two (2) or more years of experience in Midstream and Marketing or related experience in oil and gas industry
Highly proficient in Microsoft Office Excel, PowerPoint, Power BI, Word, SQL, Snowflake, Data Manipulation, and Python

Front is a customer operations platform that enables support, sales, and account management teams to deliver exceptional service at scale. Front streamlines customer communication by combining the efficiency of a help desk and the familiarity of email, with automated workflows and real-time collaboration behind the scenes. With Front, teams can centralize messages across channels, route them to the right person, and unlock visibility and insights across all of their customer operations.

More than 8,000 businesses across many different industries (manufacturing, logistics, travel, financial services, tech, etc.) use Front to drive operational efficiency that prevents churn, improves retention, and propels customer growth. Backed by Sequoia Capital and Salesforce Ventures, Front has raised $204M from leading venture capital firms and independent investors including top executives at Atlassian, Okta, Qualtrics, Zoom, and PagerDuty. Front has received numerous Great Place to Work accolades, including Y Combinator's list of Top Companies in 2023, #4 on Fortune’s Best Workplaces in the Bay Area™, Inc. Magazine's 2022 Best Workplaces list, Forbes Best Startup Employers 2022 List, and Best workplaces for Millennials 2022 list.

If the idea of rolling up your sleeves and building the framework and foundation for a successful marketing analytics org excites you, this role may be the perfect fit. We’re looking for someone who deeply understands GTM strategy and can leverage data to tell compelling stories and empower stakeholders to make data driven decisions. You will partner with marketers, data engineers, product managers, and other data science teams to execute on our company’s strategy to both grow and scale. Using a variety of analysis and data-science techniques, you’ll help stakeholders understand how Front’s leads and customers engage with us, identify opportunities for optimization, and measure the success of marketing initiatives.

Note that we are only able to hire for this role in the following states:
Arizona, Colorado, Connecticut, Florida, Illinois, Nevada, New Jersey, New York, North Carolina, Oregon, Texas, Washington, Tennessee, Missouri
What will you be doing?
Become a trusted strategic partner with the GTM organization by using data to deliver actionable insights which help address the business's biggest areas of opportunity
Design and build models to support attribution, funnel optimization, segmentation, lead scoring, lead potential, cost to acquire a customer, and more…
Evangelize and drive adoption to the data products that you develop
Identify and measure the success of marketing efforts through forecasting, goal setting and monitoring key funnel metrics and conversion rates
What skills and experience do you need?
5+ Years of Experience in Data Science or related fields
Proficiency in SQL and another data manipulation programming language (e.g Python, R)
Expertise at telling stories with data and familiarity with at least one visualization tool (e.g. Tableau, R-Shiny, Microstrategy, SAP Business Objects, Looker, etc.)
Understanding of attribution modeling with a focus on GTM / Top of Funnel
An understanding of the SaaS business model and key funnel metrics
Experience in lead and prospect segmentation and personalization efforts
Experience driving projects or programs which have had proven impact on business strategy and performance through your analytics skills
Ability to craft analysis into well-written and persuasive content
Nice to haves:
7+ Years of Experience in Data Science or related fields OR 5+ Years of experience in Data Science along with a post-graduate degree or equivalent in a related field
Experience utilizing causal inference for marketing measurement
Experience influencing functional leadership and above to adopt data solutions
An understanding of both self-serve and sales led motions
Experience in applying statistical concepts (e.g. regressions, A/B tests, clustering, probability) to business problems

Job Description
As an Associate Digital Marketing Strategist, you will act as the foundation of the paid search team, conducting research, generating/analyzing reports and performing basic administrative tasks within the department. This role is essential to the daily management of the search account and requires an individual that works well in a team-based, dynamic environment. A growth mindset with an interest in supporting advanced projects is encouraged.
In this entry-level position, you will receive intensive training and close mentorship in all aspects of paid search to assist with the management of specific clients while gaining knowledge of the anti-agency landscape.
We are looking for an outstanding individual who is up to speed with our industry’s latest tools and tactics and just as comfortable in the meeting room explaining their ideas for creating growth. This is a multi-disciplinary role. Meaning you will be involved in planning, analysis, strategy, improving conversion rates, leveraging paid search marketing, and understanding the roles of content creation and the social space.
Responsibilities
Help plan, develop, and execute digital marketing plans for clients
Set-up benchmarking to track, report, and analyze KPIs and initiatives
Help educate and coach clients on choices, decisions, and directions
Manage a diverse growing roster of clients
Implement Pay Per Click media strategies for clients
Perform daily paid search responsibilities within Google Ads and Bing Ads
Provide creative copy suggestions and graphical ad templates
Provide recommendations and execute strategies for keyword opportunities, ad groups, campaign structuring, targeting, and display network use in accordance with client goals
Keep pace with search engine and PPC industry trends and developments
Monitor and administer web analytics dashboards, reports and key reporting tools, and point out key areas of importance in accordance with client goals
Monitor and evaluate search results and search performance across the major search platforms
Communicate to team and management on project development, timelines, and results
Work closely with other team members to meet client goals.
Qualities of the Ideal Candidate
Excellent verbal and written skills; quantitative and qualitative analytical skills; exceptional organizational skills, multi-tasking capabilities, and attention to detail
Thrives working in a dynamic, collaborative environment.
Advertising/digital agency internship or marketing role experience a major plus
Google Ads/Bing Ads certification a plus
Google Analytics certification
BS/BA degree preferred
Education in Marketing, Advertising, Mass Communications or similar work experience
Most importantly, you are eager to learn, be adaptable, and have a strong interest in the advertising/media industry
This position is a full-time position with benefits including health, dental, STD, LTD, Life, 401k, and paid vacation.

Develop with commercial, compelling customer presentations/proposals and portfolios, based on the trade stories, using persuasive fact-based arguments, category dynamics and customer/consumer insights that enable EHI and partners to benefit from profitable growth. About Us:
Ascend is the largest credit union in Middle Tennessee and one of the largest credit unions in the United States, with over $4 billion in assets. With an occupation-based field of membership, Ascend is focused on the expansion and diversification of the select employee groups it serves, which creates greater security for the credit union and its member-owners. Approximately 650 employees serve more than 260,000 members from 27 Middle Tennessee branch locations, Regional Operations Center, Teller Center and Corporate Headquarters. Ascend recognizes that its employees are critical to the credit union’s sustained success and future growth. Our employees are the face of the credit union and their personal successes fuel the success of the team. Through collaboration between employees, management, our membership and our Board, we fuel an engine that propels the credit union forward.
What We Offer:
Thank you for your interest in a career with Ascend Federal Credit Union! Being employed by Ascend is vastly different than just holding a job. The credit union prides itself on providing employees rewarding career opportunities, competitive benefits and a unique work culture. The credit union’s commitment to its employees is fostered by its commitment to the member-owners, ensuring dedicated and engaged employees to serve the membership. Ascend’s vision to be the most loved credit union in our market by employees and members alike has earned the credit union distinctions including Federal Credit Union of the Year (NAFCU, 2015), Best Credit Union to Work For (2016-2022) and Training APEX Awards (2015-2023).
Overview:
The Marketing Analyst works as a key member of the Marketing team to support the department and the organization's overall goals and strategic plans by conducting research and analysis. This role will produce the analytical work used to determine: targeting, segmentation, campaign goals, marketing performance, incremental business impact as a result of marketing, member insights, assist with qualitative and quantitative research, web analytics and more. The analyst will be required to work closely with all areas of Marketing, our 3rd party agencies and various business lines to make informed, data-driven decisions related to marketing efforts for credit union products, services, and brand awareness.
Responsibilities:
Compile and conduct data measurement and analysis to inform comprehensive, multichannel marketing campaigns and promotions by defining key metrics and key performing identifiers that drive ROI.
Identify and recommend target audience segments, gather analytics, and prepare scenarios to inform or improve the success of growth and acquisition marketing campaigns.
Contribute to the success of marketing efforts by analyzing campaign performance based on data to determine efficacy and provide recommendations.
Report on ROI, KPIs and help determine goals for projects. Research and gather data to support the development of marketing personas.
Develop models to predict ROI of each product campaign based on seasonality and the current rate environment.
Report and present detailed tactic and campaign metrics to senior leaders in the credit union.
Design and compile research on new geographic areas to assess opportunities
Design and compile analysis on the current membership to assist in better targeting and messaging
Analyze competition and trends, identify the organization's strengths and weaknesses, and determine potential opportunities.
Perform other duties as assigned or required.
Read all internal publications, including HUB and Possibilities.

Education
Bachelor's Degree Marketing or related field is required
Work Experience
3-5 years Marketing is required
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Understanding of marketing principles, theory, and application to marketing projects and assignments.
Knowledge of Google Tag Manager and how to utilize the data in PowerBI and GA4
Must be able to handle multiple responsibilities, meet deadlines, deal with sensitive information, and handle problem resolution.
Must be data-driven and understand sales funnels, be able to measure the performance of marketing campaigns across different channels and have the skills to report on KPIs and ROI.
Understand consumer behavior, tracking, and forecasting consumer trends.
Knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite.
Must know common marketing platforms including, but not limited to Google Analytics, marketing automation and segmentation tools, PowerBI, and other analytic tools.
Able to communicate clearly and effectively, both verbally and in writing, at different levels across the organization.
Skilled in collaboration and fostering relationships.

Critical thinking and analysis.

The Company
CTC is an established 40-year-old, woman-owned consulting firm that’s in the midst of experiencing massive growth as clients large and small seek our help to guide them through this seminal moment in the history of broadband deployment where Congress has appropriated tens of billions of dollars to deploy broadband and connect low-income households to the modern economy.
CTC delivers best-in-class business and engineering consulting services to state and local governments, federal government agencies, and nonprofit partners. We help research, design, implement, and manage the most innovative broadband policies and programs in the country. Our approach is mission-driven as we’re true believers in the power of broadband and technology to transform communities and improve lives. We’re not here to just stack up billable hours; rather, we do this work because we know that the more connected our nation is the stronger it is. And the more connected people are the more opportunities they’ll have to better their lives. That’s why we’re always willing to go the extra mile for our clients - because our job is to help them fulfill their mission.
This attitude has been the lynchpin of CTC’s success. We have grown over the years into one of the most respected voices in broadband policies, engineering, and advocacy. We never compromise on the quality of the services we deliver, and we always work to do the right thing. As a result, state broadband offices and local governments across the country entrust us with their mission critical work.

About Quizlet:

Inspired by our belief that anyone can learn anything and powered by our own curiosity, we build the smartest tools we can imagine to help students learn.

Quizlet is the popular, global learning platform and app that millions of students, teachers and everyday people use to study any subject imaginable for school, work or as part of their personal interests - including two-thirds of high school students and half of all college students in the US. Combining cognitive science and machine learning, Quizlet guides students through adaptive study activities to confidently reach their learning goals. We’re on track to become the undisputed leader in user-generated learning content and engagement, at the scale of YouTube.

Valued at $1 billion, Quizlet has raised over $60 million in venture capital from investors including Icon Ventures, Union Square Ventures, General Atlantic, Costanoa Ventures, Owl Ventures, and Altos Ventures.

To serve our global community of learners, our teams tackle lofty technical challenges and design for use cases across cultures and languages. We work hard, act like owners, and collaborate every chance we get. We’re energized by the potential to power more learners through multiple approaches and various tools.

About the Team:

Quizlet’s marketing team plays a pivotal role in comprehending and effectively conveying Quizlet’s value proposition to students and teachers, with the ultimate goal of elevating brand awareness, fostering user engagement, and driving growth in subscriptions and ads revenue.

About the Role:

Reporting directly into the head of marketing, the Lead Marketing Analyst will serve as a highly cross-functional partner. You will work closely with members across the marketing organization to help them understand the incremental impact they are driving to Quizlet. You will also be responsible for collaborating with our Data Science team to ensure our efforts are aligned and tracking with extended team and company objectives.

This is a hybrid role based out of our New York or San Francisco offices.
In this role, you will:
Measure the impact and effectiveness of various marketing strategies (across direct response, lifecycle, product and brand marketing) against predetermined team and company goals and use the data to inform future goals
Partner with the product marketing and lifecycle teams to chart the student journey, illuminating points of higher engagement and drop off to better understand and inform onsite and lifecycle communication opportunities
Be a key owner with Data Engineering in our investment in new marketing analytics reporting tools in 2024 and beyond
Meet with Data Scientists across the company to understand changes in reporting in the data, be it tables, definitions, compelling A/B results, models to try, etc
Support clearer attribution efforts and strategies for key marketing initiatives
Support our external communications efforts through data storytelling, identifying compelling trends and topics that will generate interest across media

Own the creation of dashboards to help:
Measure user growth, subscription and revenue impact and assign value across all marketing channels
Measure the performance and engagement across social media channels to help inform strategy and understand campaign performance
Measure and monitor brand sentiment across social media channels
What you bring to the table:
8+ years of experience in marketing analytics
6+ years of experience running marketing analytics for paid and social campaigns
Must have advanced SQL skills using window functions and CTEs, including highly developed QA skills and ability to write efficient, optimized code
6+ years of practical knowledge running incremental testsfor marketing teams
Bonus points if you have:
Experience working with Periscope and BigQuery
Compensation, Benefits & Perks:
Quizlet is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Salary transparency helps to mitigate unfair hiring practices when it comes to discrimination and pay gaps. Total compensation for this role is market competitive, including a starting base salary of $170,000 - $200,000, depending on location and experience, as well as company stock options
Collaborate with your manager and team to create a healthy work-life balance
20 vacation days (and we expect you to take them!)
Competitive health, dental, and vision insurance (100% employee and 75% dependent PPO, HMO, VSP Choice)
Employer-sponsored 401k plan with company match
Access to LinkedIn Learning and other resources to support professional growth
Paid Family Leave, FSA, HSA, Commuter benefits, Wellness benefits
40 hours of annual paid time off to participate in volunteer programs of choice
We strive to make everyone feel comfortable and welcome!
We work to create a holistic interview process, where both Quizlet and candidates have an opportunity to view what it would be like to work together, in exploring a mutually beneficial partnership.
We provide a transparent setting, that gives a comprehensive view of who we are!

In Closing:

We hope you are excited about everything you read so far. We highly encourage you to apply for this position, even if you feel you do not meet all the requirements. Quizlet is always looking for amazing folks that believe in our mission and can contribute to our team in various ways - not merely candidates that fit a certain mold.

We have a bias for action, take initiative, and take pride in delivering results. We make informed decisions whenever possible but are unafraid to take calculated risks on great ideas to promote learning. We embrace challenges and see effort as the path to mastery. We’re constantly seeking opportunities to learn and we embrace curiosity. Quality matters at Quizlet, and we hold the bar high on everything we do.
We treat each other with honesty and respect, encourage vigorous debate, and seek critical feedback. We value diversity, humility, transparency, and collaboration as the best paths to our success — as individuals, as a team, and as a company.

Quizlet’s success as an online learning community depends on a strong commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion. We are actively working to build a team that is representative of the diverse communities we serve, and an open, inclusive work environment where all employees can thrive. As an equal opportunity employer and a tech company committed to societal change, we welcome applicants from all backgrounds. Women, people of color, members of the LGBTQ+ community, individuals with disabilities, and veterans are strongly encouraged to apply. Come join us!

To All Recruiters and Placement Agencies:
At this time Quizlet does not accept unsolicited agency resumes and/or profiles.
Please do not forward unsolicited agency resumes to our website or to any Quizlet employee. Quizlet will not pay fees to any third-party agency or firm nor will it be responsible for any agency fees associated with unsolicited resumes. All unsolicited resumes received will be considered the property of Quizlet.

Job Summary:
This position is responsible for leading the analysis of marketing initiatives across national and local channels. They will leverage data to identify trends and patterns, providing actionable insights to optimize marketing strategies and improve overall business performance. They will be responsible for data collection, validation and uploads for a commercial mix modeling tool and conducting media plan simulations to provide recommendations for increased performance.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES (other duties as assigned):
Utilize a commercial mix modeling tool to evaluate and identify future trends and projected business performance and optimize marketing strategies. Conduct simulations of media plans to provide insights and recommendations on media mix and investment strategies.
Use analytics techniques to interpret and drive meaningful insights from large data sets to provide actionable insights and recommendations for optimizing marketing initiatives. Identify opportunities to enhance marketing effectiveness and overall business performance.
Collaborate with key internal and external partners to ensure seamless data uploads to business intelligence systems and modeling tools. Validate and cleanse data to ensure data accuracy and integrity and create a reliable and accurate view of metrics. Work with internal stakeholders to streamline data processes and maintain data quality standards.
Create comprehensive and visually appealing reports and dashboards that effectively communicate key performance and metrics in a clear and understandable manner. Utilize the DOMO platform to customize cards that provide real-time insights to stakeholders.
Conduct pixel tracking audits between agencies and digital commerce team.

This role directly contributes to the success of national marketing efforts and our company-owned Furniture Galleries network of stores through successful analysis, insights and recommendations. The national marketing plan drives impact across all sales channels and contributes $1.7Billion in annual sales. The company-owned FG network stores produces almost $900 Million in written sales annually. This role will work directly with many internal resources and up to 5 Agency partners to drive successful plans.

Excellent analytical, problem-solving & critical thinking skills
Effective communication skills, with the ability to convoy complex findings to non-technical stakeholders
Travel Required: Up to 5%
PREFERRED REQUIREMENTS:
Experience as an analyst, with a focus on data analysis and interpretation
Experience with commercial media mix modeling
Experience with the DOMO platform or other business intelligence tools
Enthusiastic self-starter

PHYSICAL DEMANDS/WORK ENVIRONMENT:
Office environment/no specific or unusual physical or environmental demands.

Job Description:
Remitly is on a mission to transform the lives of immigrants and their families by providing the most trusted financial products and services on the planet. Since 2011, we have been tirelessly delivering on our promises to immigrants sending their hard earned money home. Today, we are reimagining international payments at scale and building new products to create deeper relationships with our customers and their loved ones across the globe. Join over 2,700 employees across 10 offices who are growing their careers while having a positive impact on people globally.
Remitly is registered as a Money Services Business in the U.S., Canada, EU, United Kingdom, Singapore and Australia. Each of these jurisdictions require, among other items, that Remitly maintain a comprehensive Risk and Compliance Program.
About the Role:
As a Senior Marketing Analyst you will report to the Senior Manager for Marketing Analytics. You will drive analytical decisions for Remitly's owned marketing channels, specifically SEO and ASO.This includes campaign design, measurement and optimization for the channel, contributing directly to growth in acquisition of customers. You would also provide expertise on designing A/B tests and evaluating across marketing channels and be a thought-partner and mentor to analysts and marketers.You will lead the development and management of data and reporting tools, defining important KPIs, tracking and monitoring metrics movements and identifying insights.
You Will:
Provide ongoing campaign analysis and optimizations using a defined set of KPIs for owned marketing channels, specifically SEO and ASO.
Build measurement plans based on strategic imperatives, communication objectives and media strategies
Proactively identify and interpret important drivers behind marketing and media performance, and deliver insights to channel owners to improve the efficiency of spend and performance of media as aligned with our goals
Design and implement reporting dashboards that track important metrics and performance trends, and provide actionable insights to marketing leadership.
Provide leadership in streamlining our data stack and improving and / or maintaining the quality and reliability of our owned marketing channels data, including data ingested from third-party partners.
Partner closely with the Marketing team to design tests and execute analysis to generate actionable insights.
You Have:
7+ years of experience in A/B testing, digital marketing analytics, and comfort with basic statistical techniques (including causal inference and regression analysis).
Expertise with SEO and ASO and knowledge of tools / APIs such as Amplitude, Google Analytics and Lighthouse
Ability to represent complex information in easily understood visualizations (including Tableau, Excel (can perform complex functions)).
7+ years experience with SQL, R or Python, and data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Periscope).
Experience building regular reports/dashboards to measure channel performance, support decisions on P&L management, find opportunities and performance trends while also helping analyze metric trends
Experience managing stakeholders, communication with executives, channel owners, partners, and contributing to projects and meetings
Quantitative, and analytics skills must be very comfortable with data analysis and Influencing decision-making
Biased for action: willing to build the first prototype, and continuously improve based on learnings.
Our Benefits:
Flexible paid time off
Health, dental, and vision benefits + 401k plan with company matching
Company contributions to your HSA plan, if you choose one
Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP) available for eligible employees
Continuing education and corridor travel benefits

Overview
CGR Creative specializes in the creation, marketing, and analysis of digital assets. We’re changing the way our clients think about Digital Marketing. Our Digital-to-Dollars approach connects engagements like clicks, follows, and forwards to proven conversion paths that maximize ROI. Without assumptions. Without exceptions.
With our commitment to effective marketing, we cringe at mediocrity and are bored with greatness. At CGR we’re only interested in exceptional thinking and solutions.
If you’re exhausted by the corporate handcuffs or cookie-cutter agency cliches and are ready to contribute to no-bs, impactful marketing, be a part of a welcoming company culture, and have your hands in digital analytics – this might just be the perfect match for you.
JOB DESCRIPTION
To support our continued growth, we are looking for a full-time Digital Marketing Analyst with strong analytical skills and data-driven thinking to join our passionate and collaborative team of “thinkers” to lead ongoing digital marketing efforts and strategies.
The Digital Marketing Analyst will be responsible for collecting and analyzing complex data sets using online analytics tools to identify valuable insights and develop reporting to demonstrate the effectiveness of marketing initiatives.
This role is to work onsite in Charlotte, NC (South End).
GENERAL JOB DUTIES
Develop and maintain reports and dashboards using VLOOKUP tables, Tableau, Power BI, etc.
Experience with Python/RStudio or other programming language.
Collaborate with team members to analyze reports and provide proactive insights and recommendations.
Analyze and provide recommendations based on A/B testing.
Understand and assist with back-end integrations with other systems, such as Salesforce, HubSpot, etc.
Configure, implement, and administer Google Analytics including Google Analytics 4 (GA4)/GA360, Google Tag Manager, and Looker (formerly Google Data) Studio.
Support additional digital marketing initiatives including paid search, display advertising, social media advertising, remarketing, e-commerce media buying, and search engine optimization.
Monitor client and agency deliverables, tasks, and resources in the internal project management system to complete work and meet deadlines accordingly.
Conduct competitive research to gather ideas for new strategies.
Continuously learning new technologies and techniques.
QUALIFICATIONS AND KEY SKILLS
Authorized to work in the US for any employer.
Bachelor’s degree in analytics, computer science, statistics, marketing, or related field.
3+ years experience in online marketing and/or digital analytics, preferably in an agency environment.
Experience using data visualization & BI platforms such as, Tableau, Looker Studio (formerly Google Data), PowerBI or other data visualization tools.
Hands-on competency with SQL and other database tools and languages.
Experience using Google Analytics (universal and GA4) and Google Tag Manager.
Strong working knowledge of PPC, SEO, and SEM best practices.
Strong communicator with excellent verbal, written and presentation skills for presenting data in a digestible way.
Ability to prioritize, multi-task, and thrive in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
Excellent ability to collaborate with internal and external teams.
Strong knowledge of search engine algorithms and ranking strategies.
REQUIRED SKILLS AND TECHNOLOGIES
Data visualization tools, such as PowerBI, Looker or Tableau.
Google Analytics (GA4)
Google Search Console
Google Tag Manager
Looker (formerly Google Data) Studio
SQL and/or statistical programming languages (R, Python, etc.)
SEO Research Tools: Ahrefs, DeepCrawl, Moz, SemRush, etc.
Google Ads
Bing Ads
Meta Ads and Business Suite
Twitter Ads
Linkedin Ads
Google Merchant Center

PREFERRED SKILLS AND TECHNOLOGIES
Google Cloud Platform – BigQuery
Google Ads Certified
Adobe Marketing Cloud

As a Digital Marketing Analyst at Corcentric, you will join a fun, collaborative team within an ambitious, entrepreneurial global organization. You will be responsible for a robust blend of technical expertise, strategic thinking, and applied analytics in full-funnel digital marketing, data analysis, reporting, and campaign optimization to drive continuous improvements to campaign performance, enhance our end-to-end online presence, and drive impactful results across our digital ecosystem.

This key position reports to the Director, Digital Marketing within our Global Marketing team. We’re a dedicated, down-to-earth group in a growing organization offering plenty of opportunity. We look forward to adding you into the mix!
As a Digital Marketing Analyst, you’ll be responsible for:
Stay up to date with industry trends and best practices in digital marketing and provide recommendations for continuous improvement.
Collaborate cross-functionally with creative, content, demand generation, and development teams to ensure alignment of campaign strategies and execution.
Collaborate with agencies and vendor partners.

PPC / Paid Media:
Deliver multi-channel digital media campaigns across paid search, paid social, programmatic advertising, and media buying.
Oversee the day-to-day management of digital marketing campaign optimization, ensuring they are on strategy, within budget, and producing desired results.
Collaborate with internal teams to enhance lead quality, boost conversion rates, optimize landing pages, and integrate into the broader digital experience.
Develop new and innovative growth strategies across media, creative, and technology that bolster efficiency of media dollars.
Identify trends and insights and optimize spend and performance based on the insights.
Perform industry and competitive analysis to inform investments and campaign tactics.
Research, analyze, benchmark, test and manage new marketing channel opportunities.
Regularly conduct comprehensive keyword research.

Reporting & Data Analysis:
Utilize analytical tools and techniques to interpret data, identify trends, and generate actionable insights that inform decision-making for cross-channel campaign and digital program improvements.
Establish best practices around the use of data and analytics to inform marketing and campaign effectiveness.
Utilize strong analytical ability to evaluate end-to-end customer experience across multiple channels and customer touch points.
Measure and deliver action-driven reporting. Can look at data, analyze it, assess against goals (ROI and KPIs), draw insights, and take action.
Plan, execute, and measure experiments and conversion tests.
Instrument conversion points and optimize user funnels throughout the buyer’s journey.

Requirements
You’ll need to have:
6+ years of digital marketing experience with a successful track record of managing campaigns, defining and driving key metrics. Demand generation reporting.
Familiarity with various digital marketing tools, CRM systems, and ad platforms.
Certification in Google Analytics Universal & Google Ads.
Experience with ABM and programmatic platforms.
Experience with A/B and multivariate testing
Building models, forecasts, regression, budgets and dynamic reports with SQL, Google Data Studio and Excel that provide meaningful direction and insight
Data visualization and presentation
Setting, managing and reporting against multi-year plans, budgets, KPIs, milestones, roadmaps, etc.
Demonstrated ability to accurately synthesize and present data in a digestible format.

(We want to make sure you’re set up to succeed, and we view these as the critical skills you’ll need to achieve great things at Corcentric!)

It’s great if you also have:

Knowledge of Chat GPT and generative AI tools to improve our digital outcomes.
Media planning and buying, lead generation and acquisition strategies.
Paid advertising on social media platforms, display advertising, and retargeting required
Hands-on experience with planning and implementing a successful SEO / SEM strategies.

Overview:

About Seminole Hard Rock Hotel & Casino Hollywood
Seminole Hard Rock Hotel & Casino Hollywood is the flagship casino resort of Hard Rock International, owned by the Seminole Tribe of Florida. This world-renowned entertainment, gaming and hospitality destination unveiled a $1.5 billion expansion on Oct. 24, 2019. New offerings include 638 upscale guestrooms in the first-ever Guitar Hotel, 168 luxury guestrooms and unique swim-up suites in the adjacent Oasis Tower at Seminole Hard Rock Hotel & Casino Hollywood, and 465 newly redesigned guestrooms in Hard Rock Hotel for a combined room count of 1,271 throughout the resort. Additional amenities include the lush, “Bora Bora” style lagoon with private cabanas and butler service; a 42,000 square-foot Rock Spa® & Salon; a 13.5-acre recreational water experience for swimming, kayaking and paddle boarding; 19 dining outlets and 20 bars and lounges; an expansive gaming floor with 3,100 slots, 195 table games and a 45-table poker room; 120,000 square feet of premier meeting and convention space including a 38,000 square-foot, carpeted exhibition hall; and a 26,000 square-foot retail promenade. The highly anticipated Hard Rock Live entertainment venue with a 7,000-person capacity, will showcase A-list entertainers, comedy acts, Broadway performances, sporting events and live broadcast productions. The integrated resort is located on 87 acres of the Hollywood Seminole Reservation along State Road 7 (U.S. Highway 441), and is 10 minutes from Fort Lauderdale/Hollywood International Airport and 30 minutes from downtown Miami and Miami International Airport. For more information, visit us online at www.seminolehardrockhollywood.com, call 800-937-0010 or follow us: Facebook: SeminoleHardRockHollywood, Twitter: @HardRockHolly, Instagram: @HardRockHolly.
Responsibilities:
Under the direction of the Director of Promotions, the incumbent is responsible for creating post event reporting and ad-hoc analysis as well as maintaining revenue predictive models for the marketing department within Seminole Hard Rock Hollywood Hotel Casino & Hotel. This position specializes in using data and technical skills to develop insightful reporting to help optimize casino marketing strategies and offers. The ideal candidate is passionate about data analytics and providing reports and insights that will lead to actionable business decisions to positively impact casino revenue.

Essential duties include, but are not limited to:
Utilizes SQL to collect data from various databases in order to develop post forma reports and perform ad-hoc analysis on projects requested by management
Maintains predictive models using SAS enterprise guide and SQL.
Develops historical, current, and potential future trend analysis
Learn and retain casino mathematics equations and key performance indicators
Communicates financial and operational results to: Managers, Directors, and Executive Team
Responsible for daily, weekly, and monthly reporting across multiple departments and properties within Seminole Gaming
Develops appropriate financial and operating metrics for use by management in decision making
Supports departmental goals and ensures performance measures are understood and achieved by managers
Takes lead on ad-hoc projects and provides support on projects as needed
If needed, develops and maintains advanced Excel tools such as VBA
Validates results in order to ensure reporting accuracy
Communicates effectively with all levels of management
Supports the annual budgeting process
Supports business and financial planning, includes short and long term forecasting
Qualifications:
Bachelor degree preferred in the area of Marketing, Finance, Statistics, Economics, or Business Management. One (1) year casino marketing experience and one (1) year experience performing comparable analytical functions also preferred, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.

Additional Requirements:

Must be able and willing to work flexible hours to include evenings, weekends and holidays.
Must have 1 – 2 years of experience using Microsoft SQL
Must have a high proficiency level with Microsoft Excel
SAS enterprise guide preferred, but not required
Forecasting experience preferred, but not required
VBA experience preferred, but not required
Strong analytical skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret employee business needs and translate them into operational requirements
Self-sufficient, requiring some limited supervision over job knowledge, expectations, and successful project completion
Highly personable, able to easily articulate information and build strong relationships across multiple internal departments and potentially multiple external properties
Must possess ability to manage multiple projects at once
Must be very detail-oriented
Must possess the ability to define problems, collect/sort/manipulate large amounts of data from multiple sources, establish facts, test theories, and draw valid conclusions

Work Environment:
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms, talk or hear; and taste or smell. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close, distance, color, and peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job.
The Casino environment is hectic, fast-paced and often crowded and noisy. May be exposed to casino related environmental factors including, but not limited to, second hand smoke, excessive noise and constant exposure to general public.
Must be able to communicate effectively with guests in English, specific to position duties and responsibilities.

Closing:
The Tribal Council gives preference in all of its employment practices to Native Americans. Credit Check

Join our corporate communications team as a Digital Analyst to support Landstar’s public websites and external digital marketing. The ideal candidate must love retrieving and evaluating data – website analytics, UTM codes, SEO – and connecting it to impactful content and communications. Reporting to the Content Marketer, this role may also assist in website content updates; online, pay-per-click and social media advertising; and online monitoring of news and brand mentions.

Essential Responsibilities:
Evaluate website analytics for all public websites
Conduct ongoing analysis with responsibility for creating triggers/UTM codes for tracking
Proactively research, learn, and implement the latest website SEO/SEM and other digital marketing best practices
Stay apprised of and implement website SEO best practices
Create and maintain online/digital lead-generation and brand building advertising
Process advertising and digital marketing invoices to maintain department lead-gen advertising budget
Minimum Experience and Qualifications:
1 year experience with Google analytics and pay-per-click platforms
Bachelor’s degree (B.A.) in communications, advertising, marketing or related field from an accredited four-year college or university, or equivalent practical work experience
Preferred Experience and Qualifications:
Internship(s) in office environment (agency or corporate)
6 months experience with website CMS, which may include Umbraco and WordPress
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
Familiar with social media advertising
Advanced knowledge of Excel, working knowledge of Word and PowerPoint
Ability to prioritize and manage multiple assignments, and meet deadlines
Effectively communicate and work with internal and external stakeholders
Ability to uphold quality processes, policies and protocols
Ability to establish and maintain positive relationships
Ability to work in a fast-paced team environment
Currently Hybrid schedule which requires scheduled time working in the office in Jacksonville, FL

Why work at Landstar?
Landstar is seeking hard-working and dedicated employees committed to exceeding the expectations of those we serve. We employ a highly diverse workforce and welcome employees from all cultures and backgrounds to our team.

Our workplace culture is second-to-none. Landstar provides a safe and professional work environment in which to thrive and grow. We offer competitive compensation, robust benefit plans including affordable medical plans, employer 401(k) match, paid time off, tuition assistance and much more.

If you want to be part of a top-notch Fortune 500 company with an emphasis on safety, service, teamwork, and dedication then Landstar is the place for you!

DIGITAL MARKETING ANALYST (DMA)
Job Description
We are looking for an ambitious, data-focused performance marketer to join our team. The Digital Marketing Analyst (DMA) is primarily responsible for analyzing and optimizing paid media programs (Google Ads, social media programs, etc.). The DMA will provide key analytical and operational support for Synapse’s flagship clients. Primary responsibilities include:
Conducting robust data analysis using client and platform data
Implementing, analyzing, and synthesizing A/B tests to evaluate and optimize messaging and landing pages experiences
Collaborating with account supervisor to devise account strategies and manage client relationships
Applying advanced techniques and statistical tools developed by Synapse SEM (training on our tools will be provided) to enhance insights.
Identifying new opportunities for account growth and efficiency improvements
Developing and analyzing client reports
Desired Skills and Experience
Ability to analyze and synthesize complex data sets and identify key findings and next steps based on those insights
Strong Excel skills
Strong communication skills
Interest in working with a rapidly growing performance marketing firm
Bachelor’s degree, preferably in business, statistics, math or a similar discipline

The Marketing Analyst is responsible for reporting the performance within and across all marketing channels, both digital and traditional. This individual identifies insights for channel managers through analyzing large data sets, builds reporting within the Datorama suite, produces PowerPoint presentations that clearly and concisely tell the story of our performance and responds quickly and accurately to ad hoc reporting requests from across the business.

Track ROI, actualize marketing spend build forecasts and act as a liaison between marketing and our data & analytics team with a strong storytelling ability through Microsoft PowerPoint.

Update job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities.

Overview:
Weatherford is a leading global energy services company. Our world-class experts partner with customers to optimize their resources and realize the full potential of their assets. Across our operating locations, including manufacturing, research and development, service, and training facilities, operators choose us for strategic solutions that add efficiency, flexibility, and responsibility to any energy operation.

We are focused on technology development, digital solutions, and defining our footprint in the new energy space. Our ability to provide integrated solutions across our segments will be critical to growth in our core operations and the energy transition.

Energy producers face unique challenges every day, so it is our job to create solutions that enhance safety, streamline operations, and sustain uptime to meet or exceed their targets. We operate across the global energy landscape employing some of the best diverse talent in the industry. At Weatherford, we understand the value each individual brings to the table. We celebrate diversity in all its forms and are immensely proud of our workforce. We invite you to join our passionate, talented, world-class team.

When you join Weatherford, you instantly feel connected to something bigger – a community that is grounded by our core values and driven to create innovative solutions for our customers. We celebrate each other’s successes, grow together, and learn from each other constantly. Individually, we are impressive. Together, we are unstoppable. We are One Weatherford.

Weatherford offers competitive compensation, a comprehensive benefits program and provides you a challenging and enriching career path, with a healthy balance of structure and flexibility to chart your own course.

Weatherford is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

Responsibilities:

Job Purpose

The Strategic Marketing Analyst is responsible for market insights and actionable intelligence for one of Weatherford’s three product segments – Drilling and Evaluation, Well Construction and Completions, or Production and Intervention. This role supports the Sales/Commercial function as well as Product Lines, Geozones, and leadership with a remit to provide market clarity to grow revenue, customer satisfaction and value, product line/offering development, operational effectiveness, and inform tactical and strategic decision making.

Develops actionable market and strategic intelligence to support sustainable, profitable growth across the global business
Well versed with key market and industry drivers such as commodity prices, macroeconomic data/indicators, geopolitical environments, activities of major operators, competitive/competitor intelligence, material and operational costs, emerging technologies and operating models, as well as broader energy transition themes and strategies
Incorporates internal and external data to build insights and identify market and commercial opportunities and risks
Assesses and integrates external macroeconomic, geopolitical, and market data sources (e.g., IHS, IEA, EIA, Rystad, Kimberlite, Spears, Enverus, etc.) and external ‘signals’ into a scenario-driven Weatherford market point of view to support tactical and strategic decision making, forecasting, and commercial opportunities (current and market white space) and risk
Collects and analyzes relevant customer information (e.g., Capex, Operational activity across Geozones, purchasing and investment trends, voice of the customer (VoC), and other customer-driven insights
Designs and executes robust, scenario-based market opportunity sizing (i.e., total available market (TAM) and the associated Weatherford available market (WAM) and collaborates with product line and Geozone leadership to develop risk/reward assessments and market penetration strategies
Collaborates with and co-develops cohesive, aligned strategy development across corporate, functional, and product lines.
Understands and leverages internal data sources and platforms (JDE, Salesforce, etc.) as inputs into analysis data and insights
Supports Sales/Commercial and Marketing functions in relation to customer lists for campaigns, prioritization of target groups, target new clients and measurements of effectiveness of marketing campaigns
Co-develops and internally promotes data tools, dashboards, and communication tools for key stakeholders that leverages the latest technologies and software, paired with user-centric design, insights, scenarios, and forecasts that provide market clarity and speed decision and action
Responds promptly to management ad-hoc requests
Demonstrates effective Safety leadership at all times to reinforce the organization’s commitment to safety performance
Maintains the highest level of reliability around data analyses and can effectively communicate and justify methodologies and assumptions

Qualifications:
Experience & Education

REQUIRED
Bachelors degree in Marketing, Finance, Operations Management, or other business discipline.
Have 5+ years experience in a similar role
PREFERRED
MBA preferred
Oil and gas, oilfield services, energy, or industrial manufacturing industry experience.
Other applicable experience may also be considered.
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities

REQUIRED
Systems-thinking mindset and ability to triangulate across multiple data sources and insights to develop a compelling Weatherford point of view
Intellectual horsepower and curious, agile, growth-focused mindset
Strong commercial acumen to tie insights to company results and impact
Excellent communicator – both verbal and written – with effective storytelling and smart brevity
Power user of Microsoft 365 suite – especially key scenario and data modelling tools (i.e., Excel)
Strong work ethic, integrity, and accountability paired with commitment to quality at all levels
Collaborator that values varied perspectives and inputs to enhance relevant, actionable insights and drive efficiency and productivity

PREFERRED
Experience with data management and visualization tools (e.g., Alteryx, PowerBI, etc.)
Prior experience in Strategic Marketing, Forecasting, Corporate Strategy, and/or Market Intelligence

Job Title: Senior Marketing Analyst, Web and Digital
Job Description:
Description
Position at Confluent Inc
Confluent is pioneering a fundamentally new category of data infrastructure focused on data in motion. Have you ever found a new favorite series on Netflix, picked up groceries curbside at Walmart, or paid for something using Square? That’s the power of data in motion in action—giving organizations instant access to the massive amounts of data that is constantly flowing throughout their business. At Confluent, we’re building the foundational platform for this new paradigm of data infrastructure. Our cloud-native offering is designed to be the intelligent connective tissue enabling real-time data, from multiple sources, to constantly stream across the organization. With Confluent, organizations can create a central nervous system to innovate and win in a digital-first world.

We’re looking for self-motivated team members who crave a challenge and feel energized to roll up their sleeves and help realize Confluent’s enormous potential. Chart your own path and take healthy risks as we solve big problems together. We value having diverse teams and want you to grow as we grow—whether you’re just starting out in your career or managing a large team, you’ll be amazed at the magnitude of your impact.

About the Role:
Marketing Strategy and Insights is a team of analysts within the Marketing Operations organization at Confluent. This team serves as internal analytical consultants to all parts of the Marketing organization, focusing on delivering targeted insights into key components of the marketing engine including website conversion analytics, digital and in-person marketing campaign performance, marketing pipeline attribution and ROI, Product Led Growth analytics, lead scoring, lead management, and more.

What You Will Do:
This Senior Marketing Analyst role we’re hiring for will specifically focus on website and digital marketing program analytics.
Partnership: Work closely with colleagues across Confluent including Web, Digital Marketing, Marketing Operations, Data Science, Field Marketing, Finance, and more to drive the execution of strategic or tactical recommendations
You’ll apply your analytical and strategic skillset to help optimize the effectiveness of Confluent’s website and digital channels as conversion engines for our business, focusing on:
Digital performance reports, dashboards, and optimization
Experiment analyses and consultation
Web event and digital channel tracking and reporting
Web and digital marketing forecasting
Exploratory analyses, working with Data Science on classification or predictive model
Be proactive in identifying opportunities for improvement within your area of ownership, scope and prioritize projects, and spearhead the execution of analytically-driven recommendations in support of key business objectives

What You Will Bring:
5+ years of experience in an analytics role supporting a go-to-market organization
Bachelor’s Degree in Business, or quantitative field such as Analytics, Finance, Economics, Physical Sciences, Math, Statistics, Engineering
2+ years of experience in SQL querying
Experience with modern website, marketing, and data technology stacks such as Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Segment, Marketo, Bigquery
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau
Highly proficient in Excel or Google Sheets
Familiarity with Salesforce or other CRM software
Be able to own and execute an agenda in a dynamic and entrepreneurial environment
Strong business judgment: Be a tenacious decision maker, able to assess priorities and execute to drive key business outcomes
Strong communication skills: Impeccable written and oral communication credentials, coupled with strategic influencing skills and the ability to drive agreement through intellect, interpersonal and negotiation skills
Clear results orientation: display the ability to scope and execute on projects in service of both short and long-term goals

Come As You Are
At Confluent, equality is a core tenet of our culture. We are committed to building an inclusive global team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences. The more diverse we are, the richer our community and the broader our impact. Employment decisions are made on the basis of job-related criteria without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other classification protected by applicable law.

At Confluent, we are committed to providing competitive pay and benefits that are in line with industry standards. We analyze and carefully consider several factors when determining compensation, including work history, education, professional experience, and location. This position has an annual estimated salary of $125,500 - $147,420, an annual bonus, and a competitive equity package. The actual pay may vary depending on your skills, qualifications, experience, and work location. In addition, Confluent offers a wide range of employee benefits. .
