#LI-Remote

Summary:

It's an exciting time to launch a career with PlanSource, a rapidly growing benefits technology company with offices in Orlando, Florida, Salt Lake City, Utah and Bengaluru, India. We are all about making an impact, winning as a team and celebrating success. We work together to build innovative technology and are on a mission to help people live happier, healthier lives by maximizing the benefits of their benefits.

The Marketing team at PlanSource develops compelling messaging and campaigns that fuel our Go-to-Market team with everything they need to inspire our customers and partners to choose PlanSource. We work with many teams across the organization including sales, product, operations and more to increase demand of our technology through webinars, events, videos, campaigns, product launches and other self-service thought leadership tools and resources.

We are looking for an energetic Content & Digital Marketing Analyst to be a key contributor to the marketing team. In this role you will strategize and implement demand generation activities including webinars, emails and digitial marketing. You are excited about generating leads and pipeline and have experience in reviewing metrics to see the effectiveness of your campaigns.

You’ll also ensure that for each go-to-market (GTM) campaign, we have a well-founded and tightly coordinated lead strategy and work closely with our Marketing Operations Analyst to ensure reporting is in place. You’ll work closely with our Marketing, Sales, Customer Success and other teams to help us maximize the effectiveness and efficiency of all of our Marketing programs. You’ll have a direct hand in driving company growth, helping our GTM teams launch campaigns and understand why and how they worked (or didn’t!).

WHAT YOU’LL ACHIEVE:
Create impactful nurture programs to improve conversion rates from leads to opportunities
Collaborate with events strategist to promote trade shows and events through marketing channels such as social media, emails, and advertising campaigns and report on effectiveness of events in collaboration with events team
Strategize demand generation campaign topics (1-3 per quarter) to drive pipeline and bookings
Manage the content calendar to ensure consistent engagement and deadlines
Align internal teams on each campaign including product, social (paid and organic), design, reporting and business development
Work with team members across our team and in our company to ensure proper messaging, timing, and execution of multi-channel campaigns
Own messaging strategy, developing audience segments, building email nurtures, top of funnel virtual events and content, and reviewing results with team
Collaborate on digital content strategies across all online platforms to ensure consistent branding (social, website, email, paid search etc)
Manage the webinar process including content development, logistics, promotion and follow-ups
Collaborate with SEO strategist on Knowledge base by creating outlines, editing and proofing content
Create gated resources (guides and reports) including the research process, outline and copy building and collaboration with design
Work with Digital Agency for paid campaigns
Work closely with Marketing, Sales and BDR teams to continuously improve lead quality and conversion

About You:
A Bachelor's degree in a business-related program
Experience writing in the benefits technology or healthcare industry
3+ years experience in marketing and demand generation, growth marketing, revenue marketing, ABM or related field
1 - 3 years experience with CRM and Marketing Automation tools (Salesforce is a must + Pardot, Marketo or similar)
Experience with building and maintaining consistent nurture programs to cultivate relationships and acquire new customers
Knowledge and experience writing email campaigns and program playbooks and training sales on playbook requirements
Knowledge of lead management/lifecycle (MQL to Close/Won opportunities) and how to analyze and develop actionable recommendations for improving programs
Ability to juggle multiple projects at once in a fast-paced, results-oriented environment
Excellent organizational skills, strong copywriting skills, attention to detail and a strong sense of urgency and follow-through
What We Offer:
Great benefits package, including a full suite of health benefits, a generous 401(k) Plan, unlimited PTO, paid parental leave, a strong rewards and recognition program, and a focus on mental health and well-being.
An inclusive environment with Employee Resource Groups to join, volunteering days and the ability to donate to organizations of your choice through our recognition platform.
The opportunity to work for a growing, established technology company, but work side-by-side with a small, dynamic team of talented professionals.
Fast-paced environment with big goals and the opportunity to make a big impact.

Top five reasons to come to PlanSource:

#5: Join the Vista Family. In March 2019, Vista Equity Partners acquired PlanSource, marking a new phase of growth. Vista’s portfolio of technology and software companies collectively make up the 4th largest software ecosystem in the world.

#4: PlanSource is highly rated with our customers. Be proud of our sophisticated cloud-based technology that meets the needs of even the most complex benefit programs.

#3: Success is rewarded. With more than just a pat on the back, your success is recognized and rewarded. We take care of our employees in every way we can, with comprehensive benefits, employee recognitions, and a commitment to wellbeing.

#2: You can grow and develop professionally. PlanSource has a great track record of internal promotions within the company and offering development plans and tracks to pursue your personal and professional goals.

#1: Share our values. Be part of a team that values diversity and representation in all levels of the organization. Be part of a team that gives back to local communities, and is actively aware of their social and environmental impact.

PlanSource is committed to fostering, cultivating, and preserving a culture of diversity and inclusion. Our employees are the most valuable asset we have. The collective sum of the individual differences, life experiences, knowledge, inventiveness, innovation, self-expression, unique capabilities and talent that our employees invest in their work represents a significant part of not only our culture, but our reputation and company’s achievement as well.

We celebrate and support our employees’ diversity in age, color, disability, ethnicity, cultural beliefs, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status and other characteristics that make our employees unique.

Marketing Analyst at SmartFinancial
At SmartFinancial, we're on a mission to make the insurance shopping process better, simpler, and more effective.
Our transparent insurance-technology platform is changing the way people shop for insurance by pairing them with the right carrier and policy, one policy at a time. Our company was founded by a team of industry experts who are passionate about delivering measurable results and exceptional customer service to all our clients. We're committed to providing the best resources and support to our insurance partners as they adopt our technology platform to reach the right consumers and optimize their marketing campaigns. We are proud to foster a diverse and inclusive workplace where our employees can thrive and make meaningful contributions to our mission

We are looking for a detail-oriented Marketing Analyst to join our team. As a Marketing Analyst, you will analyze market trends, competitors, and customer behavior to develop effective marketing strategies. You will work closely with the marketing team to measure the success of marketing campaigns, identify areas for improvement, and provide data-driven insights. The ideal candidate has a strong analytical mindset, proficiency in data analysis tools, and excellent communication skills.

Compensation for this position is $70-$115k annually.
Responsibilities:
Analyze market trends, customer demographics, and competitors to identify opportunities and develop effective marketing strategies
Measure the success of marketing campaigns and initiatives using data analytics tools
Develop and maintain marketing performance reports and dashboards
Provide data-driven insights and recommendations to optimize marketing efforts
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align marketing strategies with business goals
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in marketing analytics
Requirements
2+ years of experience in marketing analytics or related field
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, SQL, and Google Analytics
Ability to analyze and interpret complex data sets
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Detail-oriented and highly organized
Ability to work independently and in a team
Benefits
Base plus commissions and performance bonuses
Flexible working schedule
401k with company match
Health insurance
Employee referral bonus
Advancement opportunities - we promote within
Fun company atmosphere

We’re a team of dedicated people who are excited to come to work every day. SmartFinancial offers a fun and engaging company culture in which everyone is encouraged to share ideas and work together. We’re always looking for excited, dedicated people to join our team. SmartFinancial has been named one of the “Best Place to Work” in Orange County four years in a row!

Job Title: Sr Digital Marketing and Technology Analyst
Job Description:
Myriad Genetics is seeking a Senior Digital Marketing and Technology Analyst (IC) to join the Enterprise Marketing Team. Reporting to the Senior Director, Enterprise Digital Marketing.
Your responsibilities will include strategies of tracking online marketing trends, collecting, and analyzing data, developing campaign strategy measurement plans, optimizing, and reporting online campaign performance, then communicating with constituents and stakeholders. This role will also lead the marketing automation and technical discovery, definition, mapping, measurement, and optimizations of privacy forward outbound digital marketing technologies to drive Myriad’s growth and optimize its digital presence.
To be successful as a digital marketing analyst and technology lead, you should have strong technical skills and be able to present actionable insights to inform and optimize digital marketing strategies across the business units. A top-notch digital marketing and technology analyst should also have excellent analytical skills, be detail-oriented, and work well within and cross-functional team.
Responsibilities
Identifying best-in-breed Marketing Technology (automation) and Advertising Technology that support Myriad and all BUs pan-organizationally.
Mapping dimensions of marketing automation tools for pan organizational scorecards.
Testing campaigns, analyzing key metrics, and identifying opportunities to increase campaign performance.
Developing and presenting learnings from your analyses, including actionable insights and recommendations.
Developing digital campaign and web measurement strategies.
Informing dashboards, data visualizations, campaign, and website performance reports at varying levels – Working, Leadership, and ELT.
Monitoring and analyzing external digital media and marketing trends.
Support high-priority enterprise growth initiatives, including upper-funnel awareness campaigns, web experiences, and lead generation efforts with data and analytics prowess.
Communicating and presenting to colleagues and constituents.
Collaborate with multiple teams (including business units, product management, R&D, medical affairs, payer relations), to develop digital marketing measurement and technology deliverables that support key business goals.
Lead digital marketing analytics partners and teammates to establish performance goals, measurement strategies, and dashboards for digital marketing and lead generation efforts.
Lead data and analytics in designing and implementing artifacts, including frameworks and playbooks, to promote consistent methods for digital marketing strategy development and measurement across the enterprise and entire organization.
Provide bi-annual web analytics reporting and compare the site features with industry peers and global bests, coupled with proposals for site improvements.
Constant testing of audiences, placements, solutions, and creativity, including structured A/B tests. Familiar with UTM parameters that allow for accurate tracking and measurement.
Own relationships with assigned third-party solutions and make decisions based on their performance.
Manage performance across a variety of marketing channels: search, programmatic display, paid social, affiliate, prospecting email, and rich media.
Day-to-day reporting of marketing efforts for spend, impressions, clicks, leads, and down funnel performance to marry this data to sales and revenue (actual and projections)
Develop detailed, quantitative analysis while developing meaningful insights into business performance for marketing campaigns.
Provide variance and impact analyses of lead generation, cost, revenue, and contribution margin.
Partner to group leadership to develop QBRs, quarterly web analytics and campaign reporting.
Compare and contrast Myriad product site features with industry peers and global bests, coupled with proposals for site improvements.
Lead agency resources, as needed, by informing digital campaigns, creative and measurement plans that are aligned to clear strategies, objectives, and best practices.
Requirements
Deep experience in AdTech stacks (DSPs, Meta, Google - GAW, GTM, GA4).
Deep experience in MarTech stacks (Bitly, Looker, Tableau, Adobe Suite).
Deep experience in first party data and CDPs.
Deep experience in 3rd party data and parameters.
Deep experience in Marketing Automation and feature sets of: CRM - Salesforce, including AI/ML features and lead scoring models.
Working knowledge of omni-channel campaign including performance across a variety of marketing channels: SEO, paid search, programmatic display, paid social, affiliate, prospecting email, and rich media.
Predictive modelling, a plus.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree required.
10+ years of progressive experience in developing, implementing, and measuring digital marketing programs.
Industry experience in healthcare, pharma, biotech is preferred.
Demonstrated track record in leading omni-channel digital marketing campaigns tech. including analytics components to drive and exceed business objectives.
Demonstrated experience in analyzing marketing data and transforming it into insights that optimize marketing strategies.
Demonstrated experience in optimizing best-in-class web experiences, including demonstrated knowledge of UX, design, and CRO best practices.
Expertise in leading by influence and successful cross-team collaboration, including ability to manage input from multiple stakeholders.
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills.

Recidiviz is thrilled to be hiring a Product Analyst to join our team to lead impact evaluation! We're a small, fast-moving non-profit that builds data tools to reduce incarceration safely, equitably, and at scale. Our tools are for decision makers within corrections and sentencing, from parole officers to agency leadership to people impacted by the system. That's where you come in. We're looking for someone with attention to detail to provide rigor to impact analyses, creativity and inquisitiveness to identify and solve open-ended problems, clarity to think through complex and variable data, flexibility to adjust in a rapidly evolving environment, and above all else, a collaborative, kind nature to add to our culture. In this role, you'll be responsible for evaluating and understanding the impact of Recidiviz tools in order to communicate our impact externally and empower your Reciditeammates to take actions to increase our impact.
About us
Recidiviz is creating safer, healthier communities by improving outcomes for justice-involved people. We build tech that reduces the number of people in prison and helps criminal justice leaders embrace data-driven decision-making.
Using modern data infrastructure and thoughtful product design, we've been able to safely and permanently reduce incarceration and improve outcomes. We work side-by-side with leaders of the criminal justice system, justice-impacted individuals, and ecosystem partners to build a better path forward. In addition to the revenue we earn from state partners, some of the most respected philanthropists and foundations support our work.
People who succeed at Recidiviz lead with kindness and humility, assume good intent, learn from failure, and fix problems when they see them.
About the role
This role is the first of its kind at Recidiviz! As a Product Analyst, you will play a crucial role in transforming our internal data into meaningful insights through the development and maintenance of Looker dashboards that will help inform the organization's product strategy. You will collaborate with internal stakeholders to understand their analytical needs and translate
complex information into user-friendly Looker dashboards with consistent and reliable org-wide metrics. This role requires a mix of technical expertise, creativity, flexibility, and effective collaboration skills. You will collaborate with our Office of the CEO, Product, State Engagement, and Data Analysis and Data Science (DADS) Teams at Recidiviz.
You're a great fit for the role if you love building dashboards and developing metrics, and have previously held Product Analyst, Marketing Analyst, Data Analyst, or Data Engineer roles.
Core responsibilities
Stakeholder Engagement - collaborate with the Office of the CEO, Product, and State Engagement teams to understand their metric and data visualization needs. Conduct meetings with stakeholders to gather feedback and refine dashboard designs.
Dashboard Development - design, develop, and maintain Looker dashboards that support Recidiviz tool impact and usage measurement. Utilize LookML to create and optimize data models for efficient dashboard performance. Understand the underlying data and infrastructure, ensure accuracy, and troubleshoot where needed.
Data Analysis - analyze and identify key trends in product usage and impact. Work closely with the Data Analytics and Data Science (DADS) team to ensure accurate, scalable, and reliable sources for dashboard development. Conduct adhoc analysis as needed to further insights.
Wild success
Within one year in the role, you'll have achieved wild success if we see that Recidiviz has reliable, standardized, interpretable, and readily-accessible impact metrics in Looker that meet the needs of the Office of the CEO, the Product Team, and the State Engagement Team.
Minimum qualifications
3+ years of practical experience exploring and analyzing complex datasets
Highly proficient in in SQL
Applied professional experience developing dashboards for internal or external stakeholders in Looker, Tableau, or PowerBI
Strong communication and collaboration skills, to help understand data needs, share results, and nurture a knowledgeable, data-oriented culture
Willingness to question source data, examine results closely, and provide constructive feedback
Eagerness to be a trailblazer, as Recidiviz's first Product Analyst and comfort with ambiguity
Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field or equivalent professional experience
Preferred qualifications
Deep understanding of LookML to define data models and familiarity with Looker concepts such as Explores, Models, Derived Tables, and Liquid.
Familiarity with Python, specifically Pandas package
Experience navigating large datasets from the public sector and academic communities, especially related to criminal justice
Familiarity with our data stack, which includes Looker, Google Cloud Platform, BigQuery, and Jupyter notebooks
Compensation
Compensation levels are standard across the organization and are set as rungs, not bands. These levels help us ensure equitable compensation and responsible stewardship of our resources. Please note that we do not negotiate compensation offers.
Depending on experience and skill set, the compensation for this role is:
L2 (mid-level): $97,000
L3 (senior): $120,000
What we offer
Effective, extremely thoughtful colleagues, working together on a mission that matters
90% medical, dental, and vision insurance coverage for you and your dependents
Flexible time off, including 20 days of PTO and 13 paid holidays
12 weeks of paid parental leave
401(k) retirement plan with 5% company match and no vesting period
Complimentary One Medical membership (depending on location)
Partnership with Carrot to provide employees with inclusive fertility and family-forming benefits, as well as a small but growing number of hormonal health and gender-affirming care benefits
Free mental health support via Talkspace
Well-located offices in Oakland and Manhattan, with the flexibility to work remotely or go into either office as you choose
An annual company offsite each spring and other ad-hoc gatherings
All the exhilarating challenges and stretch opportunities of a tech startup, combined with the mission-driven heart of a nonprofit
More about Recidiviz
Recidiviz was an all-volunteer effort until early 2019, when Clementine, Andrew, and Joshua founded the organization. Since then, we've built an A-team of software engineers, designers, product managers and domain experts, from companies like Google, Apple, Dropbox, Opower, and Sidewalk Labs. Recidiviz was part of Y-Combinator's 2019 class and has received support from some of the most respected philanthropists and foundations, including Ford Foundation, Mackenzie Scott, Schmidt Futures, Arnold Ventures, Chan Zuckerberg Initiative, and the Mozilla Foundation.
Today, Recidiviz works with (and earns revenue from) 11 state partners – big and small, red and blue – and covers 25% of the US incarcerated population. We have helped to get tens of thousands of people out of the criminal justice system, safely and equitably, and saved states nearly $1 billion. In the next five years, Recidiviz plans to partner with 40 states and help 250,000 people who are stuck in the system to get out and stay out. In addition to partnering with state Departments of Corrections, Recidiviz collaborates with and learns from partners – from organizations like the Correctional Leaders Association (CLA) to community based organizations and justice-impacted individuals, whose perspectives guide our work.
To learn more about how we do what we do, check out our 2022 Year in Review, read some press coverage, or watch our recent TED Talk. And if you're really keen to see our work, you can dive into our Github :).
An important note
Lasting change is always built on diversity. Recidiviz recruits, employs, trains, compensates and promotes regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, disability, age, veteran status, ancestry, citizenship, marital status, gender identity and all protected status as required by applicable law. We consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you have a special need that requires accommodation, please let us know in your application. Even if you don't think you meet all the criteria above, drop your resume, and we'll take a look – you might be great for another role or another time!

Overview:
The Distribution Enablement Group (DEG) is a growing team within Natixis. Our group encompasses Business Intelligence, Analytics & Data Science, Data Operations, Marketing Operations, Distribution Consulting & Strategy, and Marketing Technology. Our core mission is to drive business growth and improve efficiency by extracting insights from data and aligning the use of data and technology.
As a Senior Marketing Analyst, you will become an expert in the effective use of our tools and data as it relates to digital engagement initiatives. You will provide the marketing department with the data, insights and strategic guidance needed to make informed decisions. Success in this role enhances the experience of internal and external clients. You will have an opportunity to shape the vision of how analytics support & align with Marketing and Sales efforts. This is a hybrid position located in Boston, MA.
What you will do:
Provide strategic & tactical insights and analytics to optimize marketing performance, user experience, and drive customer acquisition.
Support alignment of Marketing and Sales efforts related to digital engagement and lead generation.
Develop and regularly communicate key performance indicators of campaign tactics, content engagement and website experience internally.
Establish and maintain processes for marketing technology guidelines and workflows.
Manage cross-channel & cross-campaign marketing dashboards and identify action items that best support business goals.
Assist in the evaluation and recommendation of new marketing technologies to enhance our marketing capabilities and stay ahead of industry trends.
Partner with IT and the broader DEG team on centralized data accessibility, accuracy, timeliness, and documentation.
What you will bring:
A minimum of 8 years of progressive experience encompassing marketing analytics, internal & external user experience development, and delivery & governance of media or digital content, preferably within financial services or B2B.
Strong understanding of B2B marketing, digital advertising and analytics.
Experience using analytics and/or business intelligence platforms.
Commitment to being a phenomenal teammate and the ability to provide mentorship and guidance to other teammates as needed.
Ability to proactively identify and address data integrity issues across marketing platforms and applications.
Understanding of marketing technologies and their integration with data warehouses, CRMs and analytic platforms to enable data-driven insights.
Refined written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to multitask and meet deadlines while remaining flexible toward unexpected changes.
Excellent time management skills, attention to detail, and resourcefulness.
Experience with Adobe suite of digital engagement tools, Workfront, Seismic, Pardot and Salesforce, strongly preferred.

Job Title: Marketing Analyst - Urgent Care Group - St. Louis, MO
Job Description:
Description:
Urgent Care Group (UCG) is a growing healthcare network operating more than 57 urgent care centers in six states. We are focused on growing markets where we can deliver our Mission of fast, friendly, and affordable healthcare. Through acquisition and de novo growth, we are developing new centers by partnering with leading urgent care providers and health systems.
UCG is actively seeking a motivated, analytical, and creative Marketing Analyst to facilitate growth. UCG utilizes an integrated marketing strategy that focuses on data analytics and digital strategies to create an excellent patient experience.
This role is primarily remote, though candidates in the following metropolitan areas are specifically welcomed on account of our active regional growth initiatives:
Nashville, TN
St. Louis, MO
Roles and Responsibilities
Assist the Director of Marketing with marketing plan implementation, project management, organization, and administrative functions related to strategic planning, digital marketing, communications, and recruiting.
Implement marketing strategy for de novo and acquisition growth
Evaluate data, identify trends, and build reports that provide analytic insights
Execute social media advertising and PPC Google Ads, including creating content, drafting ad copy, strategy development, and optimizing budget
Create/design content to increase brand awareness: social posts, blog posts, press release, printed materials
Manage, update, and organize content for company website in WordPress
Manage local businesses listings for all Urgent Care Group centers
Requirements:
Natural puzzle-solver who is eager to learn new information and skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
A blend of analytical and creative skills to assist in creating and implementing impactful marketing
Outstanding organizational skills, including proven ability to simultaneously manage multiple projects and responsibilities
Good interpersonal skills and the ability to work effectively with the UCG management team
Cooperative work style that functions well in team settings but is also self-sufficient with individual projects and remote work
Education and Experience
Bachelor’s degree
Proficiency with Excel, PowerPoint, Word, required; experience with Adobe Creative Suite/design tools, and WordPress preferred
Benefits
We offer an excellent and highly competitive compensation package in this high-energy work environment, including:
Comprehensive Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, and Short Term Disability insurance
Free care for you, your spouse, and children at all UCG locations (for those carrying UCG-sponsored or other health insurance)
Generous paid time off (PTO)
401(k) plan with match
Employee Discounts:
Amazon Prime reimbursement or Sam’s, Costco, or BJs base membership
Verizon discount
Online ticket deals
Who is Urgent Care Group?
Urgent Care Group’s (UCG) Mission is to provide fast, friendly, and affordable healthcare in every community. Based in Nashville, UCG was founded in 2017 to create the leading urgent care company. Urgent Care Group partners with premier health systems and excellent providers committed to expanding access to high-quality healthcare.
The Urgent Care Group Network includes more than 55 centers operating as six brands: Covenant Health Urgent Care in partnership with Covenant Health in Tennessee, Health Choice Urgent Care in partnership with Northside Hospital in Georgia, Medac Urgent Care in North Carolina, MEDcare Urgent Care in South Carolina, ParkMed Urgent Care in Tennessee, and Total Access Urgent Care in Missouri. For more information, visit: UrgentCareGroup.com.

We are global, we are impacting the lives of millions every day, we are making a difference!
At Amcor we are inspired to change the packaging industry and are taking on the aspirational challenge to make all our products recyclable or reusable by 2025. Through our products and global footprint, we are in a unique position to truly make a difference in the packaging space. Our products impact the lives of millions of people across the globe every day from food, beverage, pharmaceutical, medical, home- and personal-care, and other essential products. Amcor is a thriving S&P 500 organisation listed both on the NYSE (AMCR) and ASX (AMC) with US$13 billion in sales. We have a proud history dating back to the 1860’s and come a long way from a single paper mill based in Melbourne to becoming the global leading packaging company. Today, Amcor is an international organisation empowering its 50,000 employees in over 40 countries and across 250 sites.

Will you be next to join our journey towards a more sustainable future? At Amcor we are always looking for talented and passionate individuals who are motivated to make a difference. Working at Amcor means you will have a unique opportunity to be a part of an organisation that is committed to providing sustainable packaging solutions. To find out more about our commitment to sustainability and about Amcor, visit
www.amcor.com
.
Job Description
Job Description
The Sales and Marketing Analyst will play a key support role in optimizing and streamlining our commercial processes, with a focus on Salesforce (SFDC) management. This position will serve as a SalesForce system expert and work across all business groups to identify and drive improvements and determine related KPIs. The successful candidate will possess a strong foundation in process optimization, tool management, and change management.
WHAT YOU GET TO DO
Build deep understanding of existing Sales and Marketing current process.
Develop, plan and facilitate sessions with cross-BG teams to understand business requirements to design and implement standard processes.
Manage and lead global Salesforce (SFDC) enhancements to ensure effective usage, value creation and alignment with business needs.
Implement and drive improvements to existing processes, tools, and systems to enable commercial team members and drive stronger sales & profitability focus.
Conduct regular assessments of commercial operations to identify areas for improvement.
Lead change management initiatives related to process optimization and tool implementations.
Support BG team members in developing training material for new processes and tools.
Generate reports and analytics to track key performance indicators (KPIs) related to commercial operations.
Work closely with HR for continuous improvement and management of the training calendar and creation of a global platform for commercial learning.
WHAT WE VALUE
Continuous Improvement Focus
Drive for Results
Collaboration and Influencing
Results Orientation
WHAT WE WANT FROM YOU
A Bachelors Degree in business or administrative related studies or equivalent degree
Excel knowledge and proficiency with other Microsoft Office applications
1+ years’ experience working with SFDC, and other complex information systems
The ability to successfully navigate ambiguous situations
The ability to effectively communicate and collaborate across all level of the business on a global basis.
#LI-Hybrid
Our Expectations
We expect our people to be guided by The Amcor Way and demonstrate our Values every day to enable the business to win. We are winning when:
Our people are engaged and developing as part of a high-performing Amcor team
Our customers grow and prosper from Amcor’s quality, service, and innovation
Our investors benefit from Amcor’s consistent growth and superior returns
The environment is better off because of Amcor’s leadership and products

ABOUT THE ROLE
Serena & Lily is a direct-to-consumer, luxury home furnishings company with headquarters in Sausalito, California, and Design Shops in twenty cities (and counting!). We are seeking a curious self-starter interested in being an integral part in building out our marketing analytics capability to assist in developing insights across channels. This person will be taking on significant ownership responsibility in the creation and ideation of reporting needs across marketing. Our ideal candidate is inspired by looking under the hood and tinkering with data to uncover insights and loves having the agency to quickly put those discoveries into action. The Digital Marketing Analyst will also be responsible for supporting the day-to-day management of Serena & Lily’s digital marketing channels, including but not limited to paid search (SEM), video, and search optimization (SEO) campaigns. The Digital Marketing Analyst will report directly to the Director of Growth Marketing & Analytics to help grow these channels with a focus on acquisition and growth.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Responsible for daily budget pacing & monitoring budget distribution and performance of paid ad campaigns
Provide weekly channel performance reporting with actionable insights to inform optimizations using platform data, Sigma, Excel, Looker, SQL, and Google Analytics
Create and maintain holistic marketing dashboards that merge marketing and overall business data to fuel enhanced insights
On a regular and ad hoc basis, uncover insights and make recommendations to channel leaders to achieve business goals and make campaign improvements
Research paid advertising competitive landscape and report findings to the larger team
Collaborate and maintain relationships with critical external media partners
Execute paid ad setup, QC, and optimization across networks (Google, Bing, Meta, and Pinterest, etc.) with an eye towards acquisition, and incrementally boost share of search traffic and conversion
Liaise with eCommerce, Merchandising, and Customer Experience teams to execute 360 marketing campaigns and amplify marketing coverage
QUALIFICATIONS
2-4 years of marketing analytics experience inclusive of building out reports (design, data cleaning, data transformation, calculations)
Proficiency in SQL and BI tools
Owned at least one performance marketing channel budget and was responsible for that channel’s performance outcomes is a plus
Curiosity and a desire to learn
Ability to work in ambiguity
Self-starter
An interest in data science and a passion for using data to make decisions
Highly organized
Proactive approach to problem solving
Adapts quickly to changes
Extreme attention to detail
Strong analytical skills
Excellent written and verbal skills
Proficient in Microsoft Excel
Effective communicator with internal and external parties; must have the ability to work in/with cross-functional teams
Enjoys interior design and an interest in the home furnishings industry is a plus
COMPENSATION:
$80-90K depending on experience
Employees (and their families) are covered by medical, dental, vision, and basic life insurance should they choose to participate in Serena & Lily’s benefits. Employees can enroll in our company’s 401k plan. During the first year of employment, full-time employees accrue twenty-one days of PTO and seven paid holidays throughout the year.

Work at Purchasing Power

Position: Senior Marketing Analyst
Location: Atlanta/Hybrid work model
Who Are We: Purchasing Power (corp.purchasingpower.com)
We are an Atlanta-based voluntary benefit company offering an industry-leading employee purchase program for brand-name consumer products, online education services and vacation packages through convenient payroll deduction, helping employees achieve financial flexibility.
The Opportunity: The Senior Marketing Analyst is responsible for providing analysis, insight and recommendation into all marketing activities, regarding their effectiveness and profitability. The position will coordinate, manage and produce marketing reports and analyses of all marketing activities, including direct mail, email, digital, promotions, customer segments, offers, and other marketing campaigns. As part of this role, the individual will also track and provide insights on business drivers including customer lifetime value and customer segment performance.
What You Will Do:
Provide data driven insights and recommendations for all marketing activities, such as campaign planning/tracking/analysis, customer/client segmentation, customer makeup and any other information as required by business functions and leaders
Monitor the performance of each marketing campaign to support the decision-making process for marketing initiatives
Develop and implement marketing and promotion tests to gain actionable learnings on incremental demand/margin performance
Lead Customer Lifetime Value (CLTV) analysis, customer acquisition/retention analysis, first time buyer vs. repeat buyer performance
Provide actionable insights on daily/weekly/monthly key metrics and customer behaviors to understand key business drivers and support key organizational goals
Utilize your algorithmic/programming toolkit, build predictive/statistical models to drive acquisition, engagement and retention and improve growth and profitability
Automate manual processes and find other efficiencies to better deliver for the business
Support enterprise-wide initiatives and special projects as assigned and execute ad hoc analysis as requested by senior leadership
Build effective relationships with cross functional teams (merchandising, supply chain, finance, account management and data science) to assure data accuracy and integrity as it relates to marketing planning and reporting
Provide cross-training and ongoing guidance for junior team members, including offshore resources
The Experience You Will Bring:
Bachelor's degree in Economics, Mathematics, Finance or related field
5+ years of Marketing analysis experience, including evaluating campaign effectiveness, in a retail or financial services environment
5+ years of experience with SAS/SQL and other statistical software platforms
2+ years of experience with Power BI, campaign management, CRM, and/or web analytics tools (e.g. Adobe Analytics)
Knowledge of marketing principles including direct mail, paid search, display advertising, paid social, word of mouth etc.
Experience with advanced quantitative analytic techniques and protocols (e.g. Marketing Mix models, Price Elasticities, Simulations, SKU Optimization, CLTV, Attribution, Forecasting) used to build necessary business models
Proven experience driving value-added insights in a B2C retail or financial services organization
Understanding of business calculations to determine return on investment, cost per acquisition, profitability, high value segments, and market analysis
Effective storytelling using data
Possess strong analytical skills and the ability to manage projects and process end to end with a strong attention to detail
Preferred Qualifications:
MBA or Master degree in Analytics
Experience with Python and R
Your Well Being:
Hybrid work model (Onsite/Offsite)
Comprehensive benefits: medical, dental, vision, company paid Basic Life/AD&D
401k Retirement Plan
Flexible PTO
Career Development
Employee Purchase Program

We act with intensity, urgency and a passion for supporting our customers and growing our business. We strive for excellence.
We hold ourselves accountable and expect it of each other. We attack problems with a positive “can do” attitude. We do what we say we’ll do.
We deliver as one team, working together with integrity, respect, trust, transparency, and fun. We are better because we work here.
We believe our unique diversity and authenticity makes us a better company, allows us to be our best selves and is a competitive advantage.
We exhibit innate curiosity and creativity to innovate and reimagine how things can be done. We ask, is there a better way?

Company: Konica Minolta Business Solutions, U.S.A., Inc.
Job Description:
Overview:
The Senior Marketing Analyst is data driven, passionate about the customer journey and enjoys working across teams to drive insights and optimizations. The ideal candidate is highly skilled and experienced in managing and optimizing campaigns across platforms, and delivering on high-growth B2B funnel targets. Responsibilities include understanding and analyzing user behavior/trends, audience composition and engagement to gain a 360-degree understanding of the Konica Minolta customer, across all touchpoints. You will interpret customer data, finding the highest value prospects and drive targeting and personalization strategies that position our brand in the right way, to the right business at the right time. You don’t only think in terms of acquisition or top down funnel; your lens is on the customer journey.
Responsibilities:
Establish the vision, strategy and goals for the Customer Data Platform to be leveraged primarily for digital channel outreach
Use data analytics to measure the effectiveness of campaigns and make data-driven decisions
Lead the development and management of large and disparate data sets to create highly targeted customer audiences for personalized customer experiences
Define and manage processes to continually maintain and improve audience data quality and technology usage
Responsible for the data/audience strategy, data onboarding and data audience insights as well as internally working with data operations, analysts and internal stakeholders
Define, maintain and govern a portfolio of audience definitions, including first and third party data for both prospecting and nurturing of audiences
Understand and analyze user behavior/trends, audience composition and engagement to gain a 360-degree understanding of audiences and respective performances
Enrich customer data and develop user scores and propensity models with predictive analytics in support of relevant targeting and messaging
Apply statistical modeling and analysis to data sets to develop predictive marketing models that inform better decisions, optimize the customer buyer journey, enabling faster sales cycles, improved targeting and increased conversion rates
Partner with stakeholders to develop personalization strategies, quantify, test and refine the program to maximize effectiveness
Build a lifecycle analytics function and measure the effectiveness of retention and customer lifetime value integrating customer demographic and purchasing behavior
Focus on Customer Segmentation and Personalization from the 1st party audiences, through all the digital touchpoints
Lead and mentor a direct report, providing guidance and support to ensure individual and collective success
Maintain and enforce departmental SOPs, ensuring operational excellence in all your endeavors

Qualifications:
COMPETENCIES (KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES)
Experience as a project lead and/or people manager, showcasing leadership and team collaboration skills
Ability to iterate with limited day-to-day direction, independently prioritize and resolve issues
Translate marketing use cases and business requirements into CDP data sets, schemas and platform configurations to deliver business outcomes
Experience analyzing customer lifecycle and lifetime value across interactions such as Email, Multi-channel messaging/voice/chat, and Re targeting
Strong analytical skills with understanding of statistical techniques: hypothesis development, designing tests/experiments, analyzing data, drawing conclusions, and developing actionable recommendations
Experience in developing reporting and advancing data visualization capabilities with new or existing tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau, PowerBI, DataStudio, etc.)
Proficient in working with an array of MarTech Tools and data management platforms, Customer Data Platform, Salesforce CRM / Marketing Cloud Account Engagement (Marketing Automation), data exchanges, ad networks or demand side platforms (DSP)
Ability to build strong relationships internally with cross-functional teams and externally with paid digital agencies
Knowledge of Public cloud technologies ( i.e.,Google BigQuery, Snowflake)
Data science programming language experience (e.g., Python, R)
Experience with AI and personalization solutions
EXPERIENCE, EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS AND CERTIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s Degree Business, Marketing, Data Analytics or Advertising.
8+ years progressive marketing analytics, audience management, acquisition marketing and/or retention marketing experience with proficiency in CDP/CRM technology
3+ years experience managing others

About SK hynix America
In today’s digital world, semiconductors are serving as the critical foundation and enabler of the IT industry. Semiconductors are more than just components; their performance now determines the performance of numerous IT devices. SK hynix mainly produces memory semiconductors such as DRAM and NAND flash which are essential components of various IT devices such as mobile and computing products, but the company’s portfolio also includes system semiconductors such as CMOS image sensors. Ever since the first pilot production of Korea’s very first 16Kb SRAM in 1984, SK hynix has been reinforcing its technological leadership by introducing a series of the world’s first, smallest, fastest, and lowest-power innovations in the semiconductor industry.
Just as smartphones and tablets have become an integral part of modern lifestyle, more and more futuristic IT devices will continue to permeate our everyday lives. The advent of new digital products and the ever-expanding Internet of Things are driving the growth of demand and applications of semiconductors. Bolstered by such market trends, SK hynix has been achieving tremendous financial success and qualitative growth with its cutting-edge technologies.
As IT devices become smarter and more mobile-focused, demand is surging for more advanced semiconductors. In response, SK hynix has been solidifying its technological leadership while improving its product competitiveness in the high-value-added premium product sector. In particular, SK hynix is continuously striving to achieve leadership in areas where the importance of semiconductors is rising, including mobile, server, and storage solutions. Meanwhile, the company is preparing next-generation memory technologies beyond DRAM and NAND flash, such as PCRAM, STT-MRAM, and ReRAM, in a bid to lead the future market.
Join us today in revolutionizing the DRAM/NAND memory storage business!

Responsibilities:

Understanding the market dynamics, trends, market sizing, demand drivers, growth opportunities
TAM/SAM/SOM analysis, identify target opportunities, competitive landscape, market forecasts, product segment alignment
Work closely across functional teams to pull together strategic initiatives and drive for execution by understanding the market trends, customers’ demands, business plan, products, and competitive landscape
Monitor and develop proposals to drive business opportunities
Draft marketing documentation/report for application & product trends working closely with cross-functional teams for customer meetings
Build customer relationships and develop implications or insights on specific topics
Must have the ability to frame ambiguous business opportunities, create structured business recommendations, adapt quickly based on customer input, and effectively communicate to the cross-functional teams

Qualification:
Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Computer Science, Engineering or related field; MBA a plus
A minimum of 2-5 years in related industry experience
Background in memory industry such as DRAM, NAND Flash etc
Strong business planning, problem solving, strategic, and analytic skills
Ability to interact with and influence cross-functional team leaders
Strong communication and interpersonal skills including ability to work in a truly multicultural and global environment

Requirement:
English/Korean Bilingual Required (Written & Spoken)
Authorized to work in the US

Compensation:
The base salary range for this full-time (contract) position is : $75,000 - $100,000
Individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training.

Overview:
The Secondary Marketing Analyst administers all secondary market duties that aid in selling and purchasing residential loans. Logs information related to loan sales and purchases.

Principal Duties & Responsibilities:
Responsible for administering daily pricing and rate sheets for residential products and intraday price changes for any products designated to off-Balance Sheet Investors.
Prints and reviews loan documents for mailing (shipping and delivering) to investors.
Manage the maintenance of the pricing engine within the LOS to ensure appropriate base pricing, and product parameters consistent with the Bank’s objectives or with Investors’ guidelines and LLPA's pricing parameters, as applicable.
Ensure daily pricing and margins are accurate and consistent with the Banks’ profitability objectives.
Oversight of the Lock Desk includes processing incoming locks, lock extensions, renegotiations, and Change of Circumstance scenarios.
Work with Sales as the primary point of contact to ensure a positive borrower experience while managing profitability objectives.
Ensure loans designated to Investors are locked and managed with the appropriate portal: Monitor Investor and Bank pipelines for lock expiration and timing of funding.
Assist is Best Efforts trading and Mandatory trading, as appropriate.
Assist in bidding, trading, and managing purchased loan transactions.
Responsible for coordinating analytical reporting of all consumer asset purchases and sales.
Administer counterparty/Investor monitoring in compliance with the Bank’s risk policy.
Assist in the preparation of reporting requirements.
Develop and maintain policies and procedures for pricing, management of secondary marketing sale execution, margin management, and the lock desk program.
Other duties as assigned or expanded due to growth.
Qualifications:
5-7 years in banking or mortgage banking with relevant secondary marketing experience.
Experience with Mortgage Cadence or similar pricing tool/LOS strongly preferred.
Familiarity with capital markets transactions and process flows.
Familiarity and experience with Agency and Non-Agency pricing highly preferred.
Experience working with market participants in assisting transactional requirements.
Excellent documentation and procedural writing skills desired.
Proficient in Excel and Word.
Ability to develop complex Excel models to manage and report on activity.
Must be a team player with strong attention to detail and ability to work independently.
Education:
High School Diploma or GED equivalent Required
Bachelor's Degree in a related field Preferred

Job Title: Free People Digital and Marketing Analyst
Job Description:
Free People began its journey in 1970, in a modest West Philadelphia storefront, offering plants and records, along with a few pieces of clothing. Though the name was changed to Urban Outfitters just a year later, Free People was revived as the company’s wholesale label in 1984. And it hasn’t looked back since.

The eclectic assortment quickly assembled behind it a fiercely loyal fan base, and this fueled the opening of FP’s first brick-and-mortar store in Paramus, NJ in 2002, along with the birth of freepeople.com in 2004, and the first mail-order catalog, which arrived in homes during the summer of 2005.
All the while, Free People has dedicated its energies to building a close-knit relationship with the FP community and continues to seek out new ways to foster and elevate this unique and meaningful bond.
Title: Digital and Marketing Analyst
Reports To: Director of Retail Strategy
Overview: Support the growth of the direct to consumer (DTC) business by collaborating with cross functional teams to identify opportunities in product categories, geography, and customer behavior.

Responsibilities:
Support and grow key areas of international direct to consumer markets: UK, France, and Australia by partnering with cross functional teams to drive country specific marketing and promotions that tie to local holidays and business peaks that may differ from the US market.
Work with DTC marketing teams to align marketing strategies to sales-driving activity to achieve our goals by month and country.
Stay in tune to the success of marketing campaigns across the customer base to include brand marketing, paid marketing, email campaigns, catalogs and the like.
Analyze correlations between direct and retail shopping behavior in the same geographic location to identify any opportunities in either channel.
Work to identify trends in DTC net sales by country to reduce returns.
Conduct size selling analysis to support optimal inventory ownership by size.
Provide ROI analysis on current and proposed changes to our shipping incentives.
Support optimizations to improve profitability of the DTC business by reducing order splits and cost per package.
Create and publish daily DTC business reporting.
Monitor monetary exchange rates and proactively recommend pricing / reporting changes to keep FP team focused on comparable data.
Skills:
Strong financial and analytical skills
Very eager to learn
Result oriented with an eye for an extreme attention to detail
Creative problem solver, “outside the box” thinker with the ability to work in ambiguity
Strong communication skills and work well in cross functional teams
Advanced Excel skills (vlookups, pivot tables, index/match etc)
Experience in Microsoft Access and/or VBA is beneficial

Location: Philadelphia, PA

Primary Function
The Performance Marketing Analyst is responsible for the day-to-day management and performance monitoring of various digital strategies, including but not limited to: SEO, SEM, implementing targeted digital advertising campaigns, and campaign landing page creation. Additionally, the role will more broadly support campaign operations and strategy for performance marketing’s primary objective to retain and recapture our portfolio of customers.

Assist in managing SEO and SEM strategies while monitoring and attributing web traffic to the strategy.
Monitor and report on website traffic at large to identify high traffic areas for customer experience and marketing opportunities.
Implement targeted digital advertising campaigns based on customer propensity for various home financing products and defined net tangible benefit.
Generate unique landing pages and coordinate a complementary blog strategy for all campaign activity.
Calculate and report on ROI for all campaign and marketing initiatives.
Assist in campaign operations for all campaign methods: Email, Direct Mail, Digital, Outbound, and Customer Service Transfers.
Become Marketing Cloud Certified in order to maximize Newrez’s ability to harness customer behavior and preference data and convert to high intent leads.
Generate and present analysis on testing strategies to inform future decisions.
Assist in aggregating weekly executive level reporting on all marketing strategies, campaign activities, and results.
Performs related duties as assigned by management.
Education and Experience
Bachelor’s degree in Marketing.
0-3 years’ experience in a data driven marketing role.
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Detail Oriented.
Proven experience in managing projects with various stakeholders.
Understanding of SEO and Google Analytics.
Excellent organization and time management skills.
Communication and team management skills.
Content writing and editing skills.
Strong Microsoft Office skills.

Tundra Federal, an Akima company, is not just another federal IT contractor. As an Alaska Native Corporation (ANC), our mission and purpose extend beyond our exciting federal projects as we support our shareholder communities in Alaska.
At Tundra Federal, the work you do every day makes a difference in the lives of our 15,000 Iñupiat shareholders, a group of Alaska natives from one of the most remote and harshest environments in the United States.
For our shareholders , Tundra Federal provides support and employment opportunities and contributes to the survival of a culture that has thrived above the Arctic Circle for more than 10,000 years.
For our government customers , Tundra Federal delivers agile information technology solutions to implement and evolve IT infrastructures to achieve and advance functionality, efficiency, security, and compliance.
As a Tundra Federal employee , you will be surrounded by a challenging, yet supportive work environment that is committed to innovation and diversity, two of our most important values. You will also have access to our comprehensive benefits and competitive pay in addition to growth opportunities and excellent retirement options.

Position Summary
The Marketing Analyst will research, organize, and analyze data to recommend products, promotions and target audiences, as well as, identify relevant trends in the higher-education market. Utilize web analytics, data automation, analytics reporting, data visualization, digital media optimization, and search engine optimization strategies across multiple media modalities for National University (NU) and its affiliates. Determine the impact of current and future marketing initiatives through quantitative data and research. Work with partners to ensure NU has access to reporting and data to drive analysis and strategy for campaigns and marketing channels.
Essential Functions:
Researches and analyzes data to recommend new products and services to target audiences and generate business development opportunities based on audience requirements.
Evaluates, identifies and reports on emerging trends in the online and higher-education industry with relevancy of services based on specific demographics and behaviors; executes digital strategies based on analysis.
Creates graphs, reports, dashboards and presents data analysis results to senior management with recommendations and potential impact.
Constructs dashboard visualization techniques to articulate the data to easily understood stories.
Executes pre and post marketing campaign analysis, spike and dip analysis and other analytics as necessary and determines the campaign Return-On-Investment (ROI).
Corroborates data integrity by ensuring website tracking is meticulous and complete; analyzing and reporting on website performance across different channels.
Manages and plans conversion rate optimization tests and reports results with strategic recommendations.
Data Integrity: Ensure website tracking is thorough and complete.
Manages relationships with third party vendors and partners as well as NUS affiliate partners to ensure NUS has access to data warehouses and data sources.
Develops new insights into situations; questions conventional approaches; encourages new ideas and innovations; designs and implements new or cutting-edge programs/processes. Ability to generate and/or recognize imaginative or creative solutions that generate successful outcomes.
Maintain full funnel data pipeline to ensure marketing department has access to data
Other duties as assigned.
Supervisory Responsibilities: N/A
Requirements:
Education & Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Mathematics, required; and, four (4) years relevant experience in digital marketing, web analytics or business intelligence platforms at an agency level; higher-education experience, preferred; or, equivalent combination of education and experience.
2-4+ year experience in digital marketing.
2-4+ year experience with web analytics platforms (SiteCatalyst, Google Analytics, Omniture, WebTrends.)
2-4+ year experience with business intelligence platforms (Tableau, DOMO, Birst, Microsoft Power BI).
Experience working at an agency preferred.
Experience in higher education is a plus.
Experience in SEO, PPC, or email marketing is a plus.
Competencies/Technical/Functional Skills:
Ability to own all data aspects of a digital media campaign: developing key metrics, tagging, testing, reporting, and analysis
Aptitude to gather and analyze statistical data and generate reports and design and implement systems necessary to collect, consolidate and analyze data. Knowledge of research methodology, principles and procedures. Understand data visualization and data flow.
Strong understanding of Google Analytics; Demonstrated ability to create reports from Google Analytics
Advanced use of computers and Microsoft Office Suite Applications such as Word, Excel, Power Point, Outlook
Impeccable attention to detail and follow-up.
Ability to maintain working relationships and be the main point of contact for all data and analytics related projects and inquiries for multiple affiliates.
Working knowledge of Conversion Rate Optimization and website best practices.
Ability to get things done through existing production processes; help improve existing processes; identify need or new processes; improve efficiencies.
Must have experience in developing effective working relationships within both large and small organizational teams.
Actively seeks opportunities to influence, build effective relationships and gain alignment with peers, functional partners and/or external partners to accomplish business objectives.
Accepts personal accountability, proactively seeks resolution for personal limitations head-on; and supports honesty and respect towards others, the company and oneself.
Ability to review in detail, tasks to identify errors or omissions and edit where necessary to ensure accuracy and completeness, including solid follow-up and follow-through.
Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to effectively communicate with a wide range of individual of constituencies in a diverse community. Ability to communicate effectively orally and in writing. Strong problem solving, critical and analytical thinking skills.

Work independently and foster a cooperative spirit within a large and/or small team of diverse cultures, while working in a fast-paced environment with multiple deadlines and frequently changing priorities.

About Red Ventures Puerto Rico: Five years ago, a group of determined young professionals ignited a movement to rebuild Puerto Rico after the devastating Hurricane Maria. Today, the FWD787 movement has evolved into Red Ventures Puerto Rico—a thriving marketing and technology company located in the vibrant heart of Santurce with over 100 employees.
Our mission remains unwavering—to provide exceptional job opportunities with competitive salaries and benefits, cultivating local talent and driving economic development on the island.
As we continue to expand our Puerto Rico office, our hunger for exceptional talent grows stronger. We seek experienced professionals with the drive and vision to make a lasting impact on the island. If you are in Puerto Rico or looking to move back, this is the perfect opportunity and time to join our team. Apply today to become part of the movement as we build upon our legacy and create new growth opportunities.
As a requirement for this role, the selected candidate must be based in Puerto Rico. We are seeking individuals who are currently residing on the island or are willing to relocate to Puerto Rico. This location-based requirement is essential to foster our commitment to local talent and contribute to the economic growth of Puerto Rico.

This role is a part of our Higher Education division, aimed at connecting over 5M students to colleges across North America.

You will measure success on projects through proprietary in-house marketing tools, reporting on progress to senior leadership.
You will work closely with editorial and engineering stakeholders on a bias-to-action plan that improves our portfolio of over 50 sites and over 16,000 pages.
You will collaborate closely with our cross-functional teams – business, product, and technology - to understand the challenges they face, identify opportunities for data-driven improvement, and deploy digital experiences that are consumer facing.
You will translate complex business problems into clear, measurable projects. You'll see the big picture but also dive into details to uncover new opportunities for growth and optimization

Job Summary

The Marketing Analyst, US Onshore and GOM will be responsible for the nomination, scheduling and monitoring processes related to natural gas, NGL and crude oil deliveries for Murphy Oil Corporation in the Eagleford Shale (EFS) and Gulf of Mexico (GOM). In addition, the Marketing Analyst will evaluate and provide analysis based on market fundamentals and will utilize a data management background to assist with continuous process improvement within the Marketing team.

The Marketing Analyst, US Onshore and GOM will work in our Houston Corporate office and may work two (2) days a week remote.

Responsibilities

Responsible for Nomination process including monitoring of natural gas, NGL and crude oil deliveries throughout month

Communicate production changes to marketers to manage sales positions
Provides detailed and insightful analysis of market fundamentals for crude oil, natural gas, and natural gas liquids

Financial reporting including monthly price accruals and estimates, reserve pricing, Budget and LRP pricing, impairment and demand charge reporting, weekly and daily price updates

Key contact for check exchange process including price and volume confirmations, and verification of invoices

Responsible for receiving, verifying, and sales or commercial contracts in Allegro and Contract Management system; ensure internal audit contract process is followed

Pro-actively identify system issues and needs for continuous improvement in business processes and reporting

Gather business requirements for accounting, risk, trade control, and front office

Document and train users on system changes

Using industry knowledge, provide insight on ETRM best practices

Deep understanding of the life cycle of commodity transactions – physical and financial

Troubleshoot valuation discrepancies

Design data validation queries for referential data, trade entry, scheduling, and actualization

Lead enhancements requiring full project life cycle (requirements, design, development, testing, and implementation)

Qualifications/Requirements

Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or Engineering

Minimum 3 years’ experience in natural gas or crude oil pipeline infrastructure

Expert working knowledge of Microsoft Office

Strong interpersonal, communication, and critical analysis skills, with the ability to work in a collaborative manner with diverse groups of individuals

Displays a high-level of integrity in all actions, complying with and promoting the company’s core values, a respectful work environment, and aligning with the code of business conduct.

Ability to work effectively, confidentially, and professionally in a rapidly changing business environment

Results-oriented with the ability to work independently, prioritize work and multi-task effectively

Power BI proficient

SAP experience

Front is a customer operations platform that enables support, sales, and account management teams to deliver exceptional service at scale. Front streamlines customer communication by combining the efficiency of a help desk and the familiarity of email, with automated workflows and real-time collaboration behind the scenes. With Front, teams can centralize messages across channels, route them to the right person, and unlock visibility and insights across all of their customer operations.

More than 8,000 businesses across many different industries (manufacturing, logistics, travel, financial services, tech, etc.) use Front to drive operational efficiency that prevents churn, improves retention, and propels customer growth. Backed by Sequoia Capital and Salesforce Ventures, Front has raised $204M from leading venture capital firms and independent investors including top executives at Atlassian, Okta, Qualtrics, Zoom, and PagerDuty. Magazine's 2022 Best Workplaces list, Forbes Best Startup Employers 2022 List, and Best workplaces for Millennials 2022 list.

If the idea of rolling up your sleeves and building the framework and foundation for a successful marketing analytics org excites you, this role may be the perfect fit. We’re looking for someone who deeply understands GTM strategy and can leverage data to tell compelling stories and empower stakeholders to make data driven decisions. You will partner with marketers, data engineers, product managers, and other data science teams to execute on our company’s strategy to both grow and scale. Using a variety of analysis and data-science techniques, you’ll help stakeholders understand how Front’s leads and customers engage with us, identify opportunities for optimization, and measure the success of marketing initiatives.

Arizona, Colorado, Connecticut, Florida, Illinois, Nevada, New Jersey, New York, North Carolina, Oregon, Texas, Washington, Tennessee, Missouri
What will you be doing?
Become a trusted strategic partner with the GTM organization by using data to deliver actionable insights which help address the business's biggest areas of opportunity
Design and build models to support attribution, funnel optimization, segmentation, lead scoring, lead potential, cost to acquire a customer, and more…
Evangelize and drive adoption to the data products that you develop
Identify and measure the success of marketing efforts through forecasting, goal setting and monitoring key funnel metrics and conversion rates
What skills and experience do you need?
5+ Years of Experience in Data Science or related fields

Understanding of attribution modeling with a focus on GTM / Top of Funnel
An understanding of the SaaS business model and key funnel metrics
Experience in lead and prospect segmentation and personalization efforts
Experience driving projects or programs which have had proven impact on business strategy and performance through your analytics skills
Ability to craft analysis into well-written and persuasive content
Nice to haves:
7+ Years of Experience in Data Science or related fields OR 5+ Years of experience in Data Science along with a post-graduate degree or equivalent in a related field
Experience utilizing causal inference for marketing measurement
Experience influencing functional leadership and above to adopt data solutions
An understanding of both self-serve and sales led motions
Experience in applying statistical concepts (e.g. regressions, A/B tests, clustering, probability) to business problems

Facilitates day-to-day feedback and secures approvals on deliverables as they move though Workfront; from development through deploy. Keeps these emails moving through the system and ensures timely delivery.
Tracks all jobs, and secures feedback and approvals on all integrated marketing assets. Works with traffic to ensure projects are moving forward.
Responsible for communicating within the department and cross-functionally to ensure on-time, on-budget completion of integrated marketing campaigns.
Participates regularly in weekly planning and status meetings. Owns tracking documents and leads internal status mtgs walking integrated team through status of deliverables. Meets regularly with planning leads to keep them informed as projects are in development.
Qualifications/Requirements:
3-6 years of experience in advertising, marketing or related field
College degree in related field preferred
Successfully work in a matrix organization
Proven track record working with multiple clients on marketing campaigns and creative development
Must have proven ability to build strong internal team/client relationships, and be a team player
Must have a strong understanding of digital marketing and digital advertising platforms, including social media
Must have sound project management skills
Excellent organizational abilities, with strong attention to detail
Ability to prioritize and multi-task assignments
Good oral, written, and presentation skills
Must demonstrate initiative and have a “can-do, whatever it takes to get it done” attitude
Strong computer skills required; must be proficient/expert status in PowerPoint, Excel and experience with Microsoft Project. Experience in Workfront and Microsoft Teams a plus.
This position can either be hybrid in Hartford, CT or fully remote

Pay: $45.00 - $50.00 per hour
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Experience:
Email marketing: 3 years (Required)
advertising: 3 years (Required)
Work Location: In person

Description:
Our client is looking for a Senior Tech Marketing Analyst to join the Email Product and Operations team. In this role, you will own the best practices, customer segmentation, testing implementation, campaign set up, and analysis of email, SMS, and push programs. You will have intimate knowledge of marketing database architecture and data processes and will oversee data loads/pulls and overall hygiene. In this role, you will work closely with CRM, brand, and tech leads on campaign strategy and execution.
Responsibilities
Owns best practices, customer segmentation, testing implementation, campaign execution, and analysis of email, SMS, and push programs
Has intimate knowledge of marketing database architecture and data processes
Manages implementation of new data integrations and APIs
Oversees design and implementation of new programs and technical solutions
Responsible for complex customer segmentation and buildout of customer journeys
Partners with CRM and brand leads on campaign strategy and roadmap
Responsible for requirement definition, UAT, and implementation of technical projects
Acts as a technical/strategic resource for cross-functional partners and team members
Key Qualifications
3+ years of experience in email marketing campaign coordination/deployment, email best practices, customer segmentation, and database marketing
Comfortable working with large data sets with the ability to query, modify, and join data from different sources.
Strong ability to manage processes and ensure quality control
Strong technical ability using HTML, SQL, FTP tools, ETL tools. XSLT a plus.
Proficient in Salesforce Marketing Cloud software, including Email Studio, Journey Builder, and Interaction Studio
Facility with Excel and PowerPoint. Able to analyze results and create and present reports.
Project management ability working with IT, external vendors, and internal stakeholders
Ability to deal with ambiguity and a fast-paced changing environment
Well-organized, high attention to detail, deadline-oriented
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Enjoys working with others as part of a team
BS/BA degree
Additional Skills & Qualifications:
Email operations and Product – building email campaigns in a tool.
Writing SQL for Data Lookups – Building campaign logic
Re-platforming experience is a plus.
About TEKsystems:
We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. We are a team of 80,000 strong, working with over 6,000 clients, including 80% of the Fortune 500, across North America, Europe and Asia. As an industry leader in Full-Stack Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership. TEKsystems is an Allegis Group company.
