Job Description

The GCO Marketing Data Analyst provides key insights into the profitability and effectiveness for various acquisition and retention marketing programs by creating analytical dashboards, models, and presentations. This role supports multiple teams within the marketing department, including group events, promotions and incentives, guest services, guest insights, and partnership acquisition. Responsibilities include the ownership of long-term initiatives as well as quick-turnaround ad-hoc requests, including guest research analysis, business and marketing analysis. This role is supported through the guidance of the rest of the Insights & Analytics team along with other data specialists across GCO, with business knowledge provided by the Casino Marketing team. Strong SQL skills with demonstrable experience is required for this position as well as previous experience leading analytic projects. This role will need to take ownership of long-term and short-term analytical initiatives, overseeing projects from conception to completion. A self-sufficient mindset and out of the box thinker is required for this role.
Essential Functions:
Define, evaluate, and analyze success metrics for various promotions, trials, and tests. Reach concrete conclusions supported by facts.
Prepare and supply data for key processes both shipboard and shore-side, within GCO and with each of the brand partners
Interpret data and present results in a clear and concise way. Clearly communicate findings in written and verbal form. Drive insight. Prepare and present formal reviews (at least quarterly) to both the working team and senior management (SVP, EVP, etc).
Partner with Global Casino Operations Analytics team and brand IT teams to grow and improve the quality of data available to inform guest offers and analysis of the business
Review recurring needs and questions with an eye to automate and streamline processes where possible.
Support the Casino Guest Services team, as well as brand call centers with needed data to assist them in providing exceptional guest service
Qualifications:
Minimum Education: Bachelor’s degree, Master’s degree a plus
Discipline/Major: Data-related, technical or mathematical
Required Years & Area of Professional Experience: 2+ years of experience in performance/financial analysis
Critical Professional Related Technical/Computer Skills: Demonstrated experience in SAS, R, SQL or related tools/languages
Other Requirements: Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously. Facilitates cross-functional learning and conversations across teams. Effective verbal and written communication skills. Capable of delivering results in a remote/hybrid work environment
Preferred Experience and Type: SAS9 or Viya experience preferred
Knowledge, Skills & Abililties: Experience with Tableau or PowerBI and strong ability to visualize findings; past experience in object-oriented programming preferred
Decision-Making:
Operational: Decisions focus on day-to-day activities within the company. Decisions made at this level help to ensure that daily activities proceed smoothly and therefore help to move the company toward reaching a strategic goal. They have short term consequences. Examples are: Handling employee conflicts, purchasing materials needed for operations.
Physical Demands: Must be able to remain in a stationary position at a desk and/or computer for extended periods of time. .
Travel: Less than 25% with shipboard travel likely
Work Conditions: Work primarily in a climate-controlled environment with minimal safety/health hazard potential. Other job specific working conditions Remote work possible.
The range for this role’s salary range is $60,600-$75,000. Offers to the selected candidates will be made on a fair and equitable basis, taking into account specific job-related skills and experience.
At Carnival, your total rewards package is much more than your base salary. All non-sales roles participate in an annual cash bonus program, while sales roles have an incentive plan. Director and above roles may also be eligible to participate in Carnival’s discretionary equity incentive plan. Plus, Carnival provides comprehensive and innovative benefits to meet your needs, including:
Health Benefits:
Cost-effective medical, dental and vision plans
Employee Assistance Program and other mental health resources
Additional programs include company paid term life insurance and disability coverage
Financial Benefits:
401(k) plan that includes a company match
Employee Stock Purchase plan
Paid Time Off
Holidays – All full-time and part-time with benefits employees receive days off for 7 company-wide holidays, plus an additional floating holiday to be taken at the employee’s discretion.
Vacation Time – All full-time employees at the manager and below level start with 14 days/year; director and above level start with 19 days/year. Part-time with benefits employees receive time off based on the number of hours they work, with a minimum of 84 hours/year. All employees gain additional vacation time with further tenure.
Sick Time – All full-time employees receive 80 hours of sick time each year. Part-time with benefits employees receive time off based on the number of hours they work, with a minimum of 60 hours each year.
Other Benefits
Complementary stand-by cruises, employee discounts on confirmed cruises, plus special rates for family and friends
Personal and professional learning and development resources including tuition reimbursement
On-site preschool program and wellness center at our Miami campus

About Us
In addition to other duties/functions, this position requires full commitment and support for promoting ethical and compliant culture. More specifically, this position requires integrity, honesty, and respectful treatment of others, as well as a willingness to speak up when they see misconduct or have concerns.

Carnival Corporation & plc is a global cruise company and one of the largest vacation companies in the world. Our portfolio of leading cruise brands includes Carnival Cruise Line, Holland America Line, Princess Cruises and Seabourn in North America; P&O Cruises, and Cunard Line in the United Kingdom; AIDA in Germany; Costa Cruises in Southern Europe; and P&O Cruises in Australia. Our employees have a responsibility to be accountable for all actions. We consider the environment in all aspects of our business and have a responsibility to put safety andsustainability first. We live and share a positive attitude which is based on fostering an environment of inclusion, trust, a willingness to listen, openness and integrity.

Carnival Corporation & plc and Carnival Cruise Line is an equal employment opportunity/affirmative action employer. In this regard, it does not discriminate against any qualified individual on the basis of sex, race, color, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, age, marital status, mental, physical or sensory disability or any other classification protected by applicable local, state, federal and/or international law.

Cruise benefits

Company Overview

DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they agree. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives.


What you'll do

You will be a hands-on analytics leader for DocuSign’s SEO/SEM marketing channel. You will measure, benchmark, and play a critical part in continuously optimizing key user journeys including, but not limited to, free trial sign-up, self-service purchase (e-commerce), and upgrades from freemium to paid models worldwide. You will partner closely with fellow analysts, product managers, and business partners to socialize the end-to-end customer journeys across various experiences. You will use this knowledge to analyze performance and identify and size opportunities for growth and improved customer experiences across channels and experiences.

You will excel as a trusted advisor, creative problem solver, and exceptional problem-solver with a demonstrated ability to structure and navigate complex problems and processes. You can simultaneously think strategically and take a hands-on approach to deep dive into our data to deliver high level or detailed well-structured models and analysis depending on the business need. You will succeed by combining analytical insight, technical proficiency, business acumen, and the ability to collaborate and influence your key partners and cross-functional teams.

This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the
Performance Marketing Measurement Director.

Responsibility
Lead analytics (i.e become Subject-Matter-Expert (SME)) on search marketing channels (Organic & Paid) and map customer journeys of these segments across our website and platform and use these insights from acquired knowledge to influence SEO optimizations, keyword bidding, marketing budget and drive channel optimization for performance marketing function
Assist with managing and improving processes for identity resolution, tagging, and other tracking parameters to gather meaningful data (Google Analytics, Mixpanel)
Build relationships and partner with cross-functional teams to enhance existing analytics models, pipelines and dashboards, create additional metrics, reports and/or visualization based on evolving business needs, and support these teams in driving their OKRs
Identify patterns/trends/insights to support business outcomes and short/long-term strategy development
Apply business insight and analytics techniques on ambiguous business problems to unearth areas of opportunity and size potential impact
Own experimentation roadmap for search incrementality testing: identify and prioritize opportunities with marketing managers, write test charters, and provide test analysis and recommendations to collaborators
Partner with cross functional teams such as data science, data engineering, product analysts, experimentation and instrumentation teams to contribute to advanced models (MMM, MTA), data pipelines and instrumentation, and build testing roadmap


Job Designation

Hybrid:
Employee divides their time between in-office and remote work. Access to an office location is required. (Frequency: Minimum 2 days per week; may vary by team but will be weekly in-office expectation)

Positions at DocuSign are assigned a job designation of either In Office, Hybrid or Remote and are specific to the role/job. Preferred job designations are not guaranteed when changing positions within DocuSign. DocuSign reserves the right to change a position's job designation depending on business needs and as permitted by local law.


What you bring

Basic
Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (Statistics, Finance, Math, CS, or related) with 8 years of relevant experience in customer behavior analytics or Advanced Degree in a quantitative field with 6 years of relevant experience
5+ years of SQL skills with excellent hands-on exposure to creating complex queries across multiple database schemas
3+ years hands-on experience with performance marketing analytics with a focus on SEO and SEM optimizations
Experience with SEO analytics tools such as Google Analytics, Google Search Console, BrightEdge, SEMRush etc. and familiar with SEO strategy and keyword research
3+ years hands-on experience in A/B testing and experimentation with history of arriving at conclusive results
Experience with Statistics concepts and analysis, e.g., hypothesis testing, regression, experimental design, etc.
3+ years of experience creating data visualization dashboards in Tableau, Qlik, or equivalent
Experience with Python/R programming skills, knowledge of basic statistical modeling such as regression
Experience applying both qualitative and quantitative analysis techniques
Experience with spreadsheet modeling including pivot tables and complex formulas

Preferred
Excellent communication and presentation skills with the ability to communicate complex data analysis, insights, and recommendations to senior leadership
Comfortable with loosely defined requirements where you exercise your analytical skills to collaborate with the rest of the team to build solutions
Knowledge and hands-on experience with statistical testing such as A/B, multivariate, and Bayesian testing
Experience optimizing digital experiences to achieve world class conversion rates
Good familiarity with the principles of data science and data engineering
Attention to detail with focus on data quality, data consistency and criticality
Advanced data analysis skills – e.g., database query construction, data warehousing, forecasting, data mining and experience in business analysis
Exposure to big data platforms – Snowflake, Redshift, Azure, Matillion, Alteryx, etc.

California: $130,500 - $208,050 base salary

Illinois and Colorado: $123,700 - $174,700 base salary

Washington and New York (including NYC metro area): $123,700 - $184,275 base salary

This role is also eligible for bonus, equity and
benefits.

Global benefits provide options for the following:

Paid Time Off: earned time off, as well as paid company holidays based on region
Paid Parental Leave: take up to six months off with your child after birth, adoption or foster care placement
Full Health Benefits Plans: options for 100% employer paid and minimum employee contribution health plans from day one of employment
Retirement Plans: select retirement and pension programs with potential for employer contributions
Learning and Development: options for coaching, online courses and education reimbursements
Compassionate Care Leave: paid time off following the loss of a loved one and other life-changing events


Life at DocuSign

Working here
DocuSign is committed to building trust and making the world more agreeable for our employees, customers and the communities in which we live and work. You can count on us to listen, be honest, and try our best to do what’s right, every day. At DocuSign, everything is equal.

We each have a responsibility to ensure every team member has an equal opportunity to succeed, to be heard, to exchange ideas openly, to build lasting relationships, and to do the work of their life. Best of all, you will be able to feel deep pride in the work you do, because your contribution helps us make the world better than we found it. And for that, you’ll be loved by us, our customers, and the world in which we live.

Accommodation

If you experience any technical difficulties or issues during the application process, or with our interview tools, please reach out to us at taops@docusign.com for assistance.

Rate: $65,000 annually
Job Summary:
Directly supervises the Graphic Designer, and the Junior Marketing Analyst. Oversees the strategic and operating activities for Database Marketing, Advertising and Marketing Analytics. Provides analytical support for all Marketing departments and has primary responsibility for near- and long-term plans for the Harrah’s Northern California property. Designs and prepares ongoing and ad-hoc analytical projects. Responsible for the creation of direct mail offers and the back-end analysis associated with those offers including standard corporate reporting and ad-hoc analysis.
Qualifications:
Required proficiency with Excel, Access, Word, and PowerPoint with ability to train quickly in other software programs.
Must have excellent written, oral and presentation skills.
Must have outstanding math, critical thinking, statistical, financial, and analytical skills.

Overview:
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Marketing Analyst with expertise in Owned Channels and Lifecycle Marketing, cross channel measurement across lifecycle of customers and their journies, and audience measurement. As a key member of our marketing team, you will be responsible for driving data-driven insights and recommendations to optimize our marketing strategies and enhance customer acquisition and retention efforts. The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical mindset, a deep understanding of marketing analytics, and the ability to work collaboratively across teams.
The position will collaborate with Leadership to develop strategies, tactics and initiatives to help Western and Spouthern and Gerber Life successfully grow and retain customers and its premium stream in an economically viable manner. While promoting efficient growth, the person will oversee the allocation of the Marketing budget across a variety of products, campaigns and audiences. The person must love numbers.
Responsibilities:
Join our Customer Lifecycle Marketing Analytics team in order to help us develop new methods and strategies to enhance the relationship we have with our customers
This person will be responsible for supporting the development of lifecycle marketing strategies, building personalized propensity models, as well as communicating performance and recommendations to C-suite audiences
This role will learn new measurement methods in customer strategy using our platforms like Google Cloud Platform and Salesforce.
This is a high visibility/high impact role which will be supporting the Marketing department’s direction, along with company level goals & metrics
Support the design of the customer engagement and lifecycle strategy to increase engagement and loyalty of our Members, including multi-product adoption, payments, and multi-channel communications
Build credibility and rapport via strong analytical conclusions with cross-functional partners to help drive Member-focused change across all touchpoints
Create and socialize impactful business recommendations by combining analytical problem solving and strategic storytelling skills
Strong time management skills, to ensure timely completion of project milestones while keeping stakeholders informed
Help design, launch, and analyze omni-channel communication (email, SMS, DM, push notifications, contact center) experiments and support scaling them into mature campaigns
Support ongoing analysis of business and marketing performance required to inform company level decisions on a regular basis
Support the development, and maintain the reporting, dashboards, analysis and models to hit KPIs
Leverage strong analytical capabilities to solve non-routine problems
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in marketing, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or a related field. A master’s degree is preferred.
Proven experience (3 years) working in marketing analytics or a similar role, preferably in a fast-paced, data-driven environment.
Strong expertise in developing and implementing Lifetime Value (LTV) models, customer segmentation, and customer lifetime behavior analysis.
Proficiency in statistical analysis tools and programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL.
Demonstrated experience working with marketing analytics platforms, web analytics tools, and data visualization tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Tableau, Power BI).
Solid understanding of digital marketing channels, attribution models, and audience measurement methodologies.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to work with large datasets and derive actionable insights.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively convey complex analytical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail.
Ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a cross-functional team environment.
A passion for staying ahead of industry trends and leveraging new technologies and methodologies to drive marketing success.

Work Setting:

This position works in an office setting and remains in a stationary position for long periods of time while working at a desk, on a computer or with other standard office equipment, or while in meetings.
Position requires substantial movement of wrist, hands and fingers for continuous computer work.

Educational Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Economics, Finance or Business Administration.
Advanced degree in Analytics, Finance or MBA preferred.
3 years of experience within Insurance or Financial Services industry or withing Marketing analytics
Interested in Marketing

Computer Skills and Knowledge of Hardware & Software Required:

Advanced Excel skills
Intermediate/advanced PowerPoint skills
Strong quantitative and communication skills
Must code in SQL and Python
Proficient in new technology and/or data visualization platforms such as Power BI, Tableau, etc.
Proficient in accessing data through Salesforce, DataMart, Google Cloud Platform(GCP), database, or Google Analytics (GA4)
Familiarity with Cognos is a plus

Certifications & Licenses (i.e., Series 6 & 63, CPA, etc.):

NA

Position Demands:

Extended hours required during the peak planning period (fall) or during special/ad hoc projects
Some travel required
Highly organized with an adherence to deadlines and commitments
Ability to provide insight and direction to colleagues that do not possess similar skill sets

Track and measure the impact of data-driven decisions on marketing performance.

Conduct market research to identify new opportunities and target audiences.
Contribute to the development of data-driven marketing strategies based on market insights.

Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Salesforce, Google Analytics, Site Improve, A/B testing etc..).

Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Excellent Problem-solving and critical thinking skills.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy.

Personal value system that includes the highest standards of honesty, confidentiality, integrity, loyalty, and professional ethics reflective of the ability to succeed in building and maintaining positive relationships with the community.

Job Summary
Responsible for performing and supporting the marketing database analysis of all sections of Meskwaki Bingo Casino Hotel including development, coordination, implementation and directing all aspects and activities of marketing database ranging from maintenance of direct mail operations, extracting mail lists, detailed segmentation and ROI analysis for all segments, direct mail, and casino loyalty programs.
Essential Job Duties
Extract data, perform analyses, and create reports; summarize data and provide findings and conclusions including ROI and recommendations to increase ROI.
Design and development of all database analytics and compile pro and post analysis for all marketing campaigns and special events.
Provide monthly/quarterly/annual analysis for all direct mail programs.
Responsible to maintain, update and monitor the patron database and develop guidelines for key entry and file maintenance within the casino management system (CMS).
Assist with the coordination, planning, development, and execution of direct marketing programs with the Marketing Director.
Coordinate the database marketing requests and fulfillment of trackable offer campaigns related to, but not limited to, advertising, events, promotions, entertainment, and sponsorships through all direct response marketing mediums.
Maintain a calendar of all scheduled direct mail programs and ensure timelines are met.
Responsible for setting up all marketing offers, ensuring accuracy, and testing configurations.
Assist with establishing operating procedures to track and monitor individual campaigns to identify responders and ensure data relative to their gaming activity is tracked and reported.
Maintain on-going communications with MIS department for maintaining databases and extracting appropriate reporting data.
Make recommendations on database selections to ensure profitable mail campaigns.
Protect the integrity of the company database by ensuring all data control procedures are followed.
Assist with setting parameters and entry of Club Meskwaki members loyalty free play and other offers. Ensure all amounts are entered correctly and on a timely basis.
Communicate and network effectively with staff, other departments, and outside representatives to maintain a productive and effective department operation.
Safeguard and account for the assets of the owners.
Comply with policies and procedures required by the department, the company, the Meskwaki Gaming Commission, and the National Indian Gaming Commission.
Monitor the casino environment and follow established safety procedures to provide for the safety of guests and co-workers.
Work respectfully and effectively as part of the company team to ensure guest satisfaction, asset protection, and co-worker respect.
Must have the ability to maintain strict confidentiality relative to financial, casino and player data, policies, and marketing plans.
Must meet tight deadlines and handle multiple tasks / databases / projects simultaneously.
Maintain regular and dependable attendance, work any day of the week and any shift as required in professional attire, display a high level of personal hygiene, and follow personal appearance standards.
Supplemental Job Duties
Assist in the creation of an annual direct mail marketing plan and budget in accordance with Meskwaki guidelines.
Stay within budget and communicate variances during monthly reviews with the Director of Marketing.
To foster teamwork, all Marketing team members are required to provide positive support of all co-workers, management, guests, and the company daily.
Attends all required meetings and training sessions.
Performs other job-related duties as assigned.
Physical Requirements/Working Conditions:
Ability to maneuver in all areas of casino, ascent/descent from stairs, frequent standing, walking, sitting, reaching, stooping, kneeling, or crouching, and/or prolonged periods of time focusing on tasks. Ability to lift at least 25 lbs. May regularly need to lift/ move, push or pull up material or boxes necessary to the job functions, with or without assistance. Be able to work in a smoking environment with loud and continual noise levels for extended periods of time.
Specific vision ability includes close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, and depth perception. Visual acuity to discern and examine text, graphics, color, and symmetry. Speech to communicate clearly, express ideas and convey information in an understandable manner. Ability to hear for listening comprehension and to understand ideas presented through spoken words and sentences. Manual dexterity to operate office or required equipment and examine or update documents, records, data, instructions, logs, and files.
Social perceptiveness to assess and understand other’s reactions and behavior. Critical thinking to use logic and reasoning, reach conclusions/solutions. Comprehension in assessing, analyzing, and processing alpha, numeric, and visual data and completing required tasks or documents accurately. Ability to tolerate stress and conduct tasks under critical deadlines. Ability to concentrate on tasks over a period of time without being distracted.
Minimum Job Qualifications:
Knowledge/Education/Work Experiences (required unless stated otherwise):
Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Data Science, Business, or related field.
(Six (6) years of progressive casino marketing experience may be substituted for education requirement.)
Two (2) years of progressive casino marketing or related field experience.
Must have one (1) year of year of demonstrable casino/marketing analysis work, producing high level reports and recommendations.
Advanced demonstrable knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, and Access, SQL or other data analysis/reporting tools required.
Oasis Super Playmate and/or other casino player tracking experience preferred.
Must be 21 years of age or older.
Must be able to obtain and maintain a gaming license through the Sac & Fox Gaming Commission.
Valid Iowa Driver license and be insurable under MBCH’s policy.
High School Diploma/GED
Supervisory Responsibilities:
Not Applicable
Skills/Abilities:
Good oral and written English communication skills.
Ability to interact and respond calmly in various situations with co-workers, guests, and vendors.
Provide departmental support and guidance to ensure the marketing team’s success.
Serve as an inspirational leader for team members while fostering teamwork, positive morale, motivation, and open communications.
Must be highly organized and effectively manage time and be able to perform multiple tasks simultaneously. Re-prioritize tactics and strategies to achieve goals and objectives in dynamic market conditions.
Must be able to work any day of the week and any shift with little to no supervision.
Strong oral and written communication skills including public speaking.
Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals.
Must be able to read, write, and speak English. Ability to read, write, and speak Spanish a plus.
Must be able to meet all internal training, professional development, and education requirements.
Must have well-developed financial analysis and management skills.
Native American Preference: Members of the Meskwaki Nation and other Native American Tribes who are qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will be given preference in accordance to established procedures.

Team Members may be Club Meskwaki members and remain eligible for the benefits based on accruals but are prohibited from entering casino contests unless otherwise noted on the drawing, tournament, or contest guidelines.

Join this dynamic team focused on delivering better nutrition for every step of life’s journey

The Opportunity

Bring CPG brands to life at retail, at that very moment of truth when a consumer decides to buy or not to buy is what excites you then we have a great opportunity for you. Building brand awareness and reinforcing that mental and physical availability where it matters, at the point of purchase is what this role is all about. We have a portfolio of growing brands and strong distribution growth so there are lots of opportunities to do new things in new places. This position will report to the Shopper Marketing Manager.

Work collaboratively with Shopper Marketing Managers on the execution of programs, facilitating workflow for projects in development, ensuring timely approvals and production delivery.
Support Shopper Marketing Managers & Experiential Marketing Managers in tracking, pulling, and organizing data from internal and external sources across multiple sales channels & brands.

R esolve accounting discrepancies with the Finance department and external vendors.

manage an inventory of evergreen/ templated merchandising tools, always available for customer and experiential teams to use for tactical and ad-hoc needs
Pull redemption monthly across all brands to share with finance and shopper managers.

Job Description

We are currently seeking a Marketing Analyst for our Risk and Identity Solutions team. As a Marketing Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in planning and executing marketing campaigns, crafting compelling marketing messages, and creating effective collateral.
Your role will involve a multifaceted approach to marketing, encompassing various channels including SEO, paid media, campaign planning, and email marketing. This role requires a dynamic individual who can understand our market and customer needs, and translate that understanding into impactful marketing strategies.
As part of our team, you will be at the forefront of our company's efforts to position our Risk and Identity Solutions effectively in the marketplace. If you are a versatile marketer with a passion for strategizing and implementing marketing campaigns, we would love to hear from you.
Essential Functions
Plan and execute marketing campaigns by setting objectives, identifying target audiences, and coordinating with other teams to launch campaigns.
Create compelling marketing messages and collateral to support strategic campaigns, product launches, and industry events, ensuring alignment with Visa's business and strategic goals.
Implement SEO and paid media strategies to increase visibility and attract new business.
Leverage data analytics to assess the effectiveness of marketing campaigns, making necessary adjustments to optimize performance.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless execution of marketing initiatives.
Prepare detailed campaign plans and reports to share across teams focusing on KPIs and strategic marketing objectives.
Stay ahead of the latest marketing trends and technologies, applying this knowledge to our marketing strategies.
This is a hybrid position. Hybrid employees can alternate time between both remote and office. Employees in hybrid roles are expected to work from the office 2-3 set days a week (determined by leadership/site), with a general guidepost of being in the office 50% or more of the time based on business needs.

Qualifications

2 or more years of work experience with a Bachelor’s Degree or an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD, or PhD)

Preferred Qualifications
3 or more years of work experience with a Bachelor’s Degree or more than 2 years of work experience with an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD)
Minimum 2 years of experience in B2B marketing or digital marketing, preferably in financial services, banking, or FinTech.
Proven experience in campaign development, management, and analysis.
Strong understanding of SEO and paid media strategies.
Experience in email marketing and campaign planning.
Strong market research and analysis skills, with the ability to interpret complex data and translate it into actionable strategies.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills for crafting compelling marketing messages.
Strong project management skills, with ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet deadlines.
Ability to work in a team and collaborate with other departments.
Experience in presenting key findings and marketing strategies to leadership and stakeholders. This includes the ability to effectively communicate complex data and information in a clear and concise manner.
Proficient in Microsoft Office tools and experience using marketing platforms and software (LinkedIn, Eloqua, Wrike, etc.)
Ability to adapt to changing circumstances and navigate through ambiguity.

StreamLabs, a wholly owned subsidiary of the Chubb Group, offers Internet of Things (IoT) enabled water monitoring, leak detection and water shut-off devices and systems. StreamLabs products, which use patented and proprietary ultrasonic technology, help individuals, families and businesses predict and prevent costly property damage before it occurs. Products are sold through contractors and plumbers in construction, repair, and remodeling, ecommerce sites and insurance companies and agencies.
StreamLabs is at a critical stage in their evolution, with a strong set of products and initial sales in B2C and B2B markets. Senior leadership is focused on driving significant revenue growth, with an emphasis on clearly identifying the 2-3 industry verticals where an investment in business development, sales and marketing is most likely to produce significant revenue quickly.
Job Description
In this paid externship assignment, a student externship team of four (4) students will work with StreamLabs under the guidance of experienced faculty consultants to conduct targeted research, including review of existing customer data, conduct secondary research and interview staff and clients/prospects to identify 2-3 industry verticals and critical leverage points where investment in outbound sales and marketing resources has the greatest probability to accelerate sales quickly. The goal is to recommend a prioritized list of focus areas and initiatives to the company's management.
The student team, which may include both undergraduate and graduate students currently enrolled in the Georgia State University J. Mack Robinson College of Business, will engage in a market assessment utilizing a Marketing framework, including:
Market Analysis
Customer Segmentation
Product Positioning
Messaging and Communication Channels
Competitor Analysis
Performance Metrics
Team Collaboration
This unique co-curricular program offers students a hands-on opportunity to gain practical, agile, and project-based work experience in a complex business environment.
Primary responsibilities
Market research & analysis
Conduct in-depth market research to identify industry trends, competitive landscapes, and target audience behaviors.
Analyze data and present findings to contribute to the development of informed marketing strategies.
Strategy formulation
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to create comprehensive marketing strategies aligned with organizational goals.
Contribute creative ideas and insights to enhance the effectiveness of marketing campaigns.
Campaign planning (time allowing)
Assist in the creation and execution of marketing campaigns across various channels, including digital media, social platforms, and traditional channels.
Monitor and analyze campaign performance metrics, providing recommendations for optimization.

About CPC
Colder Products Company (CPC), a Dover company, is the world’s leading provider of quick disconnect couplings, fittings and connectors for plastic tubing. Used in a broad range of industries and applications, the innovative coupling and connection technologies from CPC are advancing markets and improving the lives of people across the world. Founded in Minnesota in 1978, CPC is headquartered in Minneapolis-Saint Paul with operations in Germany and China, sales offices in 14 countries and more than 175 distributor partners around the globe.

Job Summary:
The Marketing Analyst is responsible for designing and conducting marketing and sales funnel measurement and analysis. This role will own the creation and reporting of monthly KPIs and dashboards, as well as perform analysis and build processes that ensure best practices in marketing performance. The Analyst will be responsible for analyzing campaign effectiveness, sales enablement, and lead and demand generation across paid media, CRM and website analytics. This role will then present findings, insights, and trends to key stakeholders across the company to inform strategic business decisions. The ability to tell the story with data to diverse audiences is important in this role, as is working in a fast-paced environment and managing multiple projects simultaneously.

Essential Job Responsibilities:
Build, develop, troubleshoot, and maintain various reports and dashboards utilizing Excel and Power BI.
Create weekly and monthly analytics, dashboards, and reports to track and communicate marketing and sales enablement performance.
Perform detailed analysis to support marketing initiatives (i.e. lead generation, ROI, brand awareness, etc.).
Identify trends and generate insights from CPC marketing and sales data to enhance marketing ROI and improve customer experience and loyalty.
Coordinate research insights including marketing industry reports, competitive brand intelligence, and various forms of primary research, including campaign testing.
Provide analysis for marketing forecasts and S&OP inputs.
Coordinate department and campaign budget development and reporting.
Develop customer and executive-ready presentations that tell the story behind the data; present analysis and findings to a variety of audiences.
Interact and manage use of non-CRM MarTech Stack for customer engagement & insights.
Contribute to customer acquisition strategy by participating in annual strategic and tactical planning processes.
Use proven and innovative analytic techniques to support marketing, measurement, and reporting efforts, including advising on campaign testing protocol.
Develop and maintain complex financial modeling tools and programs.
Effectively collaborate with cross-functional internal and external partners (Sales, Customer Service, CRM, Legal & Compliance, Finance, Agencies of Record) to generate effective insights and results.
Assist the technology team in designing applications that optimize marketing operations and enhance the scope of analysis.
Assist with project management for selected projects.
Adheres to all safety regulations.
Demonstrates support of CPC core values.
Performs other job duties as assigned to meet business needs.
Other duties as assigned.

Required Job Qualifications:
Strong analytical skills and proficiency with advanced expertise in Excel.
Proven ability to learn new software platforms, test new ideas and consider new marketing methodologies.
Precision and accuracy; attention to detail and self-motivated.
Ability to work collaboratively to investigate problems and resolve issues .
Flexible and adaptable.
Ability to work in a fast-paced and changeable environment, balancing multiple priorities and ensuring high-quality outcomes.
Strong business acumen.
Knowledge of Power BI, CRM, data extraction, and analysis.
Strong Microsoft Office experience.

Required Education and/or Experience:
5-10 years’ marketing operations or analytics experience.
Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Marketing or Business Administration.
Experience with B2B business model with two-step distribution and direct channels, a plus.

Travel Requirements:
Less than 5%

The physical demands are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
The employee must frequently lift from 10 up to a maximum of 30 pounds, depending on position. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands and fingers and talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to stand, walk and/or stoop.

Loomis Sayles is a performance-driven active asset management company that seeks to identify exceptional investment opportunities on behalf of institutional and retail clients worldwide. We believe active management fueled by proprietary, best-in-class research helps us achieve financial success for our clients. Founded in 1926, Loomis Sayles currently oversees approximately $310 billion in assets under management for global clients spanning more than 50 countries.

We foster a culture of entrepreneurialism, where all employees are empowered and encouraged to develop themselves and their ideas. Our culture centers on our shared IDEALS, the core characteristics of who we aspire to be as employees and an organization.

INCLUSIVE & DIVERSE-DEDICATED TO TEAMWORK–EXCELLENT–ACCOUNTABLE–LEADERS-SOLUTION-ORIENTED

Loomis Sayles is committed to the continual improvement of our performance, processes and people. As part of this commitment, we are looking to hire an enthusiastic and passionate candidate, eager to contribute to our continued success through the following employment opportunity:

About the Role
The Senior Marketing Analyst will play a pivotal role in handling and completing day-to-day responsibilities with minimal guidance from the manager. The senior analyst will focus on ensuring accurate and timely database updates are made by collaborating with our database service provider, eVestment, and their OMNI team. The Senior Marketing Analyst uses various tools to generate data reports, troubleshoot database / Omni-related issues, and contribute to process improvement. The ideal candidate will exhibit strong attention to detail, the ability to learn and adapt quickly, a natural curiosity and a proactive, positive, can-do attitude.

About the Team
The Global Marketing Database Management team is an essential component of the global marketing group. The team is dedicated to the comprehensive management and distribution of a broad spectrum of qualitative and quantitative data about Loomis Sayles and its products. This data encompasses a growing portfolio of our company’s investment products and vehicles and spans all asset classes.

Our team is comprised of a group of skilled analysts who function as the primary interface for all database-related inquiries. Our analysts bring a wealth of expertise and knowledge, ensuring that we can efficiently handle a wide range of tasks and effectively collaborate with various internal groups and external parties. Our role extends beyond data management to include client servicing, unearthing new business opportunities, and providing solutions for data-related issues and improvements.

Our commitment to excellence ensures the highest standards of accuracy and reliability in our database management. Our work provides the foundation for effective product marketing in the growing marketing database space as well as successful engagement with institutional investors and investment consultants worldwide.

Job Responsibilities

Coordinate updates with the OMNI Evestment team, monitor monthly and quarterly update progress, using programming tools for report generation and ensuring timely updates across all of the marketing databases.
Leverage database tools (eVestment, Morningstar, and Consultant databases, etc) to enable screening analysis and to inform stakeholders on investment and product updates
Troubleshoot and resolve database / Omni-related issues focusing on data management and delivery
Keep both internal teams and external parties informed about database update progress.
Assist in process improvement and implementation. Work closely with the Omni and internal technology teams to identify process inefficiencies and develop solutions.
Maintain the integrity of marketing database information, ensuring accuracy and correcting discrepancies, as needed.
Assist with team projects and initiatives, contributing to the overall success of the Global
Qualifications & Education Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Analytics, Information Technology, Data Science, Marketing, Business Administration, Finance, or a related field.
A minimum of 5-8 years of experience in the investment or financial services industry.
Demonstrated excellent knowledge of investment industry terminology and concepts.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, including Excel, PowerPoint, and Word, and knowledge of VBA, R, and Python programming
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Exceptional attention to detail and commitment to accuracy.
Strong organizational and prioritization skills, with the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
Proven ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Company Description
Stratas Foods LLC is the leading supplier of fats and oils to the Foodservice, Food Ingredients and Retail Private Label markets in North America and is a producer of quality bulk and packaged dressings, mayonnaise and sauces. Stratas Foods was formed in October 2008 as a 50/50 joint venture between ACH Food Companies (ACH) and Archer Daniels Midland (ADM).
Manufacturing facilities are located in Dallas and Houston, TX; Decatur and Quincy, IL; Englewood, NJ; Fresno, CA; Nashville, TN; and Valdosta, GA. Corporate offices are located in Memphis, TN. We are committed to maintaining a progressive workplace by utilizing the ideas, skills and talents of all of our employees. We strive to make Stratas Foods a great place to work and are building a team capable of meeting our business goals.
*
Job Description*
This position is a member of the Corporate Marketing Team reporting to the Sr. Director of Marketing & Business Development. The Marketing Analyst is a team lead owning managerial execution of three key areas: Salesforce, GDSN platforms and Sales Team Reporting & Analytics. Role requires working closely with sales teams and key customers to provide data & insights continually improving our processes allowing our organization to sell more effectively and drive long-term growth. Data synchronization and accuracy of these three key areas across company platforms such as Infor M3, Optiva and Blacksmith will require software intuition, strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
Lead sales teams as the Salesforce subject matter expert, offering continuous training and support. Drive deeper into Salesforce functionality using Trailhead and other training resources.
Develop and maintain comprehensive dashboards, reports, and metrics within Salesforce to facilitate effective sales governance and performance monitoring.
Proactively explore and utilize Salesforce functionalities to optimize user experience and operational efficiency.
Collaborate closely with the sales team to identify and resolve technical issues, assessing the need for external consultant involvement and managing related costs accordingly.
Lead and manage GSDN platforms with accurate publication of product information and images to data pools like 1WorldSync and Syndigo.
Ensure high compliance scores on customer GSDN portals to avoid penalties by regularly updating and maintaining product attributes and images.
Produce, analyze and distribute monthly reports requirements. Report examples include sales team dashboards to marketing asset inventories to financial reports.
Ownership of master data integrity including attributes and hierarchies at both customer and product level tying back to general ledger reconciliation and cross-departmental alignments through OVOT initiative.
Utilize a data-driven approach to evaluate the outcomes of marketing and sales campaigns, develop key performance indicators (KPIs), and refine future strategies.
Analyze market, territory and business trends that drive stronger performance and help manage the effectiveness of promotional activities directing strategic decision-making. Scope goes beyond traditional direct customers to include Buying Groups and Group Purchasing Organizations.
Support the accuracy and integrity of data migration projects within ERP systems, with a focus on customer and product information.
Ensure data consistency and completeness across all reporting metrics, including third-party indirect purchasing data.
Collaborate closely with onsite teams and participate in onsite meetings to drive departmental objectives.
Competencies
Strong interpersonal, verbal, written and presentation communication skills. Excellent planning and organization, project management and time management skills. Must be able to learn as well as train.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills evidenced by the ability to mine data, identify performance trends and mobilize key findings into actionable recommendations. Strong spreadsheet modeling skills are required.
Organizational Skills – Ensure projects are tracked and completed in a timely manner; Multi-tasking and various external and internal contacts will require strong organizational skills.
Ability to be respectful, approachable and team oriented while building strong working relationships and a positive work environment.
Retail Consumer Goods and/or Foodservice background. Sales experience a plus.
*
Qualifications**
Education: *Bachelor’s degree in a general business, marketing, finance or a related field required
*
Related Experience:*
5 years minimum experience in a Business support role.
3 – 5 years minimum experience as Salesforce.com Power-user creating dashboards, reports, and business analytics driving user enablement.
Must be able to handle diversity of tasks and manage them effectively.
*
Equipment/Software Skills:*
Highly proficient with Microsoft Office applications with a strong emphasis on Excel.
(Pivot Tables required / PowerBi a plus)
Experience preferred with GSDN platforms, Blacksmith and ERP Systems.
*
Certifications, Licenses, Registrations:*
Drivers License
*
Additional Information**
Physical: *Typing and manual dexterity required. Movement back and forth between printers and other office equipment. Must be comfortable sitting for long periods of time. Phone dialogue is required.
Sensory: Heavy telephone and email volume. Must have excellent diction to respond to call and excellent hearing in order to understand and respond to issues or request. Must have excellent written and verbal communications skills.
Mental/Reasoning:
Excellent oral and written communication skills. Good organizational skills with strong discipline and work ethic. Ability to multi task and work under pressure while managing obstacles such as time constraints and prioritize work load appropriately. Must work well with others under little supervision. Ability to rationalize and analyze results and make appropriate business decisions.

Active International seeks a Product Discovery & Marketing Analyst to join our Product Innovation team. This role is pivotal in bringing new and innovative Corporate Trade and Media solutions to the marketplace. The ideal candidate will have 2-5 years of experience in marketing technology products, with a strong focus on leveraging Data Science, AI, and cloud technologies. The Product Marketer will play a key role in validating, developing, and testing product ideas, significantly contributing to reducing the cost and time to market for our products.
Active International is a global leader in corporate trade and media buying, renowned for its creative solutions that assist clients in achieving their financial goals. At the core of our business lies the commitment to delivering efficient audience reach through a variety of offline and digital media channels. We embrace the power of data, technology, and AI to revolutionize how media buys are sourced, selected, and activated. In recent years, we have developed several innovative solutions that utilize data, technology, and analytics, providing a superior approach to media buying. Our success is built on collaborations with external consultancies, and we are dedicated to continuously enhancing our offerings. The Product Innovation team, where Product Discovery & Marketing Analyst will be positioned, plays a crucial role in this endeavor, focusing on the rapid prototyping of new technology solutions. These efforts are geared towards driving top-line growth and ensuring alignment with Active’s dynamic market position and future-oriented strategies.

Responsibilities:
Market Research and Product Discovery: Conduct in-depth market research to identify emerging trends and customer needs. Analyze market data to uncover opportunities for product innovation in corporate trade and media solutions.
Marketing Analysis: Perform detailed analysis of market trends, customer feedback, and competitive landscape to inform marketing strategies and product development.
Product Performance Evaluation: Assess the performance of new products and gather customer feedback, using insights to inform future product iterations and marketing campaigns.
Collaboration with Product Development: Work closely with the product development team to integrate market insights into the product development process.
Innovative Validation Techniques: Employ creative approaches to validate and test product ideas, minimizing risk and optimizing market fit.

Technical and Analytical Skills:
Digital Marketing Tools Proficiency: In-depth knowledge of digital marketing tools and platforms, such as Google Analytics, social media advertising platforms, and SEO tools, to execute and track the effectiveness of online marketing campaigns.
A/B Testing and Hypothesis Selection: Expertise in conducting A/B testing to optimize marketing campaigns and product features. Ability to formulate and test hypotheses based on market data and user feedback, using results to inform marketing strategies and product improvements.
Innovative Validation Techniques: Creative thinking and problem-solving skills in validating and testing product ideas. Utilizing out-of-the-box methods and marketing techniques to minimize risk and cost while maximizing the potential of new product features and updates.
Understanding of AI and Cloud Technologies: Familiarity with the basics of Data Science, AI, and cloud technologies, and how they can be leveraged in marketing innovative products.
Product Management Software: Knowledge of product management tools (e.g., JIRA, Asana) for coordinating with the product development team.
Innovation Methodologies: Understanding of innovation frameworks and how they can be applied in product marketing processes.
Analytical Thinking: Strong analytical skills, with the ability to interpret complex data and make informed marketing decisions.
Data Analysis and Interpretation: Proficiency in using data analysis tools and methodologies to guide marketing strategies and understand market trends.
Market Research: Skills in conducting market research and competitive analysis specific to technology-driven products.
Technical Communication: Ability to effectively communicate technical concepts and product features to both technical and non-technical audiences.

The salary range for this position is $78,500-90,000. The successful candidate’s salary will depend on actual ranges of current employees in the subject position, market considerations, budgetary considerations, geography, as well as the candidate’s skill set, level of experience, and qualifications. Active offers a very competitive benefits package inclusive of medical coverage, dental, vision, disability, 401k, paid time off, community engagement opportunities, great colleagues, and great learning opportunities.

Unfortunately, we are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of an employment Visa at this time.

Qualifications:
2-5 years of experience in product marketing, market analysis, or a related field.
Strong background in product discovery and marketing analysis, preferably in technology-driven solutions.
Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, Technology, or related field. Advanced degree or relevant certification preferred.

Location:
Pearl River, NY, with occasional travel required.

The Marketing Analyst will be responsible for building executive level analysis; providing business analytics and insights; category, brand, competitive, channel and customer performance reviews, pricing and promotional strategy analysis; and forecasting sales associated with brands, customers, products, and/or sales channels/categories. This is achieved by creating and maintaining monthly reporting and projection models for products and customers, incorporating business intelligence and forecast information gathered from sales reporting, marketing metrics, ecommerce platform reporting, and syndicated market data. This role is part of the marketing department and will directly support the brand management, digital merchandising, and loyalty marketing teams and work cross functionally with all departments including finance, category management and information services. Ideal candidate is someone who enjoys the adventure of clue hunting through data and digging below the surface to identify core drivers and translate into action.
Our ideal candidate lives in the Billings, Montana area and is willing to come on-site 5 days a week.
Essential Duties:
Design and generate weekly and monthly reports based on category and brand performance, historical sales, market trends, seasonality, and promotions to support decision-making
Measure and identify optimization opportunities with direct to customer digital merchandising, as well as within the ecommerce platform.
Serve as a subject matter expert to develop Power BI Dashboards for the team in alignment with sales and marketing objectives and initiatives
Track and merchandise NPD customer segment and product category data to marketing, sales and category management leadership in an effort to mine for opportunity areas.
Perform both product and customer segmentation analysis to determine appropriate focus areas
Develop marketing models to determine the impact of marketing and promotions.
Identify key insights for future marketing initiatives based on analytics and reporting
Support upper management and executives in building robust and credible presentations and data visualizations for senior level meetings
Support sales team and manager with key customer presentations
Identify and develop process improvements to enhance efficiencies and improve profitability
Lead internal training and education sessions as needed to support the use of analytics with the marketing team
Other duties may be assigned
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in data analytics, data science, statistics, information systems, supply chain, finance or highly analytical field preferred
3-5 years of experience working with statistical data modeling or related data visualization; can be an equivalent combination of education and experience
Expert on Excel, experience in various mathematical and statistical functions, Vlookups, Pivot Tables, and Macros
Proficient in Microsoft Office (Power Point, Outlook, Word)
Experience with IRI or Nielsen preferred
Demonstrated expertise working with big data and visualization tools including PowerBI
Proficient in DAX/DAX 365
Intermediate to advanced MS SQL experience
Strong ability and desire to work both independently and cross-functionally across multiple departments
Ability to think fast and react in a fast paced, results driven environment
Excellent interpersonal, communication, presentation and relationship building skills
Must have the ability to self-manage workload and handle multiple tasks and work with employees at all levels of the organization
Must be flexible and willing to work the demands of the department which may be subject to evenings, weekends, and holidays.

Windstream Holdings, Inc., is a leading provider of advanced network communications and technology solutions for consumers, small businesses, enterprise organizations and carrier partners across the U.S.

As Kinetic, Windstream offers bundled services, including premium broadband, security solutions, voice, and digital TV to consumers through an enhanced fiber network.
Windstream Enterprise is a leading managed services provider providing strategic communications and security products to mid-size businesses and enterprise clients.
Windstream Wholesale provides high-capacity, high-performance networking solutions and services to other telecom carriers, data centers, content providers and enterprises.
The Windstream team provides innovative software and network solutions to connect people and empower business in a world of infinite possibilities!

_________________________________________________________

Purpose:
Serve as the strategic marketing lead within the region by identifying areas of opportunity to promote Kinetic, establish community partnerships and launch marketing campaigns that resonate at the local level. In addition, facilitate the collaboration between local sales, marketing, and operations teams to ensure Kinetic brand awareness and growth in the respective geographies. Enable real time input and feedback with the Headquarters Marketing teams to leverage resources.

Responsibilities:
Attend Regional President’s Staff Meetings to learn, share & update on Marketing activities as well as network build status
Provide local insights into strategic marketing efforts and campaigns, aligning efforts with prioritized markets and Fiber build plans
Attend appropriate calls to share Regional plans and understand upcoming activities providing feedback & guidance
Work closely with Regional VP of State and Government Affairs to elevate opportunities to create brand awareness and participate in relevant local networking opportunities
Identify key events and marketing vehicles to participate in within the region that support a “hyper-local” mindset
Facilitate annual planning for the Region on
Which events to participate in & why based on infrastructure, demographics, growth opportunities, competition, government insights, etc.
Understand and track budget availability and spend and review with Sales Leaders and Regional President if there are limitations or concerns
Validate direction with Field Operations Directors to ensure network readiness
Coordinate with Local G2M Marketing Analyst to articulate the event objectives that will guide building underlying support plans based on event type and location.
Coordinate tight execution of events and activities with the actual accountability residing with the participating sales channels
Measure ROI of all activities in the region including but not limited to sales/branding events, sponsorships, chamber memberships, etc. and using that measured ROI to make strategic involvement decisions.
Ensure sales teams are working closely with field operations counterparts and technicians to understand the network status within their territory
Serve as point of contact for regional chamber memberships; this includes billing, connecting internal representatives, as well as identifying chamber events that leverage maximin exposure for local team members and the Kinetic brand.

Job Title: Jr. Web Marketing Specialist - Strategy Track
Job Description:
We're WebFX, a full-service digital marketing agency based in the US that's been named one of the Best Places To Work! We are a fast-growing company that has doubled in size over the past 5 years, with talented team members now based around the globe (and representing 18+ different countries!). While we are growing at a rapid rate, we are committed to growing strategically and sustainably, and that starts with growing our team of the #BestCoworkers - that’s where you come in!

We're looking for people to join our mission to provide world-class digital marketing solutions to mid-size businesses around the world. We are passionate about what we do, we’re committed to driving business growth for our clients, and we’re on the hunt for people just like you, who take pride in their work and want to be part of a company that does too.

We have a multi-step interview process, where we focus on giving both our candidates, and ourselves, opportunities to get to know each other a bit better. While our process may be more thorough and perhaps longer than other interview processes that you've been a part of, our goal is to work together with our candidates to find a mutually beneficial fit, where a candidate is a great addition to the FXFamily, and WebFX is the right fit for their career goals. Interested in joining the FXFamily? More info below!

Learn more about our Ft Myers location here!

You Might Be a Great Fit For This Position if You Have…

A Bachelor’s Degree
Successful FXers in this role have majored in Marketing, Advertising, Business, Journalism, Communications, Information Systems, Statistics, and beyond
GPA of 3.4

A Few Related Skills and Experiences
(This is an entry-level role, and experience in every one of these areas is not required - we will train you on what you need to know! But the following skills/experience are awesome to have, and will help get your career off to a running start):

Part-time/summer job/internship experience is a must
Customer service experience in any industry
Advertising/marketing agency experience
Digital marketing experience
Basic HTML experience
Google Analytics and/or analytical/research skills
Excel/Google Docs skills
Copywriting for the web

Any of these Signature FXer Traits!
You have an interest in the web and stay up-to-date on new and developing technologies
You are a professional, dependable, and independent worker with a strong work ethic
You’re self-motivated, thrive on challenges, and enjoy getting things done
You have an eye for detail and dedication to high-quality work
You have an exceptional level of follow-through
You are a proactive, creative problem-solver who faces challenges with a can-do mindset
You possess excellent time/project management skills
You have solid analytical skills and a knack for making data-driven decisions
You work with a sense of urgency and can consistently meet deadlines
You are an outstanding communicator and possess strong interpersonal skills
You are a lifelong learner who loves to grow and stretch outside of your comfort zone, and are always looking to improve your skills

If any of these sound like you, then we want to hear from you! We are committed to growing 1% better everyday, and we believe working at WebFX could quite possibly make your life 1(00)% better - after all, you would be surrounded by the #BestCoworkersinPA!

In This Role, You’ll Get To…

Partner with senior digital marketers and support some of our largest campaigns and client accounts
Analyze performance data (in Google Analytics and MarketingCloudFX) and prepare monthly digital marketing campaign reports
Develop appropriate SEO strategies and action plans/optimizations based on data
Manage large PPC (think Google Ads!) campaigns and budgets and work to ensure a positive ROI for clients
-Perform research to ensure client success - think keyword research to competitor analysis, and everything in between
Devise the content strategy and outlines for our team of copywriters and manage the execution of web content based on client needs and preferences
Manage the ideation, planning, and execution efforts of CRO special projects and champion CRO best practices for clients
Perform A/B, website usability, and website conversion rate testing to determine what works best for your client and provide recommendations accordingly
Interpret web analytics, demographic data, market research, and buyer behaviors, and generate and execute strategies as they relate to findings
Manage the planning and execution of email marketing campaigns
Optimize web content for keywords related to client products and services
'Get your hands dirty’ and get into the backend of client websites to correct errors and technical issues and implement content

A Typical ‘Day in the Life’ Might Consist of:
5% managing resources for CRO projects
5% analyzing clients’ competitors and making appropriate recommendations
10% working in the backend of websites/fixing technical issues/implementing content
10% creating reports for client campaigns
15% analyzing data and identifying deliverables
25% creating and managing overall client strategy
30% executing on SEO and PPC strategies with regular optimizations
100% pursuing your own personal best while delivering real-world impact for our clients!
Note: The Jr. Web Marketing Specialist - Strategy Track is not a client-facing position

What You’ll Get From Us!

Opportunities to Learn and Train With Our Team!
Our “Bootcamp” training program will be provided for new FXers to learn, grow and develop both in and out of the office in the specific hard skills necessary to be successful in their position
World-class on-the-job training from the experts (think Sr. Marketers, not the HR team) as well as opportunities for ongoing personal learning and development
On-site, state-of-the-art training amenities to facilitate departmental trainings, industry-related updates, and monthly Lunch-and-Learns.

A Place to Grow Your Career
WebFX grew 250%+ over the past 3 years, and we promote almost exclusively internally. Merit-based promotional opportunities are abundant for new FXers who meet or exceed position performance metrics.

In-Person Experience Alongside Our Team of Industry Experts
This position is based fully on-site at our office in Fort Myers, FL, with opportunities for this to evolve as Fxers advance in their career tenure.

Digital Marketing Consultant

Sr. Internet Marketing Consultant

The Business Marketing Group (BMG) team connects businesses with their customers on Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp, and Messenger to help them grow their businesses through solutions like pages, advertising, messaging, commerce and more. We succeed when we help our customers grow their business leveraging our solutions.The Marketing Audiences and Measurement team sits within the Growth Marketing Operations team, helping realize the vision and strategy of marketers by designing and building audiences and measuring performance of marketing campaigns and initiatives. Besides marketing execution, the team partners closely with Growth Marketing to identify areas of opportunities for marketing.We are searching for a Marketing Analyst who will enable the execution of marketing campaigns to deliver lead generation, and self-service recommendations to advertisers. This includes responsibility for marketing campaign analytics execution (from target audience identification, opportunity sizing, audience creation, performance readouts and debugging), running experiments, and delivering actionable campaign insights.To succeed in this role, this analyst will need a data driven mind-set with strong communication skills to work across technical and non-technical audiences and prior experience in marketing analytics.


Marketing Analyst Responsibilities:
Design, analysis, and interpretation of projects from data requirement gathering to data processing, modeling, and recommendations
Audience identification, and opportunity sizing for all channel marketing campaigns
Build and maintain marketing signals and channel marketing triggers (logic which identifies when we send a particular email to a particular customer)
Debug, triage, and identify the right team to resolve the issues
Perform campaign performance analysis and create readouts (such as marketing metric performance, and success of the campaign)
Identify opportunities for improvement through automation, streamlining processes and reducing campaign issues leveraging technology



Minimum Qualifications:
5+ years of experience in an analytics role, business strategy, marketing, finance, engineering, or equivalent
Experience leveraging data to deliver business value and present data-driven insights to business audiences
Experience analyzing large, multi-dimensional data sets and synthesizing insights into actionable solutions using advanced SQL skills
Communication and collaboration skills to engage with multiple technical and non-technical stakeholders and different teams to deliver solutions efficiently
Data driven with degree in quantitative discipline like Math, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Physics, Engineering, Operations Research or equivalent
Result-oriented self-starter with ambiguity, experience initiating and driving projects
Experience building cross functional relationships across a variety of functions to launch projects that drive business value



Preferred Qualifications:
Experience working within the small business landscape and/or online marketing and advertising
Experience working with or in support of diverse communities
Experience with data analysis and statistical modeling using the R or Python ecosystems, with packages such as pandas, statsmodels, scikit-learn, tidyverse (dplyr, ggplot2, etc.)
Experience shipping code into production and writing testable modular code

Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.
